title: Executive Assistant (WCL)
description:
We are seeking a highly organized and strategic Executive Assistant to support our CEO. This role goes beyond traditional administrative support, requiring a proactive partner who can anticipate needs, manage priorities, and help the CEO operate at maximum efficiency. The ideal candidate will be someone who thinks strategically, is highly detail-oriented, and possesses the foresight to manage time and resources effectively. This person will be a key confidante for the CEO, handling
, calendar management, coordination of personal and professional activities, and serving as a reliable buffer to create valuable time for the CEO.



Core Competencies:



-Strategic Thinking & Initiative: Ability to think several steps ahead and anticipate CEO needs.

-Dependability & Loyalty: Must be a highly reliable support, maintaining loyalty and discretion at all times.

-Organizational Excellence: Detail-oriented, organized, and consistent in managing priorities and information.

-Adaptability: Capable of adjusting to shifting priorities and complex scheduling needs.



Key Responsibilities:




 Management & Organization

Manage and streamline the CEO’s inbox for efficiency and accessibility.

Prioritize and highlight critical communications for the CEO’s attention.

Maintain a logical and intuitive
 organization system without overcomplicating folders.

Filter, delegate, and respond to routine
s to optimize workflow.



-Calendar Management & Strategic Planning

Oversee the CEO’s schedule, proactively resolving conflicts and planning ahead.

Monitor the calendar 2–3 weeks in advance to ensure readiness for key meetings and deadlines.

Coordinate meetings and events with internal and external stakeholders, aligned with priorities.



-Operational & Personal Coordination

Assist with professional and personal tasks, including travel and appointments.

Serve as a bridge between the CEO and the leadership team, handling non-critical communications.

Protect the CEO’s time and confidentiality with discretion and reliability.



-Project Support & Follow-Through

Coordinate timelines, resources, and progress tracking for CEO-led initiatives.

Prepare reports, presentations, and other materials for meetings.

Proactively identify and address areas where additional support may be needed.



-Proactive Task & Resource Management

Anticipate the CEO’s needs and implement solutions to manage workload and resources.

Organize and maintain accessible documents and files.

Act as a contact point to streamline requests for information or resources.



Key Qualifications:



-Proven experience (5+ years) as an Executive Assistant to a CEO or senior executive.

-Bachelor’s degree in Business, Communications, or related field (or equivalent experience).

-Highly organized with strong attention to detail and commitment to consistency.

-Demonstrated ability to manage
 and calendars with a proactive approach.

-Strong written and verbal communication skills.

-Discreet, trustworthy, and able to handle sensitive information with the highest confidentiality.

-Skilled in Microsoft Office Suite, Google Workspace, and other productivity tools.



Employment Type:

This role will begin as a part-time position, with the potential to transition into a full-time role as responsibilities and workload increase.



Note:

Send your resume here: 

Subject: Executive Assistant – [Your Name]

title: Home Care Recruiter
description:
About Us



At Helper Heroes, we’re on a mission to provide exceptional care and support to home care agencies in America. We believe in creating a true partnership where our employees act and feel like a true member of the American team they are matched with. Our goal is to help them create a compassionate, innovative, and efficient care experience for their clients and their families. To achieve this, we’re looking for a Helper Hero to join our team and help us shine even brighter!



About You



What sets us apart is YOU. You’re not just any virtual tea
mber—you’re a Helper Hero! If you’re passionate about making a difference, have a knack for organization, and thrive in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment, you’re who we are looking for. If you’re the kind of person who loves tackling behind-the-scenes tasks with a smile, ensuring that our clients' caregivers and clients receive the best possible support, apply today!



Job Overview



We are seeking a proactive, detail-oriented Recruiter to support recruitment, caregiver

onboarding, and administrative tasks for a growing home care business. This role is

ideal for someone with experience in healthcare recruitment and a passion for

streamlining operations. You will work closely with the owner to alleviate their workload,

enabling them to focus on business growth and client care.



Key Responsibilities



1. Recruitment & Onboarding:



- Manage end-to-end caregiver recruitment: screen applicants, schedule interviews, and coordinate orientation/training.

- Process onboarding documentation via ADP Workforce (e.g., electronic I-9s, employee handbook distribution).

- Track and ensure completion of state-mandated caregiver training (e.g.,via Active Insights).



2. Administrative Support



- Answer inbound calls during peak hours and manage voi
s/lead inquiries.

- Assist with client intake calls and referral source coordination.

- Provide general administrative support (e.g., scheduling, data entry).



3. Systems & Collaboration



- Utilize platforms like WellSky or Axiscare (training provided) to streamline workflows.

- Collaborate with the owner to refine processes and maintain organization.



Qualifications:



- Excellent written/verbal communication (fluent English).

- Strong organizational and time-management abilities.

- Proficiency with CRM systems,
 management, and cloud-based tools (e.g., Google Drive).

- Proactive mindset—anticipate needs before they arise.

- Proven experience in recruitment, preferably in healthcare or home care staffing.

- Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build rapport with candidates and tea
mbers.

- Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

- Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.

- Familiarity with recruitment platforms and CRM tools

- A positive attitude, sense of humor, and a passion for helping others.



Attributes of a Successful Helper Hero:



- Empathy: You genuinely care about people and want to make a difference in their lives.

- Organization: You’re a master of multitasking and can keep everything running smoothly.

- Communication: You speak impeccable English. You’re a clear and friendly communicator, both written and verbal.

- Problem Solver: You can see the big picture when resolving complex issues and follow through until you reach full resolution.

- Self Starter: You work effectively without supervision and follow processes precisely.

- Reliability: You’re dependable, punctual, and always ready to step up when needed.



Why You’ll Love Working with U



- Competitive Base Pay: We offer the highest base pay in the home care industry!

- Make a Difference: You’ll play a key role in ensuring that clients receive the best care possible.

- Growth Opportunities: As we grow, so will you! There’s plenty of room for advancement and learning.

- Fun & Supportive Team: We’re a tight-knit group that values collaboration, compassion, and a good laugh.



Ready to Be a Hero?



If you’re excited about the opportunity to join our team, where you’ll be appreciated, have a sense of purpose and inclusion and are willing to help us create a brighter, more compassionate care experience, we can’t wait to hear from you! Apply today and let’s make a difference together.

title: Overnights Receipting / Bookkeeping Specialist
description:
Role Overview

We are seeking a detail-oriented Receipting / Bookkeeping Specialist to support our Property Management clients during the overnight shift. This role is primarily focused on completing daily bank account reconciliations while providing accounting and operational support to the overnight team. It is well suited to someone with strong bookkeeping experience who is comfortable working independently in a remote environment.



Key Responsibilities

This position focuses on accuracy, timeliness, and financial integrity across multiple property management accounts:



Bank Reconciliations

• Complete daily bank account reconciliations for Property Management clients

• Investigate and resolve discrepancies promptly

• Ensure transactions are accurately recorded and allocated



Bookkeeping & Financial Support

• Perform Xero reconciliations

• Invoice clients accurately and on schedule

• Manage intercompany transactions

• Assist with cash flow forecasting

• Prepare reports and support financial analysis



Operational & Account Support

• Support other tea
mbers working on the overnight shift

• Assist with account management tasks

• Contribute to project management activities

• Complete ad hoc finance and administration tasks as required



Candidate Profile

• Ideally have exposure to receipting Property Management Trust Accounts using CRM’s such as PropertyMe, Palace, Console or PropertyTree. 

Proven experience in bookkeeping or accounting support roles

• Strong working knowledge of Xero is essential

• High attention to detail and accuracy

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

• Ability to manage time effectively and meet overnight deadlines

• Comfortable working independently in a remote setting

• Professional, reliable, and proactive approach to work



What We Offer

• Fully remote, long-term role

• Overnight shift (aligned with NZ/AU business hours). Starting 9pm Manila time.

• Night shift bonus of Php 5,000 after successfully passing the 3rd month review

• Supportive and professional team environment

• Opportunities for development and skill progression through training

• New Zealand public holidays

• Monthly internet subsidy

• Quarterly Performance Bonus



This is a fully remote role. Applicants must have:

• Dual monitors

• Reliable, high-speed internet (minimum 80mbps)

• Backup power or UPS

title: Marketing Admin & Operations Coordinator
description:
We're looking for a reliable and proactive marketing admin who can help manage day-to-day marketing tasks and keep our projects running smoothly. This is a combination role where you'll handle marketing execution AND help coordinate our workflow and contractors.



Marketing Responsibilities:



Design execution in Canva (taking existing templates/concepts and building out additional content)

Social media scheduling using Buffer (uploading content, ensuring correct tags, timing, and formatting)

Basic copywriting/editing - proofreading content for grammar, spelling, and factual accuracy (you won't be writing from scratch, but ensuring everything reads well and information is correct)

Data collection and reporting (gathering metrics for marketing performance)

Content uploading to WordPress (copy/paste articles, basic formatting, image insertion)

General marketing administrative tasks



Operations/Project Management Responsibilities:



Daily check-in calls on working days to review priorities and workflow

Track project status and deadlines

Help manage and coordinate with other contractors

Keep tasks organized and flag anything that needs attention

Needs to know or be eager to learn how to use Notion



Requirements:



Intermediate/expert level - you will likely need to learn a few things, but we need someone who understands how to deliver at a high-level

Strong English communication, both written and verbal (you'll be editing content and we'll be talking daily)

Excellent attention to detail (critical for editing and fact-checking)

Basic familiarity with Canva, Buffer, and WordPress (or eager and able to learn quickly)

Highly organized and proactive

Reliable internet connection and workspace



Available for 20 hours/3 days with flexible scheduling on those days

Available for daily calls on working days - I am located in Australia, AEDT

title: Senior Web Developer (Part-Time)
description:
About YSS Media

YSS Media is an Australian company operating in the hair and beauty industry across three divisions: a B2B SaaS loyalty platform (Hair Clubs by YSS), a creative agency for beauty brands (YSS Agency), and a podcast/media platform (Can We Go Live). We work with major brands and premium salons, and our philosophy is simple: don't be boring. Everything we produce from code to creative needs to meet a premium standard.

We're a small, tight team that moves fast. You'll be working directly with the founder (who has a technical background in software engineering) and alongside our Ops & Automation Engineer and Art Director.



The Role

We're looking for a senior web developer with strong design sensibility to own our web properties - primarily client websites on WordPress and Shopify, and Framer.



This is not a pure execution role. We need someone who can look at a design and implement it perfectly, but also someone who can take a rough brief and build something that looks and feels premium without needing their hand held. You should be as comfortable in PHP and server config as you are in CSS and animations.



You'll start part time (30 hours/week). For the right person, this role grows into a technical full time lead position. This is someone who doesn't just build, but thinks architecturally, contributes to infrastructure decisions, and becomes a true engineering partner.



What You'll Be Doing

Core Responsibilities (Day One)

Frontend & Design Implementation



Implementing designs from our Art Director, translating Figma/design files into responsive websites

Frontend animations and interactions, CSS animations, GSAP, scroll effects, loaders. The details that make a site feel premium

Maintaining visual consistency and premium quality across all web properties



WordPress Development

Theme development, ACF flexible content, custom blocks, page templates

We need modular, reusable architecture

PHP backend logic custom functions, hooks, filters, REST API endpoints

Security hardening SSL management, malware scanning, vulnerability patching, keeping WordPress core and plugins secure



Shopify Development

Liquid templates, theme customisation, section architecture

Frontend polish and theme modifications



Framer

Marketing pages, landing pages, interactive components



Server & Hosting

Managing hosting environments, staging sites, DNS configuration

Server troubleshooting and performance issues

Deployments and environment management



Analytics & Tracking

GA4, Google Tag Manager, conversion pixels setup and maintenance

Ensuring tracking is accurate and properly configured across client sites





Performance Optimisation

Page speed, caching strategies, CDN configuration

Core Web Vitals and overall site performance



API Integrations

Third party service integrations and webhooks

Building and maintaining connections between platforms



Growth Responsibilities (As You Develop) 

Contributing to technical architecture decisions across YSS, including our SaaS platform (Hair Clubs)

Solutions architecture,  evaluating approaches, identifying trade offs, making recommendations

Helping shape engineering processes and standards across the team

Mentoring and collaborating with our automation engineer on cross functional projects

Occasionally handling client communication on technical matters when needed





What We're Looking For

Must Haves



5+ years web development experience across WordPress and Shopify

Strong design sensibility, you understand typography, spacing, visual hierarchy, and colour. You don't just build what you're told; you notice when something looks off and fix it

WordPress expertise, custom theme development, ACF (Advanced Custom Fields), flexible content, custom blocks, PHP templating. You build modular, reusable components not one off sections that can't be repurposed

PHP proficiency comfortable writing custom backend logic, not just installing plugins

Shopify Liquid comfortable with theme architecture, sections, templates

Modern CSS/SCSS responsive design, animations, transitions, grid, flexbox

JavaScript vanilla JS, DOM manipulation, some framework experience is a plus

Server management comfortable with hosting environments, SSH, staging setups, DNS, basic server troubleshooting

Security awareness SSL, WordPress hardening, malware scanning, keeping things locked down

Git proficiency branching, merging, pull requests, code review. Not just committing to main

AI coding tools this is critical. We expect you to use Claude Code, Cursor, or similar AI tools daily. Not as a crutch, but as a force multiplier. If you're not already using AI in your development workflow, this isn't the right fit

Documentation habits you write code comments, maintain READMEs, and document architecture decisions. We never want to be in a position where only you understand how something is built

Independence you can take a brief, ask smart questions, and deliver without constant oversight

Attention to detail pixel level precision on implementation. If the design says 24px padding, it's 24px padding



Nice-to-Haves



Framer experience

GSAP / animation libraries

GA4 and Google Tag Manager setup experience

Klaviyo or similar
 platform experience

Performance optimisation (Core Web Vitals, caching, CDN)

API integration experience (REST APIs, webhooks)

CI/CD and deployment pipeline experience

Experience with headless CMS setups

Understanding of SEO best practices

Agile thinking you understand iterative development, not just waterfall task execution

Coaching tea
mbers



How You'll Work



Embedded in the team — you'll be on Slack, standups and all tea
etings

Timezone overlap with Sydney - you work from 11am Sydney time year round

Direct communication - you'll work directly with the founder and Art Director, not through a project manager or ticketing black box

Structured engineering practices — we're building proper Git workflows, PR processes, and code review practices together. You'll have input into how we set these up





Our Standards

We're moving away from an external agency because their output consistently didn't meet our standards. To be direct about what that means:



A page duplication with copy and image swaps should take 2–3 hours, not 20

A loading animation should actually loop until the page is ready, not play once and show a black screen

If you're building ACF sections, they should be modular enough to reuse across pages without rebuilding from scratch every time

Code should be clean, commented, documented, and structured — not 150 lines of inline CSS with no explanation

If something will take longer than expected, we want to know upfront with a clear explanation — not a post-hoc justification

Every project should have a README. Every architectural decision should be documented. We will never again be in a position where only one person or team understands how something works



We're not unreasonable. We understand complexity. But we don't accept padded hours or sloppy architecture.



Compensation & Growth



Starting: Part-time (30 hours/week)

Growth path: Full-time as revenue scales, with compensation growth to match

Long-term: For the right person, this evolves into a technical lead role with broader architectural responsibility and compensation that reflects it

Payment: Monthly, USD





How to Apply

Don't send a generic cover letter. Instead, send us:

Your portfolio 

Loom video introduction





Location

Philippines based candidates only.

title: PPC Manager (Google & Bing Ads)
description:
Role Overview:

We are seeking an experienced PPC Manager to lead the development, execution, and optimization of paid search campaigns across both Google Ads and Bing Ads. The ideal candidate will have a hands-on understanding of both platforms and proven success managing large-scale, complex campaigns with significant budgets. You will be responsible for delivering results-driven campaigns that align with client goals while maintaining a deep understanding of industry best practices. Previous experience working at Google or a strong insider knowledge of Google Ads best practices is highly advantageous.

As a PPC Manager, you’ll be the go-to expert for all things paid search and will have a direct impact on client performance. The role requires a strategic mindset, data-driven decision-making, and the ability to maintain clear and effective communication with both internal teams and clients.



Key Responsibilities:

1. Paid Search Strategy & Execution:

Campaign Development & Management: Develop, launch, and manage paid search campaigns on Google Ads and Bing Ads, ensuring they are aligned with client objectives and maximize ROI. This includes campaigns on Google Search, Display, YouTube, Shopping, and Bing Search.

Keyword Research & Audience Targeting: Conduct extensive keyword research, competitor analysis, and audience segmentation to identify growth opportunities. Develop comprehensive strategies based on these insights to optimize targeting and bidding.

Campaign Optimization: Continuously analyze and refine campaigns to improve performance metrics such as CPC, CTR, CPA, and ROAS. Implement A/B testing strategies for ad creatives, landing pages, and bidding strategies to maximize conversions.

Ad Copy & Creative Strategy: Work closely with the creative team to ensure that ad copy, creatives, and landing pages are optimized for user engagement and aligned with campaign goals.

2. Client Communication & Consultation:

Client Liaison: Serve as the main point of contact for clients, providing expert consultation on all Google Ads and Bing Ads strategies. Clearly communicate campaign progress, adjustments, and results to ensure client satisfaction and alignment with business objectives.

Performance Reporting: Regularly prepare and present in-depth performance reports, including key performance metrics (CPC, CTR, CPA, ROAS) and actionable insights. Use these reports to showcase campaign successes and provide strategic recommendations for optimization.

Strategic Guidance: Offer strategic recommendations to clients, advising on how to improve campaign performance, expand reach, or address performance challenges. Proactively identify opportunities for growth.

Client Relationship Management: Build and nurture strong relationships with clients, becoming a trusted advisor on paid search and digital marketing. Ensure high levels of client satisfaction, resolve campaign-related issues, and manage client expectations effectively.

3. Budget Management & Performance Tracking:

Budget Oversight: Manage and optimize client budgets across both Google Ads and Bing Ads to ensure campaigns are efficient and within budget. Track and report on budget pacing and ensure that client goals are met while maximizing ROI.

Performance Tracking & Analysis: Utilize Google Analytics, Microsoft Advertising Intelligence, Google Tag Manager, and other analytics platforms to monitor campaign performance in real time. Assess KPIs such as CPC, CTR, CPA, and ROAS to ensure campaigns are delivering results within the defined parameters.

Optimization: Make data-driven decisions to optimize campaigns for better performance. Adjust bids, keywords, targeting, and ads based on performance trends and competitive insights.

4. Collaboration & Cross-Functional Alignment:

Team Collaboration: Work closely with the broader digital marketing team (SEO, Social Media, Creative, Web Development) to ensure that PPC campaigns are integrated into wider marketing and sales strategies. Align campaigns with broader business objectives, ensuring a cohesive approach across all digital channels.

Stakeholder Coordination: Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure paid search efforts align with company goals and support sales or product launch strategies.

Knowledge Sharing: Actively contribute to knowledge-sharing within the marketing team by educating peers about PPC best practices, emerging trends, and new tools or features in Google Ads and Bing Ads.

5. Industry Trend Awareness & Innovation:

Stay Current with PPC Trends: Stay up-to-date with the latest Google Ads and Bing Ads updates, features, and best practices. Attend webinars, conferences, and industry events to keep ahead of emerging trends and leverage new opportunities for clients.

Test New Strategies: Continuously evaluate and experiment with new tools, bidding strategies, and ad formats to ensure campaigns are always optimized and competitive. Propose new strategies to clients based on these findings.

6. Reporting & Data-Driven Insights:

Regular Reporting: Create and maintain regular performance reports, dashboards, and presentations to track campaign progress, analyze performance trends, and showcase ROI. Present these findings in a clear, concise manner to clients and internal teams.

Actionable Insights: Translate complex data into actionable insights that drive campaign improvements. Provide clear, data-backed recommendations to both internal and client stakeholders to guide future PPC strategies and decisions.

Attribution & Conversion Tracking: Implement and manage proper tracking systems to measure campaign effectiveness and provide accurate reporting on conversions, revenue, and other key metrics.



Qualifications:

Education:

Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience). Certifications in Google Ads and Bing Ads are a plus.



Experience:

Proven PPC Experience: Minimum of 3–5 years of hands-on experience managing PPC campaigns across Google Ads and Bing Ads. This includes experience in Google Search, Display, YouTube, Shopping, and Bing Search campaigns.

Agency or Client Experience: Experience working in a client-facing role, ideally in a digital marketing agency, managing multiple PPC accounts with large-scale budgets.

Experience at Google (Bonus): Previous experience working at Google or within a Google Partner agency is highly desirable, particularly if you have in-depth knowledge of Google Ads best practices, new features, and insights from working directly with the platform.



Technical Skills:

Google Ads & Bing Ads Expertise: Advanced proficiency in managing campaigns across Google Ads and Bing Ads, including search, display, shopping, remarketing, and video campaigns.

Analytics Tools Proficiency: Strong working knowledge of Google Analytics, Microsoft Advertising Intelligence, Google Tag Manager, and other relevant analytics and tracking tools to measure, report, and optimize PPC campaign performance.

Data Interpretation: Ability to analyze large datasets, interpret complex data, and turn insights into actionable strategies to optimize campaign performance.



Soft Skills:

Excellent Communication & Presentation Skills: Ability to explain complex PPC strategies and performance data in a clear, concise, and accessible manner for clients, internal teams, and stakeholders.

Client Management Experience: Proven experience in building and nurturing strong client relationships. Ability to manage client expectations and resolve issues in a timely and professional manner.

Problem-Solving & Proactive Mindset: Strong problem-solving skills, with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing campaign issues. Ability to think critically and take strategic action based on data.

Attention to Detail: High attention to detail, ensuring that campaign elements are precise and accurately reflect client objectives, even when working with large volumes of data.



How to Apply:

If you’re an experienced PPC Manager looking for a new challenge, we want to hear from you! Please submit your resume, along with a cover letter outlining your relevant experience. Include any specific campaigns or achievements that highlight your expertise with Google Ads and Bing Ads.

title: Long-Form YouTube Video Editor (ELITE)
description:
We are a premium content agency based in the US. We are looking for a very strong YouTube editor to edit the long-form content of some of our clients.



The best example of the editor style we're going for can be seen in these videos:




 (watch the first minute)



We are willing to pay between $500-$1,000 per video (8-20 min) for each YouTube video. And we're looking for an editor to edit 3 videos/month.



You must use Adobe Premiere.



Please
 if interested with links to past work:

title: Video Editor
description:
*Full-Time | ~$1,500 AUD/month*



## About the Role



Business Outliers is seeking a technically proficient video editor to become our permanent production partner. We interview successful entrepreneurs about the books and learnings that shaped their business thinking, and we need someone who can transform these long-form conversations into compelling content across multiple formats.



This isn't a typical podcast editing gig. Our raw files can reach 100+ GB per episode, and we need someone with the technical infrastructure and editing chops to handle this scale efficiently.



## Technical Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



- *High-performance hardware* capable of handling 100+ GB video files without performance issues

- *High-speed internet connection* for rapid cloud uploads/downloads of massive files

- *DaVinci Resolve proficiency* with experience using AI-powered plugins

- *AI automation experience* - specifically tools that auto-detect speakers and automatically switch between camera angles based on audio analysis

- *Cloud workflow familiarity* - comfortable working with shared drives and large-scale file management



## Core Responsibilities



1. *Full episode production* - Edit long-form podcast episodes with multi-camera setup

2. *Short-form content creation* - Repurpose episodes into viral-worthy clips for social platforms

3. *Graphic design integration* - Add professional motion graphics, lower thirds, and visual elements

4. *Fast turnaround* - Quick response times and rapid iteration on edits



## The Ideal Candidate



? You're genuinely interested in entrepreneurship and business content (this matters - you'll be watching hours of it)  

? You're always online and responsive - we move fast and need editors who match that pace  

? You see AI tools as multipliers, not replacements - you know how to leverage automation to work smarter  

? You have a track record of handling large-scale video projects without technical bottlenecks  

? You understand storytelling and can identify the most engaging 
nts from long conversations  

? You're solution-oriented when technical challenges arise (and they will)  



## What Success Looks Like



- Episodes delivered on schedule without quality compromises despite massive file sizes

- Short-form clips that actually perform (not just random cuts - strategic, engaging 
nts)

- Minimal revision rounds because you understand the content and audience

- Proactive suggestions for improving workflow efficiency

- Seamless integration of graphics that elevate rather than distract



## Compensation & Commitment



- *~$1,500 AUD per month* 

- Full-time arrangement (ongoing relationship as we scale)

- Consistent monthly workload with potential to increase as the podcast grows



## Application Requirements



To apply, please include:

1. Your current hardware specs and internet speed

2. Examples of podcast/interview content you've edited (especially multi-camera)

3. Specific AI tools and DaVinci Resolve plugins you currently use

4. Your typical turnaround time for a 60-90 minute podcast episode

5. Brief explanation of how you'd approach creating short-form clips from a 90-minute interview



*Note:* This role requires technical infrastructure that handles enterprise-scale files. If your current setup can't smoothly edit 100GB+ files, this isn't the right fit.

title: Virtual Assistant / Researcher (Second Brain for Strategy, Content & AI)
description:
I’m looking for a full-time Virtual Assistant who can act as my second brain across research, strategy support, content intelligence, and AI-powered workflows.



This role is not basic admin work. You’ll be deeply embedded in a fast-moving, high-level industry (healthcare, technology, content, and brand strategy). You’ll help me think better, move faster, and stay organized while working closely with AI tools.

Research & Intelligence

Competitors and comparable brands (regional + global)

Messaging, positioning, and talking points

Track what competitors are doing across content, products, and platforms

Second-Brain Support

Draft content

Summarize research

Create internal knowledge bases

Brand voice



Industry knowledge



Writing style

Operational Support



Task tracking and prioritization



File organization (Docs, Notion, Drive, etc.)



Light scheduling and coordination when needed



Help keep projects moving forward without constant direction



Tools You’ll Use



Google Docs / Sheets



Notion



Slack / Microsoft Teams



ChatGPT and other AI tools



Research tools (web, social platforms, reports)



You don’t need to know everything on day one — you do need to be confident learning quickly.



Requirements



Excellent written English



Strong research and synthesis skills



Extremely organized and detail-oriented



Comfortable using AI tools daily



Able to work full-time and be responsive during work hours



Proactive, curious, and not afraid to ask smart questions

Familiarity with healthcare, tech, or SaaS industries



Experience building internal knowledge systems or SOPs



Prior VA experience supporting founders or executives



What Success Looks Like



You help me think faster and clearer



You catch things before they become problems



You make complex information simple



You become indispensable because you understand the context, not just the task



How to Apply



Please include:

Your experience as a VA or researcher

title: Telemarketer
description:
Job Title: High-Energy Cold Caller (US Construction Sales)

Location: 100% Remote (Work from home)



Shift: EST Business Hours (Night Shift in PH)



Compensation: $150 USD per week



Are you a closer with a "never-say-die" attitude?



We are looking for a relentless, high-energy Cold Caller to join our growing team. If you have a neutral accent, a thick skin, and the ability to turn a "No" into a "Maybe" and a "Maybe" into a "Yes," we want you. This is a heavy phone sales role—you’ll be making 100+ calls a day—but for the right person, the rewards are massive.



What’s in it for you?



Competitive Pay



Uncapped Bonuses: Earn extra $$$ for every qualified lead or deal closed.



Stability: Long-term, full-time position with a supportive US-based team.



Growth: We promote from within. Show us your results, and your role will expand.



No Commute: Save your money and time by working from the comfort of your home.



What you’ll be doing:



Heavy Outbound Dialing: Dialing prospects in the US throughout your shift.



Lead Generation: Identifying motivated sellers/clients and qualifying their interest.



Data Management: Accurately updating our CRM with notes and follow-up reminders.



Script Mastery: Using our proven scripts while staying natural and conversational.



Requirements:



Sales Experience: At least 1 year of experience in cold calling or BPO outbound sales.



English Fluency: Excellent verbal and written English with a neutral accent.



Tech Savvy: Familiarity with dialers (Mojo, XenCall) and CRMs is a huge plus.



Reliability: A quiet home office, a noise-canceling headset, and a stable backup internet connection (essential).



The "Grind" Mentality: You don't get discouraged by rejection; you thrive on the hunt.



How to Apply:



Send a link to your resume.



Crucial: Attach a 60-second voice recording (Vocaroo link preferred) introducing yourself and telling us about your biggest sales win.



Applications without a voice sample will not be considered.

title: Guest Operations Coordinator
description:
Location: Remote (Work US hours, Pacific & Eastern Time)

Compensation: $4–$6/hour (depending on experience)



Join a Dynamic Team at MCBB Lodging!

MCBB Lodging creates unforgettable guest experiences and maintains exceptional property standards. We’re looking for a Guest Operations Coordinator to deliver exceptional support to our guests and team. If you’re passionate about hospitality, have a knack for solving problems, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, this is your role! Please read all of the following before applying. 



Your Role

As a Guest Operations Coordinator, you’ll ensure smooth communication with guests and support our operations team. This is a fully remote position requiring US hours (Pacific & Eastern Time). Your key responsibilities include:

Guest Communication: Respond to guest inquiries, reservation changes, and requests through messaging platforms and
 promptly and professionally.

Issue Resolution: Handle guest concerns or issues quickly to ensure a 5-star experience.

Reservation Management: Monitor and update reservation systems, including check-in and check-out processes.

Admin Support: Maintain accurate guest records, assist with scheduling, and update operational workflows.

Collaborative Coordination: Work closely with the property management, cleaning, and maintenance teams to ensure seamless day-to-day operations.

Proactive Engagement: Anticipate guest needs and provide personalized recommendations or support.



What We’re Looking For

Customer Service Experience: 1+ years in a customer-facing or hospitality role (experience with short-term rentals is a big plus).

Strong English Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication with a friendly and professional tone.

Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to resolve guest issues calmly and effectively.

Tech Savvy: Experience using tools like Hospitable, OwnerRez, etc.

Detail-Oriented: Accuracy and attention to detail in managing guest communications and reservations.

Time Management: Highly organized and capable of prioritizing tasks.

Availability: Must be available to work US business hours (Pacific & Eastern Time) including weekends, evenings, and holidays.

Reliable Equipment: A stable internet connection and a reliable computer for remote work.





Why MCBB Lodging?

At MCBB Lodging, we specialize in short-term and mid-term rentals in Arizona, Kentucky & Florida, creating unforgettable guest experiences while building strong partnerships with property owners. With a focus on detail, quality, and a can-do attitude, our mission is to make every stay memorable and maximize the value of every property. We thrive on hard work, positivity, and teamwork.



Ready to Join Us?

Apply today and help us set the standard for short-term rental excellence!

Please submit a video of why you would be a good fit for this role. We will ignore any applications that do not have a video.

title: Supply Chain Associate (Amazon)
description:
Zoyava (www.zoyava.co) is positioned to establish itself as a leading digital-native brand, rapidly growing its market presence. Our dedication to delivering top-notch, user-friendly supplements exclusively on Amazon underscores our commitment to unparalleled quality and an exceptional customer experience across all operations. We firmly believe that each employee's contribution is absolutely indispensable to driving our company's advancement and success.



Who we’re looking for:



We’re currently looking for a Supply Chain Associate to join our team. This role is crucial for ensuring the efficient and effective management of our supply chain operations, particularly focusing on our Amazon FBA logistics, procurement processes, and inventory management. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of creating shipments and labels for Amazon FBA, alongside extensive experience in procurement, including supplier communications, negotiations, and purchase order placement. If you are organized, possess strong communication skills, and are capable of maintaining a well-structured digital filing system, we would love to hear from you.



Key Responsibilities & Duties:



- Handle all elements of Amazon FBA logistics, such as creating shipments, generating labels, and ensuring compliance with Amazon's policies and procedures.

- Conduct procurement activities, including supplier sourcing, negotiation, and purchase order placement. Ensure cost-effective procurement while maintaining quality standards.

- Establish efficient communication channels with suppliers to monitor order progress, address any issues, and oversee supplier partnerships.

- Effectively monitor and control inventory levels to meet demand and avoid unnecessary overstocking. Employ inventory management software to accurately track stock movements and accurately predict future requirements.

- Maintain the company's digital filing system with meticulous organization, ensuring all supplier-related documents and paperwork are accurately filed and easily accessible.



Requirements, Skills & Qualification:



- 3-5 years of FBA shipment experience

- Logistics experience creating and coordinating shipments

- Warehouse/3PL order submission and reconciliation experience

- Must have hands-on experience creating shipments and labels for Amazon FBA. The candidate should be familiar with Amazon Seller Central and have a solid understanding of FBA requirements and procedures.

- Procurement and Supplier Management: Demonstrated experience in procurement, including direct communication with suppliers, negotiation skills, and effective placement of purchase orders. The ability to build and maintain positive relationships with suppliers is essential.

- Strong proficiency in using cloud storage services (e.g., Google Drive) for document management.

- Effective verbal and written communication skills crucial for dealing with suppliers, internal teams, and managing documentation.

- Ability to manage and track inventory levels, ensuring stock availability and minimizing overstock situations. Experience with inventory software and forecasting tools is preferred.

- Attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously are key.

- Available to work in EST 



What We Offer:



- A dynamic and supportive work environment in a fast-growing company. We are dedicated to partnering with career-driven individuals in search of stable, fulfilling employment opportunities.

- We offer an attractive salary and comprehensive benefits package to ensure that our employees are well-compensated and rewarded for their hard work.

- Unlimited Paid Time Off

- HMO (Medicard) 

- Opportunities for advancing your professional growth and development.



This is a remote position which requires you to have an active and fast internet connection and a personal computer or a laptop. If you meet the above criteria, please apply thru this link:




/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSer_dBdXnMcVnx-9GmQdaJOfeKnQT5LMQTyuOOnZnMHYf8wxQ/viewform

title: Remote IT Support Specialist (Tier 1/2) – US-Based MSP

Are you a technical problem-solver who loves the variety of working with different clients? Our client is a US-based Managed Service Provider (MSP) seeking a highly skilled Remote IT Support Specialist to join their team.



This is a 100% remote position for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and has a "client-first" attitude. While this role is centered on Level 1 and Level 2 support, you will have the opportunity to work with advanced server and cloud infrastructure daily.



What You’ll Be Doing

System Maintenance: Perform critical maintenance tasks on client servers (Windows
) and cloud environments.

Technical Skills We Are Looking For

General Requirements

Communication: Exceptional written and verbal English skills. You must be comfortable and confident speaking with US clients.



Problem-Solving: A passion for networking and a willingness to tackle challenging technical situations.



Stability: A reliable home office setup with high-speed internet (and a backup plan for power/connectivity).



Why Join Our Team?

We are a growing business that offers a fun, high-energy work environment. You won’t just be a number here; you’ll be a vital part of a great team with tremendous opportunities for learning and career growth.



To apply:

title: Creative Designer for Social Media Content
description: I’m looking for a highly creative graphic designer to support me across multiple brands and projects, with a strong focus on social media content and brand visuals. This role requires someone who deeply understands the social media landscape and how design performs across platforms like Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, and YouTube. You’ll be responsible for creating social posts, carousels, thumbnails, brand assets, and campaign visuals that are clean, modern, and scroll-stopping. This is an ongoing role for someone who is fast, detail-oriented, open to iteration, and excited to help shape strong visual identities across projects.

title: Content & Social Media Manager (Virtual Assistant)
description:
Creative • Reliable • Thinks Ahead • Cares About Quality



This is a full-time role for someone who wants to build a proper content engine, not just post reels and hope something sticks.



At CrossFit Bairnsdale and Strength Therapy Physio & Performance, content isn’t an afterthought. It’s how people understand who we are, what we stand for, and why they should trust us with their training or their body.



If you love planning, creating, editing, and improving content — and you enjoy working with people who are clear, consistent, and actually back their team — keep reading.



A Bit About Us (And Why This Role Exists)



We run two health brands under one roof in regional Australia:



CrossFit Bairnsdale — a coached, community-driven gym for everyday people who want to get stronger and feel better without intimidation.



Strength Therapy Physio & Performance — a calm, professional physio clinic focused on helping people move better long-term, not just chasing quick fixes.



Same founders. Same values. Different tone.

That’s where you come in.



We care deeply about:



Doing things properly



Communicating clearly



Getting better every week



Treating our team like adults



We move forward with intention, not chaos. And we want someone who thrives in that kind of environment.



About You



You’re not just a VA.

You’re a content operator.



You think before you post.

You enjoy structure.

You notice gaps and fix them.

And you genuinely care about making the brands you work with look sharp, consistent, and trustworthy online.



You’ll do well here if you:



- Think strategically and plan before acting

- Take ownership without needing to be chased

- Switch tone easily between different brands

- Edit fast and post consistently

- Live comfortably inside Canva, CapCut, and content calendars

- Give and receive feedback without ego

- Want a long-term role where you can grow, not just “help out”





About the Role



This role is simple, but not easy:



You own the content system for two brands.



That means planning, briefing, editing, posting, reviewing, and improving — every week.



You’ll be responsible for:



- Building monthly content calendars for both brands

- Writing clear, on-brand captions for IG, TikTok,
, and YouTube

- Giving weekly filming directions that make content easy to capture

- Editing short-form video using CapCut and Canva

- Scheduling and posting content via GoHighLevel

- Repurposing long-form content into short-form clips

- Tracking performance and adjusting based on what’s working

- Protecting each brand’s voice and visual identity

- Supporting paid campaigns, light Squarespace updates, and SOP documentation



You’ll work directly with the founders, Marty and Bree.

Clear communication. Fast decisions. No middle layers.



What You’ll Get:



- $1,000–$1,200 AUD per month + 13th-month bonus

- Full-time, long-term remote role

- Creative freedom with clear direction

- Direct access to the founders

- Exposure to paid ads and growth strategy

- A stable role where expectations are clear and standards matter

- The chance to build something meaningful, not just “manage posts”



This Role Is Probably NOT For You If:



- You need constant instructions to get started

- You struggle switching tone between brands

- You don’t enjoy feedback

- You’re only looking for short-term freelance work



How to Apply:



Apply via OnlineJobs.ph with:



1. A short intro video (max 2 minutes) sharing why this role fires you up

2. Your resume plus examples of your best content or social edits

3. Your favourite content or workflow hack — anything that makes you faster, more organised, or more effective



If you’ve read this far and thought, “This actually sounds like my kind of team” — we’d love to hear from you.



A Note From Us:



We know there are a lot of remote roles out there.



What we’re offering is a place where your work actually matters.

Where your ideas are heard.

And where effort, care, and consistency don’t go unnoticed.



We’re proud of what we’ve built at CrossFit Bairnsdale and Strength Therapy, and we’re excited about where it’s heading next. This role plays a big part in that.



If you’re someone who takes pride in your work, enjoys ownership, and wants to grow alongside a business that’s doing things properly — we’d genuinely love to meet you.



Marty & Bree

Founders — CrossFit Bairnsdale

Strength Therapy Physio & Performance

title: Key Getaways - FT STR Operations Lead
description:
Role:

Job Title: Key Getaways - Operations Lead

Schedule: 9am - 6pm Monday - Friday (US EST) with 1 hour lunch

Hours: 45 Hours

Pay: ($8/hr - $10/hr) USD DOE



About Us:

Key Getaways is a premier property management firm founded by a former futures trader who traded the chaos of the Chicago markets for a passion-driven mission: creating first-class travel experiences for families. We specialize in transforming vacation rentals into high-performing assets across national markets, currently anchored in the Smoky Mountains of Tennessee. 



Our culture is built on the "family-style" values of kindness and leadership, yet we operate with the precision and scalability of a high-growth tech company. We are a lean, execution-focused team that rejects micro-management in favor of individual ownership, and we are looking for a remote partner to help us build the systems that will support our goals.



Accountability:

1. Operational Ownership & Decision-Making

* Take full ownership of assigned operational areas from problem to resolution

* Make informed decisions with limited information and clearly explain rationale

* Escalate thoughtfully, with proposed solutions—not just problems



2. Process Leadership & Systems Thinking

* Identify inefficiencies and proactively propose better workflows

* Build new processes from scratch when services or needs are introduced

* Document systems so they can be delegated, trained, and scaled



3. Revenue & Listing Operations Leadership

* Own the creation, optimization, and ongoing accuracy of listings across platforms

* Ensure pricing rules and revenue tools are implemented correctly and consistently

* Help define billing logic and workflows for new revenue services



4. Tool Evaluation & Implementation

* Research, compare, and recommend tools that improve efficiency or accuracy

* Lead implementation and internal adoption of approved tools

* Balance functionality, cost, and scalability in recommendations



5. Leadership Readiness & Team Enablement

* Prepare workflows and documentation for delegation to future VAs

* Support onboarding and training of new tea
mbers as the team grows

* Lead by example in ownership, accountability, and quality of work



Tasks (Daily):

* Independently resolve operational issues (e.g., part sourcing, vendor research, logistics)

* Design, test, and document new workflows for emerging services

* Help structure fair, logical billing and invoicing processes

* Coordinate with leadership on priorities, risks, and improvements

* Support and improve back-office operations as the company scalesLead the creation and optimization of listings on Airbnb, VRBO, and direct booking platforms

* Manage and adjust pricing within PriceLabs and related tools



Expectations:

Required Traits

* Strong ownership mentality — you see tasks through to completion

* Comfortable making decisions and recommendations independently

* Internally motivated and driven to grow professionally

* Thinks in systems, not just checklists

* Communicates clearly, confidently, and proactively

* Attention to detail is mandatory: secret code = KGOM020926

* Leadership Mindset

* Views problems as opportunities to improve the business

* Enjoys building processes others will eventually follow

* Takes pride in mentoring, documenting, and setting standards

* Wants increased responsibility over time



Tools (Experience Preferred, Not Required)

* Airbnb, VRBO

* PriceLabs or similar pricing tools

* Google Workspace

* Process documentation tools (Notion, Google Docs, etc.)



Nice-to-Have

* Prior experience leading projects or people (formally or informally)

* Background in operations, property management, or startups

* Experience building workflows from zero



Salary (Dollar Rate):

* Position & Length: Contractor (Remote) 1-Year (12 months) with option to continue indefinitely

* Rate of Pay: $8-10 USD (depending on experience)

* Scheduled Hours Minimum: 40 hours (Must Track Hours) 

* Scheduled Hours Maximum: 50 hours (Anything above needs approval) 

* Agreed Schedule: Monday–Friday, 9AM–6PM Eastern Time with one hour lunch

* Pay Schedule: Monthly via Wise or preferred method with the submission of hours worked

* 13th Month Pay Bonus: (optional, must hit the KPI agreed, KPI TBD after probation period) 



Subject Line please add: KG Ops Lead

Please have an ID score of 70+

Please provide the secret code in the message 

Application Deadline: February 28th, 2026

title: Retreat Center Sales & Events Manager
description:
Retreat Center Sales & Events Manager

Location: Remote (Philippines-based)

Schedule: Full-time, 40 hours/week (must align with U.S. Pacific Time business hours)

Employment Type: Long-term, full-time



Overview

We are seeking a highly organized, client-focused Retreat Center Sales & Events Manager to manage the full sales cycle and coordinate retreat and event bookings for our U.S.-based retreat center. This is a fully remote role based in the Philippines.

In this role, you will be responsible for converting inquiries into booked retreats, managing client relationships from first contact through post-event follow-up, and ensuring each retreat or event is planned and executed with exceptional attention to detail.

The ideal candidate is confident in sales, highly organized, and experienced in event coordination, hospitality, or client services.



Key Responsibilities

1. Sales & Client Relationship Management (Full Sales Cycle)

Manage the complete sales cycle from initial inquiry to signed contract and final payment

Respond promptly to inbound retreat and event inquiries via
, phone, and messaging platforms

Qualify leads, understand client needs, and recommend appropriate retreat or event solutions

Conduct sales calls, virtual or in-person site tours, and follow-ups

Prepare and send proposals, pricing sheets, contracts, and agreements

Negotiate terms and close bookings to meet or exceed sales targets

Serve as the primary point of contact throughout the entire client lifecycle



2. Event & Retreat Planning & Coordination

Develop detailed agendas, run-of-show documents, and event flow schedules

Coordinate pre-event planning meetings with clients, catering teams, and vendors

Organize floor plans, setup requirements, food service details, technical needs, and staffing notes

Ensure all event and retreat details are finalized and clearly communicated to internal teams

Manage the event calendar and scheduling logistics



3. Event Marketing & Venue Promotion

Assist with marketing efforts to promote the retreat center and event space

Manage listings on event platforms, social media posts, website updates, and outreach efforts

Maintain an organized library of marketing materials, photos, descriptions, and testimonials



4. Administrative & Operational Support

Prepare invoices, track payments, and follow up on outstanding balances

Maintain accurate client files, contracts, checklists, and planning documentation

Update CRM and event management systems with accurate sales and event data

Track sales metrics and generate reports for management

Create post-event follow-up reports and client surveys



5. Post-Event & Client Follow-Up

Coordinate post-event reviews to ensure client satisfaction

Collect client feedback and provide recommendations for improvement

Reconcile event financials, vendor invoices, and final billing

Support repeat bookings and referrals through strong relationship management



Required Qualifications

Excellent written and verbal English communication skills (must be fluent and professional)

Neutral accent with clear, professional spoken English suitable for client-facing sales and event coordination

Proven experience in sales, event planning, hospitality, or client services

Strong ability to manage a sales pipeline from inquiry to close

Highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously

Comfortable with CRM systems,
 communication, scheduling tools, and collaboration platforms

Ability to work U.S. business hours (some flexibility depending on events)

Reliable home internet connection and quiet workspace



Ideal Candidate Attributes

Confident, and client-focused

Strong sense of ownership and accountability

Sales-minded with a service-oriented approach

Calm under pressure and solution-oriented

Able to anticipate client and operational needs

Passion for retreats, hospitality, and delivering exceptional experiences



Application Process



Interested candidates should apply via the link below and complete the required assessment.

A minimum score of 70% is required for consideration.



Apply here:





Please do not send direct messages unless you experience technical issues with the assessment. Qualified candidates will be contacted with next steps after successful completion.

title: ROCKSTAR Virtual Assistant
description:

The ideal candidate is proactive, organized, and committed to quality—someone who thrives in a high-speed environment and ensures that everything created under Dr Barbara Eaton’s brand meets world-class standards.



1. Tech & Platform Proficiency

* Zoom + YouTube: Download recorded Zoom calls, upload to YouTube, manage visibility settings, and ensure video descriptions, tags, and thumbnails are complete.

* Canva: Create clean, on-brand cover thumbnails optimized for YouTube and social media.

* GoHighLevel (GHL):

* Upload new lessons into membership areas.

* Test and optimize funnels—confirm all buttons, forms, and links function properly.

* Check mobile and desktop formatting for consistency and flow.

* Verify spacing, design alignment, and overall user experience.

*
 Groups: Create and schedule posts announcing new uploads, tagging members as needed.

* Google Workspace: Manage Docs, Sheets, and Drive organization for assets, testimonials, and weekly deliverables.



2. Content Quality & Brand Voice

* Proofreading & Editing:

* Spot grammar, punctuation, and formatting errors across
s, landing pages, and graphics.

* Check coherence, clarity, and logical flow.

* Maintain consistent spacing, alignment, and structure.

* Voice Adaptation:

* Learn and replicate Dr Barbara’s distinct brand voice—bold, emotionally resonant, faith-anchored, and neuroscience-informed.

* Edit AI-generated copy to sound human, relational, and on-brand.



3. Funnel & Design Quality Control

* Conduct thorough end-to-end testing of funnels, forms, and automations.

* Ensure seamless navigation, consistent spacing, and mobile responsiveness.

* Provide feedback and screenshots of any issues with clear resolution notes.



4. Testimonial Management & Organization

s, and messages into a searchable Google Doc or Sheet.

* Transcribe video testimonials accurately and link each entry to the relevant client or program.

* Maintain a clean, organized master list for marketing and credibility use.



5. Event & Call Coordination

* Provide private chat support to attendees (e.g., renaming, troubleshooting).

* Record and document participation logs after each session.



6. Data Collection & Reporting

* Access and download weekly form submissions from GHL (e.g., Business Brain Boot Camp).

* Transfer data into structured worksheets.

* Prepare weekly summary reports or
s with accurate formatting and professional presentation.



7. Personal Attributes

* Highly organized and reliable under pressure.

* Strong written and verbal communication.

* Self-starter with high follow-through—no dropped details.

* Emotionally intelligent and comfortable working in a mission-driven, faith-based business.

* Demonstrates initiative, discernment, and confidentiality.

title: Bookkeeper – E-commerce & 3PL Operations (Remote)
description:
We’re looking for a Bookkeeper to support our growing e-commerce business, with a strong focus on 3PL, fulfillment, and logistics-related accounting.



This is not a basic data-entry role. We need someone who understands how inventory movement, fulfillment fees, shipping costs, and chargebacks flow through the books and can keep everything accurate and reconciled.



You’ll work closely with operations and leadership to ensure our financials reflect what’s actually happening across sales, fulfillment, and logistics.



What You’ll Do



• Maintain accurate bookkeeping for e-commerce operations

• Reconcile bank accounts, credit cards, and payment processors

• Track and reconcile 3PL invoices, fulfillment, storage, and shipping fees

• Ensure refunds, reships, and chargebacks are recorded correctly

• Match platform revenue with fulfillment and logistics data

• Prepare monthly summaries and basic financial reports

• Flag discrepancies between sales, payouts, and 3PL charges

• Keep records clean, documented, and audit-ready



Who We’re Looking For



• Proven bookkeeping experience for e-commerce businesses

• Hands-on experience working with 3PL or fulfillment partners

• Strong understanding of shipping, storage, and fulfillment fee structures

• Experience with QuickBooks, Xero, or similar tools

• High attention to detail and accuracy

• Clear written English communication



Bonus if You



• Have worked with Shopify + 3PL providers

• Understand inventory-related accounting concepts

• Have reconciled complex 3PL invoices before

• Can proactively flag operational or process gaps

title: URGENT: Hiring "AI Influencer" CapCut Video Editor - NOT Account Manager ( Veo3, HeyGen, ElevenLabs, ChatGPT etc. )
description:
Please read the ENTIRE description.



Our previous candidate couldn't continue due to personal life problems so we're now ONLY looking for VERY dedicated members with experience in CapCut and other AI tools mentioned. This opportunity is seriously much better than it sounds at first glance!







A few words about us



Hey! We are Organic Media, a micro-agency creating and distributing educational and engaging AI-generated short-form videos for e-commerce brands, mainly in the pet niche.



You’ll work directly with our amazing manager ( 20 years old from Europe, with over 3 years of real experience in this exact space ), who has personally prepared step-by-step tutorials on Loom to teach you everything from the ground up.

No confusion. No guessing. No wasted time. ( Most team members learned the workflow within a few days and are now working fully independently )







What kind of videos will you create?

Simple UGC-like short-form videos fully based on the provided scripts by us ( you might just need to tweak a few words if needed ) which look realistic and feel "natural" to the viewers on platforms like YouTube Shorts, Instagram or Facebook. Some of them are silently advertising products at the end but the key is that it doesn't sound like an ad but rather a native short-form video which a real person/influencer would record with their iPhone. There are a few styles such as just a calm "sit down" video ( where there's only one image and the influencer would just talk for 2 minutes ) or other ones where there're a few "shots" of them with a few seconds each and the scenes change but it's really not difficult at all - just a few more generations and then connecting them in CapCut.





The process is straightforward:

Getting our scripts ready and approved, using your own creativity and generating high quality base images using tools like Nano Banana Pro, turning these images into video clips using platforms like Veo3, Kling or HeyGen and for voice ElevenLabs, cuts and trimming, other minor adjustments such as background audio effects if needed ( like supermarket background audio ). Whole process is 90% just creating the right images/video clips etc, we might not even do transitions or captions so there won't be much editing skill needed. Everything is shown clearly in the training.



You’ll be creating a lot of videos a day but these are not complex edits AT ALL. Difficulty level: 6/10 ( again, 80% is just generating the rate "input" images and later just animating them with voice. That's it )





Here are visual examples of what the videos look like ( NOT OURS ):

1. www.instagram.com/reel/DTty7hsAHe_/

2. www.instagram.com/reel/DT0R9KgDkuW/

3. www.instagram.com/reel/DSc75hsDQV6/

4. www.instagram.com/reel/DT8pDFngXfp/

5. www.instagram.com/reel/DUOAHm3kY7P/



( In your application, let us know your thoughts, do you think you can easily recreate them - what tools would you use and why? )





Training & onboarding ( this is the biggest advantage )

Once hired, you will receive structured video tutorials. In total, we have a few hours available, though most people don’t need all of it. The workflow is clear so no missing steps and no “figure it out yourself.”







Daily workload ( important )

You’ll create around 10 to 20+ videos per day ( 1 to 2 min long - we’ll start with a smaller amount and later increase it - won't negatively affect your monthly pay. We just want to make it easier for you to start - ultimately we'll be doing 20+ but making sure it's under 8-10h a day, at first it may take you longer and we may work harder - but once learned it easily becomes manageable ).

In reality, you'd have exactly 4 unique "AI influencers" but all of 4 them have the same scripts to use, you'd just need to change a few words to help with the context ( some of them might be talking only about "dogs" but some about "cats" so just need to change a few words to make it all make sense ) and you could use the same image prompts to generate almost identical images for each influencer. In reality it’s just 2 to 6 original videos PER INFLUENCER ( 4 of them ) and each with a very similar structure. Once trained, this is very manageable.



Your job is simple:

Create the videos, export them, and send them to us daily on Discord.

That’s it. No posting. No account management. No stress.







Equipment & storage ( we make this easy )

You’ll need a good computer that can smoothly handle 1080p/light 4k video editing ( we’ll do 1080p but we’re going to work on multiple browser tabs ), a stable internet connection, and at least 16GB of RAM and 250GB+ of fast storage AVAILABLE. 1TB+ of SSD storage is preferred ( make sure it’s SSD and not old and slow HDD ).



If you need to buy storage/RAM ( for example, a 1TB SSD for around $100 ), we will refund you. This is required ONLY to save you time and speed up your workflow so you can be more efficient since it can be a couple GB of files a day ( you can later remove them after sending them to us. )



There also may be small subscription costs which you’d have to cover later if needed ( only around $10 a month ) for services like iCloud+ on iPhone/iPad or Discord Nitro - we refund those as well.







Tools & software ( HUGE upside )

You get FREE access to ALL paid tools that cost us hundreds of dollars per month, including:

- AI avatar tools like HeyGen or Veo3,

- Copywriting software like ChatGPT+, Grok or Claude,

- Editing software like CapCut PRO on Desktop,

- and our CUSTOM voice-over tools like ElevenLabs,

We provide logins, instructions, and full support.

( ALL OF THEM ARE WORTH $500+ MONTHLY )





Work environment & communication

You’ll have a private 1:1 chat with our manager and separate one to send your daily work in, work fully remotely through Discord, receive clear feedback, and be treated as a long-term team member, not disposable labor.

No stressful interviews. No micromanagement. No slow emails back and forth.







Responsibilities

- Adjust our scripts for the context

- Create videos from start to finish.

- Export and send them.

- Apply feedback and improve.

- Prepare scripts for the next day.

- Organize files properly.

- Communicate clearly.

- Hit deadlines without reminders.

That’s it. Simple, repetitive, and enjoyable.







This job is perfect for you if

You’re looking for long-term stability ( months or years ), you’re willing to learn, tech-savvy, creative, organized, and able to focus consistently. You already have video creation/editing experience. Already done some AI influencers related jobs and have good experience in: Google VEO3, Nano Banana Pro, HeyGen, ElevenLabs, CapCut PRO and other similar tools. Your computer can handle multiple tabs open ( A LOT of them ). You care about doing things properly, understand and speak English well, respond to messages quickly, and can work up to 6 days per week. You’re a young, talented, smart individual. You’re okay with a slightly heavier learning phase in the first week, you’re not afraid to ask questions, you’re reliable and honest about mistakes, and you either already have or can get an iPhone device ( used only for specific verification codes - refunded if needed. You can even get some used iPhone 8 for like $40 which works ).

We value dedication, reliability, and improvement more than raw talent.







This job is not for you if

You’re looking for quick money, disappear without communication, can’t focus, you’re on the older side and have never edited 1 video in your life, never played with the AI tools mentioned above, your computer can’t handle having multiple tabs open at the same time, have unstable internet, refuse feedback, rush work carelessly, avoid consistency, or cannot communicate in English.







Salary & payments

This is a full-time position, starting at 6 days per week, under 10 hours per day. ( ultimately under 8h once you become very efficient, which our manager will help you achieve and it won't impact your salary working less - quite the opposite! )



Starting salary ranges from around $440-$540/month based on experience, with the potential in the future to increase to $540+ based on a few factors such as performance, dedication, and quality of work.



Payments are monthly, in any currency or method available in your country. ( we’ll try )



To build trust, we’re offering to pay you $100 after the first week of working with us, with the remaining balance at month end. ( we already got scammed by other platforms so please respect this )



And remember, we pay $500+ dollars/month for paid tools so you can get them for FREE meaning your pay is actually 100% profit + refunds for any costs of yours. ( meaning in theory your total compensation is closer to $1000+ including tool access )







Hiring process (step-by-step)

- Please re-read this job post carefully and only then submit your application.

- In your job application, make sure to set the right title and answer every point.

- We will review it and reach out with an extra message if accepted.

- We'll send you a Google Form to fill out with contact info, etc.

- You’ll be invited to our Discord server and will get your 1:1 chat.

- You'll complete the training and take notes of it to learn everything.

- We'll give you access to all the tools and refund any required purchases.

- You'll officially start creating videos for Organic Media and get hired.

Simple and effective.







Why this is a real opportunity

No confusion, no guessing, no unpaid trials. You get real structured video training on Loom, real tools, real support, and real long-term growth - including potential promotion to coach or lead roles.

Some jobs may offer to pay more, but very few:

Teach you properly step by step, invest in you, respect your time, and give you paid tools for free.







How to apply (pay attention)

Your application title must start with the first word “ Influencer ”:

“ Influencer: (…) “

Applications without this will be ignored.





In your application, please include the following:

- Your thoughts on the 5 videos linked above,

- Your past experience ( or none - that’s fine ),

- Links to any past work or simple edits,

- a detailed introduction about yourself,

- Your daily routine and availability,

- Why you want this opportunity and why we should pick you over someone else. ( why you’re special )

- and detailed answers to these 15 questions:



1. Do you have experience using CapCut on DESKTOP? How long have you been using it, and what type of videos do you usually create with it?

2. Which AI video tools have you personally used? ( For example: VEO, Kling, Nano Banana Pro, Seedream 4,5, HeyGen, Vozo, etc.) Briefly describe what you used them for.

3. When you watch short-form videos that reuse existing footage, are you able to recognize patterns such as hooks, pacing, avatar placement, and caption timing? Please explain how you notice these patterns.

4. We work with very detailed step-by-step SOPs that specify exactly which clips to use and how to assemble them. How do you typically work when instructions are extremely clear and structured?

5. If you are unsure about a task or something does not match the instructions, what do you do?

6. When generating AI videos, what are the most common problems you run into? (for example: bad lip sync, weird hands, low realism, wrong lighting, artifacts, etc.)

7. Would you say you’re more of a creative problem-solver who looks for shortcuts, loopholes, or ways around limitations, or someone who prefers to strictly follow rules and structure?

8. Have you ever had to regenerate the same AI scene or just an image multiple times to get a usable result? What usually goes wrong and how do you fix it?

9. When working with AI tools, do you prefer experimenting freely or strictly following a proven workflow? Why?

10. Tell us about your PC specs, how much RAM and Available Storage and is it a PC or laptop/Macbook. Also, do you already have an iPhone/iPad? If so, which model is it/generation?

11. Are you good at learning? Meaning if you want to learn something by for example, watching YouTube tutorials - do you usually rewatch it or take notes? Or just watch it once and try it yourself?

12. Describe exactly how you usually organize your project files when working on multiple videos at the same time.

For example: how you name folders, how you separate drafts vs finals, and how you avoid losing assets.

13. Take a look at the job post once again and find the 5 video example links we've included above. Watch all of them fully and let us know your overall thoughts, how do you think they were created - what tools would you use and why? Please cover the whole process in detail ( these aren't our videos but very similar )

14. What are your long-term plans or goals with this opportunity?

15. To confirm that you’ve read everything carefully, please tell us your favorite meal and dessert, as well as a restaurant in your country. Explain why someone from outside your country should absolutely try it. :)





Do not use ChatGPT or any AI to fully write your application. Be real, honest and detailed. We value spelling mistakes over perfect, AI generated responses. ( Yes, we can detect AI generated responses and it just isn't a good look on you )



You must also follow our Instagram: ( www.instagram.com/organicxmedia )







Final note

We are hiring ONLY 1 PERSON for this role and are focused strictly on long-term relationships ( months + )

If you are dedicated, reliable, and willing to learn, this can be a very comfortable long-term position. Can’t wait to have you on - good luck!

Join Our Team at Solaris — Creative Director
