title: GHL Automations Expert
description:
I’m looking for an experienced GoHighLevel specialist to build a clean, logical set of automations for an online course and consulting offer.



This is not a massive CRM rebuild. The goal is a simple, robust automation system that handles applications, call bookings, enrolments, course engagement, and ad audience segmentation without manual work.



You should be very comfortable with pipelines, workflows, tags, dynamic lists, and payment triggers in GHL.



Scope of work



Application and call booking automation (combined)

Build a single, clean automation that handles

• Application form submission

• Opportunity creation in the pipeline

• Branching logic for “call booked” vs “no call booked”

• Call booking reminders and pre-call value
s

• Handling people who book calls directly (no application) so they enter the same downstream flow



Call outcome automations

• Move opportunities based on call outcomes (showed, no-show)

• If Zoom link is clicked or appointment is marked as showed, move to “Client Showed” stage

• No-show follow up logic



Enrolment and payment automation

• When a client pays via Stripe or GHL payment link, automatically

– Move opportunity to “Won”

– Apply enrolment tags

– Stop all lead / call related automations

– Trigger client onboarding
s



Course engagement automation

• When a product or module is completed, send a motivational

• Logic should be reusable for multiple products or modules



Dynamic lists for Meta ads

Create dynamic smart lists for ad targeting, including

• Applied but didn’t book a call

• Booked but didn’t show

• Showed but didn’t enrol

• Enrolled clients (for exclusion)



Lists must stay updated automatically based on tags, pipeline stages, or activity.



What I will provide

• Existing pipelines and stages (if needed)

• Copy for
s or clear placeholders

• Payment links already created

• Clear naming conventions



What I’m looking for

• Strong GoHighLevel experience (this is not beginner work)

• Clear, logical thinker who builds simple systems that don’t break

• Good communication and ability to explain what you built

• Someone who documents workflows clearly so they’re easy to maintain



Time estimate

A competent GHL specialist should be able to complete this in approximately

10 hours

title: French Translator
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled French Translator to join our growing eLearning development team. This role is ideal for a detail-oriented linguist with a strong background in medical, healthcare, or compliance translation who can deliver accurate, culturally aligned content for French-speaking learners. If you are passionate about producing high-quality educational materials and enjoy working in a dynamic digital environment, we’d love to meet you.



Key Responsibilities

• Translate English eLearning course content into French with linguistic, technical, and cultural accuracy.

• Localize medical, dental, and regulatory terminology to ensure compliance with industry standards.

• Input, format, and organize translated text directly within Articulate Rise 360.

• Generate natural and accurate French audio narration using AI voice tools (e.g., ElevenLabs).

• Proofread, edit, and quality-check translated materials for clarity, consistency, and precision.

• Collaborate closely with the content development team to verify terminology and ensure alignment with compliance requirements.

• Maintain consistent glossaries, terminology databases, and style guides across all translated modules.

• Handle confidential and compliance-sensitive content with discretion and professionalism.

________________________________________



Qualifications

• Native or near-native proficiency in French, with excellent written and spoken communication skills.

• Strong fluency in English.

• Proven experience translating medical, healthcare, or regulatory/compliance-related content (required).

• Experience with eLearning tools especially Articulate Rise 360 is an advantage

• Familiarity with AI-based narration platforms (e.g., ElevenLabs) for generating French voiceovers.

• Exceptional attention to detail, accuracy, and linguistic consistency.

• Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.

________________________________________



Other Details

• Schedule: 8 hours/day, Monday to Friday

• Days Off: Weekends

• Time Zone: Mountain Standard Time (MST)

• Employment Type: Full-time, Work From Home

• Start Date: ASAP

title: EXECUTIVE Operations & Admin Assistant (GREAT PAY)
description:
Position: Operations & Admin Assistant (Highly Detail-Oriented / Systems-Driven)

Remote | Beginning Part-Time (20–30 hrs/week to start) then ramp up to Full-Time

Compensation: I reward hard-working, competent employees! There is no "max" earning with this role- the more experience, accuracy, effort, and drive you have, the more you will earn.



Hi!!! My name is Mel, and I own the top Christian speed-dating services in the United States! I’m on the lookout for a new assistant to grow with me. There are countless opportunities for growth, and I’m so excited to find the right person to join the team. I currently have two AMAZING assistants and need a third to keep up with the growth we've been experiencing. Here's a testimonial from one of my assistants:



"I’ve been working as Mel's VA since September 2024, and I genuinely love it. The work is meaningful (helping people find their Godly spouses), fast-paced, and never boring. You’re supporting a business that’s actively scaling. Mel is professional, clear, and respectful of boundaries. I can fully enjoy my days off, travel when needed, and never worry about work piling up. She also pays weekly and always on time. That said, a great client is great for a reason. This role requires great - truly GREAT - attention to detail. Mel has high standards, and rightfully so. If you’re not detail-oriented, proactive, and committed to doing excellent work, this won’t be the right fit. But if you are, working with her is incredibly fulfilling. I’m grateful to be part of her team and to support a leader who is clear, mission-driven, and genuinely good to work with."



Please read carefully before applying



This role is not creative, not social-media strategy, and not “wing-it” work.

This role is for someone who genuinely enjoys:

• Following detailed SOPs

• Working from templates

• Tracking numbers

• Executing conditional logic accurately

• Catching mistakes before they happen

• Doing important but sometimes tedious admin work extremely well



If you are not naturally obsessive about details, this role will feel overwhelming.



About the Role:



We run highly organized, multi-city events with complex ticket logic, conditional
 workflows, and time-sensitive admin tasks. One small mistake can create downstream issues, so precision matters. You will be responsible for executing systems exactly as documented, while also helping improve them over time once you fully understand how everything works. This is a self-directed remote role with clear expectations, clear SOPs, and recurring tasks.



Core Responsibilities:



Admin & Operations (High Attention to Detail)

• Perform data entry and tracking using Google Sheets and internal spreadsheets

• Monitor ticket inventory levels across:

• Men’s tickets

• Women’s tickets

• 1-man + 1-woman tickets

• 2-men combo tickets

• 3-men combo tickets

• Ensure events stay balanced (e.g., targeting 15 men / 17 women)

• Flag issues immediately if numbers are off or approaching limits



This requires comfort with multi-variable tracking and checking numbers multiple times per day. I’m ideally looking for someone with a high "C" & high "S" in the DISC Assessment (please write out your DISC Assessment scores).



Conditional & Logic-Based Tasks

• Execute conditional logic workflows (if-then scenarios), such as:

• Sending different
s to men vs women based on ticket availability

• Triggering follow-ups based on survey responses

• Knowing which template to use based on status, timing, and inventory levels

• Ensure the correct message goes to the correct group at the correct time



Social Media (Execution Only- No Strategy Required)

• Post Instagram Stories from pre-made templates

• Schedule stories using Buffer

• Follow exact posting instructions (timing, captions, tagging)

• No content creation or creativity required — execution only



Community & Event Setup

• Create
 Events

• Post pre-scripted messages into
 groups

• Follow posting rules and instructions exactly



 & Review Follow-Ups

• Send follow-up
s to participants who complete post-event surveys

• Encourage Google Reviews using approved scripts

• Ensure
s are sent only to the correct segments



Tools You Must Be Comfortable Using

• ClickUp (task management required)

• Google Workspace

• Google Docs

• Google Sheets (must be comfortable with complex spreadsheets)

• Instagram (Stories posting + scheduling)

• Buffer (or willingness to learn quickly)

• ChatGPT (for problem-solving, clarification, and drafting)

• Zapier experience is a BIG plus (not required but highly preferred)



Schedule & Availability Requirements

• Remote

• U.S. work hours strongly preferred

• Must be able to check ticket levels morning and evening (U.S. time)

• Weekend availability required 1-3hrs in the morning & evening on saturday & sunday. Please let me know if this works for you in your reply.

- Monday–Friday, you may choose 4-5 days to work 5–7 hours per day. You may opt to work 6 days instead of 5 if you prefer shorter daily hours—I’m flexible- as long as you get time-sensitive tasks finished. Some tasks will be time sensitive, others are flexible.



Hours & Growth

• Start at 25–30 hours/week guaranteed, and then ramp into full-time

• Workload will grow as we:

• Add more cities

• Launch new projects

• Expand operations

• We intentionally do not overload you at the start so there’s room to grow



Who You Are (This Is Important)



You are someone who:

• Is extremely detail-oriented (double-checks everything)

• Enjoys systems, structure, and checklists

• Can follow SOPs without improvising

• Notices inconsistencies others miss

• Is fast and accurate

• Can work independently without constant reminders

• Enjoys improving systems after mastering them

• Is comfortable with repetitive but important work



This is not a good fit if you:

• Prefer creative work

• Dislike repetition

• “Skim” instructions

• Get bored easily with admin tasks



Compensation & Benefits

• Competitive hourly rate (based on experience)

• 13th-month pay

• Birthday bonus

• Unpaid holidays allowed with advance notice (approval required for coverage)



We strongly reward:

• Reliability

• Accuracy

• Initiative

• Trustworthiness



Our Promise



We are building a long-term team. If you do excellent work, grow with the systems, and help the company scale:

• You will grow with us

• Your pay will increase

• Your role will expand



We value people who do quiet, excellent work behind the scenes- and we take care of them.



WE WILL ONLY CONSIDER APPLICANTS THAT ANSWER THIS QUESTION IN THE SUBJECT LINE: What is your favorite food EVER?!



Looking forward to hearing from you and finding the perfect fit to join our team!



Best,



Mel

title: Meta Ads Campaign Manager
description:
We are looking for a
 or Meta Campaign Launcher to join our team and start on a part-time basis initially. 



The role mainly involves launching and managing
 ad campaigns for our brand by following our proven SOPs. Everything you need will be provided to you to ensure you hit the ground running in our team. 



This is an execution-focused role thus you wont need to come up with any creatives or strategies.



What You’ll Do



- Launch
 ad campaigns based on our SOPs

- Set up campaigns, ad sets, targeting, and budgets

- Duplicate campaigns

- Pause and or delete campaigns where necessary

- Full training will be provided



What We’re Looking For

- Proven experience launching
 ads 

- Strong understanding of campaign structure

- Detail-oriented, reliable, and fast

- Able to follow SOPs exactly

- Stable, high-speed internet connection



Time & Pay

• 4 hours per day

• 5 days per week

• $4/hour

• Long-term opportunity for the right person

• Potential for more responsibility & pay increase over time





When applying, please include:

1. Your experience with Meta Ads and a short loom intro about your experience.

2. Your availability (hours per day & time zone)

3. Why this role interests you

4. Confirmation that you’re comfortable with $4/hour and daily work

title: Social Media Manager (SMM)
description:
Are you a creative and organized individual with a passion for social media? We’re looking for a Social Media Manager to join our team and take charge of managing multiple brand accounts, boosting engagement, and designing eye-catching freebies that delight our audience.



 Key Responsibilities:



Manage and schedule content across multiple social media platforms 
, Instagram, TikTok, etc.)



Develop creative campaigns to boost brand visibility and engagement



Create promotional materials, downloadable freebies, and lead magnets (e.g., templates, eBooks, checklists)



Monitor trends and community feedback to improve content strategies

description:

- Strong understanding of digital design principles, including typography, and visual storytelling.

- Ability to follow brand guidelines while maintaining creativity and originality.

- Reliable and detail-oriented, with strong communication skills and efficient time management.

- A creative thinker who brings innovative solutions.

- A growth mindset with a willingness to learn new techniques and adapt to industry changes.

- A team player who aligns with our values and is dedicated to driving success for both our agency and our clients.



Interested?



Don't wait! We’re eager to welcome a creative mind like yours to SWEAT!



Apply now and be a part of an agency where your creativity is valued and your career growth is taken seriously. Join us in shaping the future of fitness branding!



If you are interested in applying, please submit a copy of your portfolio, CV as well as a video introducing yourself.

title: Facebook/Meta Ads Media Buyer
description:
Facebook Ads Media Buyer (Remote) Wanted!

Monthly Salary: PHP 66,500



SWEAT Digital is a rapidly expanding marketing agency dedicated to helping fitness, health, and wellness brands achieve significant growth. We're seeking a skilled and proactive Filipino
 Media Buyer to join our dynamic team. If you have solid experience managing and optimizing
 and Instagram ad campaigns and are eager to take on more responsibility to drive tangible results, we'd love to hear from you!



What You'll Do:

This role focuses on hands-on campaign management and optimization, with opportunities to contribute to strategy. You will be responsible for:



- Campaign Management & Optimization: Strategizing, setting up, launching, monitoring, and actively optimizing
 and Instagram ad campaigns across various objectives (e.g., conversions, lead generation) to ensure strong performance and maximize ROAS.

- Performance Analysis: Regularly reviewing campaign data within Ads Manager, identifying key trends, and making data-backed adjustments to improve metrics like ROAS, CPA, and CPL.

- Audience Targeting: Developing and implementing effective audience targeting strategies, including leveraging custom and lookalike audiences, to reach the right customers.

- Creative & Copy Collaboration: Working closely with our creative team by providing performance-based insights to help develop high-converting ad visuals and compelling copy.

- Budget Management: Efficiently managing client ad budgets to achieve performance goals.

Reporting: Contributing to the generation of clear and concise performance reports, highlighting key results and actionable insights for our internal team.

- Staying Current: Proactively keeping up-to-date with the latest Meta advertising features, platform changes, and industry best practices.



What You Need:

We're looking for a dedicated professional with proven experience who is ready for their next challenge.



- 2-4 Years Proven Experience as a
 Media Buyer: Solid hands-on experience managing and optimizing a variety of performance-driven ad campaigns.

- Demonstrated Ability to Improve Performance: You should be able to discuss specific campaigns where your strategies led to measurable positive impacts on results.

- Strong Analytical Skills: Capable of interpreting complex campaign data and identifying clear opportunities for optimization.

- Excellent Written English: Strong communication skills are crucial for internal collaboration and effective ad creation.

- Detail-Oriented & Organized: A meticulous approach to campaign setup, data accuracy, and execution is essential for ensuring client success.

- Proactive & Solutions-Oriented: Ability to identify issues and propose effective solutions, working efficiently with minimal supervision.

- Proficiency with Tools: Strong practical experience with
 Ads Manager and Meta Business Suite. Familiarity with project management tools (e.g., Asana) is a plus.

- Reliable Setup: Consistent and reliable internet connection with the ability to work 7 AM – 3 PM PH Time.



Ready to Drive Results with SWEAT Digital?

If you're a driven
 Media Buyer looking for a rewarding remote opportunity with a competitive salary and the chance to make a real impact on growing health and wellness brands, we encourage you to apply!



To Apply: Please send the following:

- Your CV/Resume, clearly highlighting your
 Media Buying experience and any key performance achievements.

- A 1-2 minute video introducing yourself and discussing a
 Ad campaign you're proud of, outlining your role, the strategies you implemented, and the results achieved.

We are seeking a driven Closer who wants real ownership, not just a task list. This isn't about managing a CRM—it's about being the high-energy engine of our sales pipeline. If you thrive on accountability, hate micromanagement, and want a paycheck that reflects your performance, this long-term, full-time remote role is for you.



Your Mission: To own the "middle-to-end" of the sales funnel. Your primary goal is to turn leads into revenue by building pipeline, running compelling demos, and closing deals on the spot.



What You’ll Do:

Prospect & Build Pipeline: Make 75–100+ outbound/cold calls daily. You don't wait for perfect leads—you create them.



Demo & Close: Run live demos (showing how to get an "instant pay raise") and confidently ask for the sale, converting prospects into paying customers.



Manage Leads: Follow up diligently on warm leads and inbound requests.



CRM Mastery: Fully manage our GoHighLevel (GHL) CRM—maintain a clean pipeline, update stages, and execute SMS/email follow-up sequences.



Onboard & Support: Help new customers get live by setting up the product to their specific needs.



Drive Improvement: Share feedback on objections and blockers. Work with the team to refine messaging and improve win rates.



Administrative Execution: Schedule appointments and ensure impeccable daily CRM hygiene.



What "Success" Looks Like

Closing 20+ new paying customers weekly.



Maintaining an impeccable, accurate GHL pipeline.



Consistently improving close rates and conversion over time.



Who You Are (Requirements):

A Proven Closer: You're comfortable asking for the sale and handling objections until you get a "Yes."



GHL Expert (Non-Negotiable): Extensive, hands-on experience building/managing pipelines, automations, and campaigns in GoHighLevel is required.



Outbound Hunter: Exceptionally comfortable with high-volume cold calling and outbound prospecting.



Autonomous & Organized: You prefer ownership over micromanagement. You're a proactive self-starter, meticulous with follow-up.



Excellent Communicator: You possess clear, fluent, and confident spoken English for demos and sales calls.



Professional Setup: Reliable high-speed internet, a professional headset, a quiet workspace, and comfort on camera.



Who This Is NOT For:

People who only want to handle inbound leads.



Those uncomfortable with cold calling or outbound prospecting.



People who avoid targets or accountability.



Compensation & Schedule:

Schedule: Full-Time, Remote.



Compensation: Competitive Base + Commission.



Month 1 (Ramp): Guaranteed base salary + commission per sale.



Ongoing: Base salary with performance-based unlocks (base increases with production) and strong commission structure.



How to Apply:

DO NOT apply through a platform.

Send your application DIRECTLY via WhatsApp to: 
AND
 to:

title: Home Care Scheduler
description:
About Us



At Helper Heroes, we’re on a mission to provide exceptional care and support to home

care agencies in the U.S. We believe in true partnership where our virtual assistants act

as an extension of the care team. Our goal is to ensure a compassionate, innovative,

and efficient care experience for clients and families alike.



About You



What sets us apart is YOU. You’re not just any virtual tea
mber—you’re a Helper

Hero! If you’re passionate about making a difference, have a knack for organization, and

thrive in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment, you’re who we are looking for. If

you’re the kind of person who loves tackling behind-the-scenes tasks with a smile,

ensuring that our clients and caregivers receive the best possible support, apply today!



About the Role



We’re looking for a detail-oriented Home Care Scheduler to match caregivers with client

visits, fill open shifts fast, and keep the daily schedule smooth. You’ll work closely with

recruiters, care managers, clients, and caregivers to make sure every visit is covered and

logged correctly.



Key Responsibilities



- Build, publish, and maintain daily/weekly schedules for caregivers and clients

- Fill open shifts quickly by calling, texting, and following up with caregivers

- Match caregivers based on skills, availability, location, client preferences, and pay

rates

- Monitor call-outs, late arrivals, and no-shows; arrange immediate coverage and

notify stakeholders

- Confirm new starts, schedule changes, and cancellations with clients and

caregivers

- Update client and caregiver profiles, care plans, and visit notes in the scheduling

system

- Track EVV/clock-ins and resolve exceptions before billing and payroll cutoffs

- Coordinate with recruiters and team leads to forecast coverage needs

- Escalate risks (missed visits, repeated call-outs, client concerns) early

- Provide end-of-day and end-of-week coverage reports and metrics

- (If needed) Support after-hours/on-call rotation for urgent schedule changes



Qualifications



-1+ year of scheduling, dispatch, coordination, or call center experience (home

care, home health, or healthcare preferred)

- Strong English communication skills (phone, text, and
) with a calm, helpful

tone

- Fast, accurate data entry and excellent attention to detail

- Proven ability to juggle many moving parts and stay organized under time

pressure

- Problem solver who can think ahead and act quickly when plans change

- Basic understanding of HIPAA/privacy and client confidentiality

- Comfortable working US business hours; willing to work occasional

evenings/weekends/holidays as needed



Nice-to-Have (Tools & Systems)

Experience with any of these is a plus:



- Scheduling/EVV platforms: WellSky (ClearCare), AxisCare, AlayaCare

- Phone/SMS tools: RingCentral, Dialpad, JustCall, Twilio

- Productivity: Google Workspace or Microsoft 365, Slack/Teams, spreadsheets



Work Setup



- Laptop or desktop

- Reliable internet (at least 25 Mbps), backup connectivity/power recommended

- Quiet workspace and professional phone etiquette



Why You’ll Love Working with Us



- Competitive Base Pay: We offer the highest base pay in the home care industry!

- Make a Difference: You’ll play a key role in ensuring that clients receive the best

care possible.

- Growth Opportunities: As we grow, so will you! There’s plenty of room for

advancement and learning.

- Fun & Supportive Team: We’re a tight-knit group that values collaboration,

compassion, and a good laugh.



Ready to Be a Hero?



If you’re excited about the opportunity to join our team, where you’ll be appreciated,

have a sense of purpose and inclusion and are willing to help us create a brighter, more

compassionate care experience, we can’t wait to hear from you! Apply today and let’s

make a difference together.

mber of our team. This role is customer-facing and mission-critical. You’ll be the voice of our brand, helping customers feel supported, informed, and confident in their purchase.

What You’ll Do:

Required Qualifications:

- Available to work Eastern Time (EST) hours

- Strong computer skills and familiarity with office tools

- Highly organized, detail-oriented, and self-motivated

- Able to work independently and meet deadlines consistently



Technical Requirements:

- Personal computer with an updated operating system

- Quiet, professional workspace

- Backup power source strongly recommended



What We Offer:

- Long-term role with growth opportunities

- Supportive, structured work environment



How to Apply (Important – Read Carefully)

To apply, please submit all of the following:

2. Cover letter explaining why you’re a strong fit

3. Preferred working hours in EST

4. Video submission (required)

5. Subject line must include the word: AWESOME



Your video should answer the questions below. Please provide a link to your recording (Loom or Google Drive with sharing enabled). **Applications without a video submission will not be considered.



Video Questions:

title: Electrical Engineer for Power Distribution Centers
description:
As an Electrical Engineer specializing in Power Distribution Centers, you will be responsible for designing, analyzing, and optimizing electrical distribution systems within industrial and commercial settings. Your role will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure efficient power distribution, compliance with regulations, and adherence to project timelines and budgets.



Responsibilities:

- Design and develop electrical distribution systems for power distribution centers, ensuring reliability, efficiency, and safety.

- Perform load flow, short circuit, and coordination studies to optimize system performance and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.

- Collaborate with project managers, architects, and other engineering disciplines to integrate electrical systems into overall facility designs.

- Select appropriate equipment such as transformers, switchgear, circuit breakers, and protective devices to meet project requirements.

- Prepare technical specifications, drawings, and documentation for construction and installation.

- Conduct site visits and inspections to assess existing electrical infrastructure and provide recommendations for upgrades or modifications.

- Participate in commissioning and testing activities to verify system performance and troubleshoot any issues.

- Stay current with advancements in electrical engineering technology, codes, and standards to continuously improve design -practices.

- Provide technical support and guidance to junior engineers and project teams as needed.

- Communicate effectively with clients, contractors, and regulatory authorities to ensure project requirements are met and approvals obtained.



Qualifications:

- Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or related field; Master's degree preferred.

- Professional Engineer (PE) license preferred.

- Solid understanding of power distribution fundamentals, including three-phase systems, voltage regulation, and protection schemes.

- Proficiency in engineering software such as ETAP, SKM PowerTools, or equivalent for electrical analysis and design.

- Experience with AutoCAD or similar drafting software for creating electrical drawings and schematics.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for collaborating with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders.

- Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively.

- Knowledge of relevant codes and standards such as NEC, NFPA, IEEE, and ANSI.

- Experience in industrial or commercial electrical design and construction preferred.

- Familiarity with renewable energy systems and energy storage technologies is a plus.



Join our team and contribute to the development of cutting-edge power distribution solutions that drive efficiency and sustainability in diverse industries

title: Mechanical Engineer for Power Distribution Centers
description:
Overview:

As a Mechanical Engineer specializing in Power Distribution Centers, you will play a crucial role in designing, analyzing, and optimizing the mechanical systems and components associated with power distribution infrastructure. Your expertise will ensure the efficient operation, reliability, and safety of power distribution centers within industrial and commercial environments.



Responsibilities:

- Design and develop mechanical systems and components for power distribution centers, including HVAC systems, ventilation, cooling, and fire suppression systems.

- Collaborate with electrical engineers and other stakeholders to integrate mechanical systems seamlessly with electrical distribution infrastructure.

- Perform thermal analysis and heat dissipation calculations to ensure proper operation and longevity of equipment housed within power distribution centers.

- Select and specify appropriate equipment such as chillers, fans, pumps, and ductwork to meet project requirements and environmental conditions.

- Prepare detailed mechanical drawings, specifications, and documentation for construction, installation, and maintenance.

- Conduct site assessments and evaluations to determine spatial constraints, environmental factors, and logistical considerations for mechanical system implementation.

- Ensure compliance with relevant codes, standards, and regulations governing mechanical design and construction in power distribution facilities.

- Participate in commissioning activities and collaborate with testing teams to verify the performance and functionality of mechanical systems.

- Evaluate and recommend improvements to existing mechanical designs and systems to enhance efficiency, reliability, and safety.

- Provide technical support and guidance to project teams, contractors, and maintenance personnel as needed.



Qualifications:

- Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field; Master's degree preferred.

- Professional Engineer (PE) license preferred.

- Strong understanding of HVAC principles, thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, and heat transfer.

- Proficiency in engineering software such as AutoCAD, SolidWorks, or equivalent for mechanical design and modeling.

- Experience with computational fluid dynamics (CFD) software for analyzing airflow and heat distribution within power distribution centers.

- Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

- Effective communication and collaboration skills for working in multidisciplinary teams.

- Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively.

- Knowledge of relevant codes and standards such as ASHRAE, ASME, and NFPA.

- Experience in designing mechanical systems for industrial or commercial facilities preferred.

- Familiarity with energy efficiency practices and sustainability principles is a plus.



Join our team and contribute to the development of innovative mechanical solutions that ensure the reliable and efficient operation of power distribution centers in diverse applications.

title: Meta Media Buyer
description:
We are looking for a Media Buyer & Creative Strategist who truly understands how to scale DTC brands profitably. You’ve either worked in-house at a startup or at an agency managing DTC client accounts—and you know how to build campaigns from the ground up.



This role blends performance and creativity. You’ll be setting up campaigns, testing hypotheses, and also mocking up ad concepts in Canva or CapCut to show how you’d bring ideas to life. You’ll help shape what “profitable growth” looks like across early-stage DTC brands by pairing data with insight and creativity.



What You’ll Do

* Set up, manage, and optimize paid campaigns across Meta, Google, TikTok, and other key platforms.

* Create and test new ad concepts—using Canva, CapCut, or similar tools to mock up static and short-form video ads.

* Monitor creative performance, extract insights, and refine messaging, hooks, and formats to improve ROAS, CAC, and MER.

* Build clean account structures, tracking (pixel/CAPI), and reporting dashboards.



Who You Are

* You’ve managed paid media for DTC brands (in-house or agency side) and understand how to scale efficiently.

* You can start from zero—creating the ad account, structuring the campaigns, and iterating to scale profitably.

* You have hands-on creative skills and an eye for what converts—comfortable editing short-form content, mocking up ads, and testing ideas fast.

* You balance analytical thinking with creative intuition. You can read the numbers but also understand the story behind them.

* You’re proactive, independent, and thrive in flexible, fast-moving environments.



Role Details

* Part-time (flexible hours)

* $5-7 USD per hour

* Must have DTC experience, do not apply if you do not have applicable media buying experience with Meta and Google.

title: Property Manager & Executive Assistant
description:
I’m a real estate entrepreneur based in Dallas, Texas, running two connected businesses: a real estate sales team that helps buyers and sellers, and a property management company that operates furnished co-living rentals. We use ClickUp for task and project management and Google Drive as our primary file system. We also use Buildium as our main property management tool.



I’m looking for a full-time Property Manager who becomes the operational hub for the property management side of the business — overseeing day-to-day execution, tenant and vendor coordination, and ensuring our systems and processes are followed accurately and consistently as we continue to scale.



WHAT YOU’LL DO

- Serve as a primary point of contact for tenants, vendors, and taskers (escalating issues as needed)

- Coordinate furnishing installs, turns, maintenance requests, and vendor schedules

- Coordinate closely with the Property Management Department Lead to align priorities and next steps

- Review applications and move qualified leads through the leasing pipeline daily

- Execute workflows in ClickUp and Buildium (statuses, due dates, tags, notes, and documentation)

- Manage day-to-day conversations with tenants and vendors to keep items moving

- Help create and document SOPs for recurring workflows

- Maintain and update SOPs/process documentation as changes are made, ensuring the team is working off the latest version

- Ensure follow-up and closure on every open item — nothing falls through the cracks



YOU’D BE A GREAT FIT IF

- You have property management experience

- You follow instructions exactly and don’t cut corners

- You write and speak clearly in English

- You stay calm managing many moving parts

- You take ownership and don’t need hand-holding

- You take initiative: you spot issues early, investigate, and propose next steps/solutions

- You use good judgment and can prioritize without being told every step

- You thrive in a fast-paced environment and can adapt quickly as priorities shift

- Tools experience preferred: Buildium, ClickUp, Google Workspace (we will train — instruction-following matters more than expertise)



ROLE DETAILS

- Full-time, remote

- Schedule: Mon–Fri, aligned with CST

- Pay: $4-6 USD/hour, based on experience

- Long-term role with growth and bonuses



HOW TO APPLY (READ CAREFULLY)

We do not review platfor
ssages.

Applications that don’t follow instructions are disqualified.



STEP 1 —

1. Send an
 to 

2. Subject line: Property Manager – [Full Name]

3.
 body must include only:

- A short greeting

- A Google Drive folder link

- Your answer to the Detail Check (see Step 3)



STEP 2 — GOOGLE DRIVE FOLDER

1. Create a folder named: [Your Full Name] — Property Manager Application

2. Set sharing to “Anyone with the link can view.”

3. You can organize the folder however you think is best. I will be looking at both what you submit and how you organize it.

4. Include the following:

a. Resume (PDF)

b. Tech and Setup

   - Include a screenshot of your internet speed showing download and upload speeds. 

   - Include a screenshot of your computer specs showing RAM, processor, and OS.

   - Include one photo of your current workspace (desk and computer).

c. Written Answers (one Google Doc)

   - Property Management Experience

      - Describe one property management role or company you worked with. Include:

      - Number of properties/units

      - Your day-to-day responsibilities

      - Tools you used (Buildium, AppFolio, ClickUp, spreadsheets, etc.)

   - Taking Ownership

      - We already have SOPs and systems, but they’re still improving.

      - What would you focus on in your first 2 weeks to keep operations running smoothly without needing constant supervision?

d. Systems Proof (2–4 screenshots)

   - At least 1 “HQ” or home base view you’ve built (for a founder/team)

      Example: a dashboard, control panel, or main view in ClickUp, Asana, Notion, etc.

   - At least 1 project management board or folder structure you created

      Example: a tool for maintenance tracking, tenant or leasing pipeline, or vendor coordination

   - For each screenshot, add a short caption (this can be in a small Google Doc or directly on the image as text), including:

      - What the system is used for

      - Which tool it’s in (ClickUp, Asana, Google Drive, Notion, etc.)

      - What part you personally designed or organized

   - If you cannot share screenshots from a previous client because of confidentiality, you may recreate a similar structure in a fresh workspace (with fake data) and take screenshots of that instead.

e. Video Introduction (2–4 minutes)

   - Who you are and where you’re based

   - Your property management experience

   - Example of handling multiple stakeholders at once

   - How you personally stay organized



STEP 3 — DETAIL CHECK

At the very bottom of your
 (under the Drive link), write only the price per square foot for this property:



3384 P Avenue, Plano, TX 75074 – Sold for 255,555 USD.



Just include the final price per square foot number, with no explanation.



WHAT HAPPENS NEXT

-
 application screen

- Systems portfolio review

- Paid sample task (1-2 hours)

- Interview

- Hire

This is not a call-centre role. Outreach is primarily

Alongside outbound sales activity, this role also supports light marketing execution to improve response rates and overall campaign performance.

 and contact discovery platforms

 and LinkedIn

Case study summaries

Assist with basic marketing activities such as:

Posting content to social media channels

Supporting newsletters and
 campaigns

Uploading or formatting case studies for the website

Work with Craig to align outreach messaging with current campaigns and priorities

title: We’re Hiring: Expert Video Ad Creator for Meta (Facebook & Instagram)
description:
About Us:

Our company is a Los Angeles–based design and build company with over 9 years of experience serving homeowners across Southern California. We specialize in ADU construction, home remodeling, additions, and full design-build projects — and we’re growing fast!



We’re looking for a creative and skilled Video Ad Creator who can produce scroll-stopping, high-converting Meta video ads that highlight our services and attract new clients.

 and Instagram.

Write or follow compelling ad scripts that drive viewer action (calls or form submissions).

Collaborate with our marketing team to align visuals with campaigns and messaging.

Proven experience creating Meta 
 & Instagram) video ads — please provide examples or portfolio links.

killed in tools like CapCut, Premiere Pro, After Effects, Canva, or similar AI video software (e.g., InVideo, Pictory, Vizard).

Good English communication and script comprehension.

Able to work independently with minimal supervision and deliver on deadlines.

Experience in the construction, home design, or real estate industry

title: Full-Cycle Accountant
description:
Full-Cycle Accountant

Remote



Job Summary: 

We are looking for a detail-oriented Full-Cycle Accountant to manage end-to-end accounting operations, including bookkeeping, monthly closing, and work-in-progress (WIP) tracking. This role will also provide financial support and assistance to Finance Manager on various finance-related functions. The ideal candidate is hands-on, organized, and comfortable working across multiple accounting areas.



Key Responsibilities:



Work-in-Progress (WIP)

-Monitor, track, and reconcile WIP accounts.Ensure proper revenue and cost recognition related to ongoing projects.Coordinate with operations or project teams to validate WIP balances.



Bookkeeping, Month-end closing, and Compliance

-Manage the full accounting cycle (AR, AP, Payroll and General Ledger) Reconcile bank statements, credit cards, and other balance sheet accounts. Complete monthly, quarterly, and year-end closing activities. Ensure compliance with accounting standards and internal guidelines.Maintain organized financial records and audit-ready documentation.



Payroll Management

-Reviewing employee timesheets, work hours, deductions, commissions. Calculating and distributing employee wages every payroll period.



Management Reporting & Internal Controls

-Assist Finance Manager with financial analysis, reporting, and other management reporting tasks as needed. Help improve accounting processes and internal controls.



Qualifications & Requirements

-Bachelor’s degree in Accounting

-Proven experience in full-cycle accounting.

-Strong experience in monthly closing processes.

-Experience with WIP accounting in a service based business is an advantage.

-Experience in Payroll administration.

-Proficient in XERO accounting software from previous roles and Excel/Google Sheets.

-High attention to detail and strong organizational skills.

-Ability to work independently and collaboratively with finance and operations teams.



Preferred Skills

Experience with service-based businessExperience handling multi-entity businessStrong communication skills and ability to support cross-functional teams.Continuous improvement mindset for accounting processes.

title: Design & HubSpot Marketing VA
description:
About the Role



We are looking for a virtual assistant to support our marketing initiatives and operational needs. In this role, you will create on-brand marketing assets, build and maintain HubSpot landing pages, and assist with day-to-day marketing and administrative tasks.



You will work closely with our team to ensure all marketing materials and campaigns are clean, professional, and aligned with our brand guidelines. In addition to marketing tasks, you will help manage book inventory, coordinate orders for our online store, and handle simple administrative duties.



This role requires someone detail-oriented, organized, and adaptable, with the ability to follow instructions and contribute to multiple areas of the business. There is also opportunity for additional responsibilities and growth based on performance and available hours.



Key Responsibilities

• Design marketing handouts, PDFs, and simple digital assets

• Build and update landing pages in HubSpot

• Set up HubSpot forms and CTAs (basic level)

• Follow provided brand colors, fonts, and layout guidelines

• Make revisions based on feedback

• Organize and maintain design files in shared folders

• Support marketing campaigns as needed

• Maintain and monitor book inventory and manage communication related to orders and logistics 

• Manage the online apparel store, ensuring inventory management, order processing, and customer experience.

• Handle simple day to day administrative tasks

• Opportunity for additional responsibilities and growth based on performance and available hours



Required Skills & Experience

• At least 3 years of virtual work experience

• Experience using HubSpot (landing pages, forms,
s)

• Strong design skills (Canva, Adobe, or similar)

• Experience creating marketing handouts or landing pages

• Experience optimizing landing pages for conversion

• Basic understanding of marketing funnels or lead generation

• Strong attention to detail and organization

• Clear written communication



Tools You’ll Use

• HubSpot

• Canva (Adobe is a plus)

• Google Drive

• Required to have a Gmail account

• Asana (or willingness to learn)

• Missive (for communication)



Work Details

• Part-time with potential to transition to full-time

• Remote role, US-based (Central time)

• Paid hourly

• Start: Immediate work availability 



How to apply?

Please submit your job application through this platform and include a Google Drive folder link named:

title: Creative Video Editor (E-commerce and Social Media) - Remote
description:
Job Summary:



We are looking for a highly skilled and creative Video Editor who excels at transforming raw clips and creative concepts into engaging, high-converting video content for social media ads and Amazon product videos.



This role requires more than just technical proficiency—it demands a strong storytelling ability, a deep understanding of e-commerce video trends, and the ability to craft videos that capture and hold attention with minimal supervision. As Mr. Beast says, "the magic happens in the editing room"—your work will be the d
 factor in whether a video succeeds or fails.



You'll collaborate closely with the marketing and creative teams to bring products to life through compelling visual storytelling that drives conversions and enhances brand visibility.



Primary Duties and Responsibilities:



Edit and produce high-converting video ads for platforms like
, Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube.

Transform raw footage and creative briefs into engaging videos that capture attention and hold viewers from start to finish.

Craft compelling narratives using motion graphics, text overlays, sound design, and special effects.

Optimize videos for different platforms, ensuring the best performance on mobile and desktop.

Work autonomously—taking scripts, clips, and hooks and turning them into attention-grabbing videos without heavy supervision.

Edit footage to highlight key selling points, user testimonials, and product demonstrations.

Stay ahead of trends in video marketing, storytelling, and social media best practices for e-commerce brands.

Manage multiple projects while maintaining quality and meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Qualifications:



Proven experience as a Video Editor, preferably in e-commerce, social media marketing, or DTC brands.

Expert-level proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, Final Cut Pro, or similar editing software.

Strong understanding of social media ad formats, aspect ratios, and platform-specific video requirements.

Ability to edit fast-paced, attention-grabbing content optimized for conversions.

Exceptional storytelling skills—knowing how to keep viewers engaged from start to finish.

Experience with motion graphics, text animation, and sound design to enhance engagement.

Ability to work independently and take creative direction, producing high-quality content with minimal supervision.

Preferred Qualifications:



Experience editing videos for beauty, health, or lifestyle brands.

Knowledge of A/B testing for video ads and performance optimization strategies.

Familiarity with Amazon product video guidelines and best practices.

Basic skills in color grading, lighting correction, and sound mixing.

About Us:



Skin Research Institute is a fast-growing e-commerce brand dedicated to creating high-quality beauty and wellness products. Our marketing team thrives on delivering compelling, high-performing video content that resonates with our audience and drives sales.



Learn more about us:











To Apply:



Submit your portfolio of past video projects—especially social media ads and Amazon product videos. We are looking for someone who can bring creative concepts to life and create videos that demand attention.



Let’s create standout content together!

title: Customer Experience Specialist
description:
Clarity, care, and speed—human support for every parent, athlete, and coach.

 



What You’ll Do



At Prep Network, our purpose is simple: to positively impact kids through sports. Through unparalleled written, social, and visual coverage at nationwide events, our no-player-is-off-limits approach shines a spotlight on student-athletes at every level.



The Prep Network Customer Experience team plays a critical role in delivering that mission. Working within our ticketing CRM, the team provides thoughtful, high-quality support to customers across all Prep Network brands. We collaborate closely with teams across the organization to support customer-facing initiatives and ensure a consistent, positive experience at every touchpoint.





Who We Are



Prep Network is a sports company that connects high school athletes with college coaches. Through our nine brands, we publish over 4,000 articles each month and actively scout talented athletes across the U.S.  We aim to discover and promote promising prospects who aspire to play at the collegiate level. 



In addition to our content, Prep Network is the top event operator in the U.S., hosting 200+ tournaments annually.  We offer a combination of top-tier competitions and extensive media exposure for attending teams.  Our 250+ showcases each year provide a platform for over 10,000+ prospects to compete in front of colleges, scouts, and media outlets. 



We’re pumped to have been named one of the "Best Places to Work" by Minneapolis/St. Paul Business Journal for four years running, and to land a spot on the 2025 Inc. 5000 list of America’s fastest-growing private companies. Prep Network isn’t your average sports company—we’re all about helping student-athletes succeed and creating an awesome workplace.





Core Responsibilities



- Manage Customer Climate: Build trusted relationships and maintain high customer satisfaction across Prep Network brands.

- Create Customer Experience: Gather customer feedback and translate insights into process and product improvements.

- Educate: Guide customers through our website, subscriptions, and events with clear, friendly explanations.

Resolve. Assist with orders, refunds, cancellations, upgrades, and other miscellaneous website and event inquiries efficiently and empathetically.

- Communicate: Deliver clear, professional support via
, chat, and occasional phone calls.

- Be a Team Player: We're growing quickly and need someone who embraces new challenges and opportunities. No job is too big or too small.





How We Measure Success



- Customer satisfaction and positive feedback

- Timely response and resolution times

- Accurate, consistent support and documentation





Must-Haves in a Candidate



- Fluent in both written and spoken English with clear, professional communication

- 1+ year of customer support or service experience 
, chat, or phone)

- Excellent writing skills with strong grammar, tone, and empathy

- Highly organized with strong attention to detail

- Ability to manage multiple tickets and priorities independently

- Comfort in resolving customer issues without constant supervision

- Experience with Google Workspace (Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Calendar)

- Reliable internet and ability to work an 8-hour shift between 6 am–5 pm CST





Nice-to-Haves in a Candidate



- Experience with customer support tools (Zendesk, Intercom, Freshdesk, etc.)

- Experience working with SaaS subscriptions or event/ticketing platforms

- Familiarity with Slack and Asana or similar team tools

- Strong technical aptitude and comfort learning new systems quickly

- Experience supporting U.S.-based customers or companies





Benefits and Perks



At Prep Network, we take pride in our culture and commitment to creating an exceptional workplace environment. Here are some of the benefits and perks you can expect when you join our team:



- Impact at Scale.  Your work directly shapes the experience of thousands of parents, athletes, and coaches each year. This isn’t just a support role; you’re a key part of how families experience Prep Network.



- Remote Flexibility. Work remotely from your home while collaborating with a U.S.-based team. You’ll have a consistent schedule during CST business hours, with clear expectations and structured workflows.



- Supportive, High-Trust Culture. Prep Network has been recognized as a Best Place to Work multiple times. We value curiosity, accountability, and people who care deeply about doing great work and supporting customers with empathy.



- Ownership & Autonomy.  We trust you to manage your workload and deliver excellent service. You’ll have documented processes, clear goals, and the autonomy to solve problems and make a real impact.



- Professional Growth.  We encourage continuous learning and growth. High-performing contractors have opportunities for expanded responsibilities and long-term engagement.



- Compensation. The starting salary will depend on the skills and applicable experience you bring to this role. 





Contract Details



- This is a contractor role (not a U.S. employee)  

- Paid monthly, on the last business day of the month, via Wise

- The expected schedule: 40 hours/week during CST business hours

- Long-term opportunity for high performers

 

Join us at Prep Network and be part of a dynamic team that values your individuality, fosters personal growth, and offers a diverse range of benefits to enhance your professional and personal life. Discover a workplace where you can thrive, learn, and make a meaningful impact on our journey together.



To be considered for this role, please apply through this link. Applications submitted outside of this link will not be considered:

title: Investment Research Analyst
description:
1.) What you’ll be doing



You will be given very specific criteria to find private equity buyers (example: find me PE firms that have invested into indoor family entertainment businesses like go-karting, laser tag, trampoline parks, etc.).



Your job is simple and repetitive:



- Take the criteria we give you



- Conduct online research to find private equity firms that clearly fit



- Verify that they have actually invested in the type of companies specified



- Record the buyer’s information in a spreadsheet (with proof/source links)



- Move on and find the next one



This is not data entry and not guessing. Every buyer must be supported by real evidence (portfolio pages, press releases, acquisition announcements, etc.).



You will be working from clear instructions and strict rules.



2.) What we’re looking for



Detail-oriented and accurate



Experience with business, financial, market, or investment research is a big plus



You do not need prior private equity experience — but you do need to be able to research, verify, and think logically.



3.) Performance expectations



You will be given a weekly research metric (example: 100 qualified buyers)



Accuracy matters more than speed



Buyers that do not meet criteria will not count



4.) Pay & incentives



Base pay: $100 USD per week (we can talk more if you bring more skills to the job)



Incentive: $0.50 USD for every additional qualified buyer above your weekly metric



Example: If your target is 100 buyers and you find 120 qualified buyers, you earn an extra $10 that week



Paid weekly



5.) Work schedule



Full-time



40 hours per week



Long-term role for the right person



To apply fill out this form below

title: AI Orchestrator & Experimental Systems Builder (n8n, Playwright, MCP)
description:
WHO WE ARE

We are a tech-forward Real Estate Company based in Singapore. We are moving away from traditional real estate workflows and building a fully automated, agentic business model. You will be the Technical Lead for our experimental division, working closely with our operations team to bridge the gap between "Ideas on X.com" and "Production-ready systems."



THE MISSION

We don't need a "
 beginner." We need a builder who can live in the experimental gray area. You will be responsible for deploying, maintaining, and scaling high-risk, high-reward automations.



Core Responsibilities:



Agentic Orchestration: Link Claude Desktop/AI Agents to our Notion Second Brain using MCP (Model Context Protocol) or custom REST API bridges for real-time brain dumps and auto-categorization.



Stealth Scraping: Build and maintain Playwright/Puppeteer scrapers for property portals that bypass modern DOM fingerprinting and rate-limiting using residential proxy rotation and stealth plugins.



Deployment & DevOps: Manage deployments on our RackNerd VPS using Docker/Portainer. You should be comfortable reading a raw GitHub README for an experimental AI tool and having a "Hello World" running in an hour.



Modular Support: Architect "Sub-workflow" patterns in n8n that are modular enough for our team to troubleshoot without needing a Senior Dev every time a node fails.



REQUIRED TECHNICAL STACK



n8n Mastery: Must understand Idempotent logic, Global Error Triggers, and Async Polling Loops for long-running video render jobs.



IDE Proficiency: You live in Cursor or VS Code. If you don't use AI to 10x your own development speed, you are the wrong fit.



State Management: You treat Notion/Google Sheets as a database with clear Status Flags (e.g., Scraped -> Drafted -> Reviewed -> Posted) to ensure zero double-posts or silent failures.



COMPENSATION & LOGISTICS



Rate: $6-$8 USD / hour



Type: Part-time (approx. 20 hours/week) with long-term growth potential.

Culture: We move fast. You will be expected to "test and learn" with new AI tools daily.



HOW TO APPLY (Automated Test)

Subject line: "Architect – [Your Favorite AI Tool]"

Explain: How do you handle asynchronous callback webhooks in n8n for a video API that takes 15 minutes to process?

Describe: Your strategy for bypassing Cloudflare 403 errors when scraping real estate listings.

- Increase to $4.50/hour after a 45-day review

- Annual performance reviews with potential increases



Additional Expections:

Exclusivity Requirement - This is a full-time role. Candidates must be fully available during scheduled work hours and may not work for other clients or employers during those hours. Failure to disclose additional employment may result in termination.



No Subcontracting Policy - This position does not allow subcontracting or outsourcing. The individual hired must personally complete all assigned work. Use of assistants, shared accounts, or third parties to complete tasks is not permitted.



How to Apply

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Elite Nannies on Demand is seeking a reliable, detail-oriented Administrative Assistant to support our growing team. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who thrives in a dynamic environment, enjoys variety in their day-to-day work, and is committed to helping a small business succeed.

Key Responsibilities :

Coordinate and assign nannies to open shifts, ensuring optimal coverage and client satisfaction

Assist with billing clients and processing payments to nannies accurately and on time

Support candidate screening and onboarding processes to maintain high-quality standards

Contact new client leads to schedule introductory calls with the owner (welcoming and appointment scheduling only, no sales)

 and schedule organization



?What We’re Looking For:

Proactive, self-motivated team player with a positive attitude?Exceptional organizational skills and keen attention to detail

Ability to manage multiple priorities and tasks efficiently

Strong English communication skills, both written and verbal

Comfortable working independently in a remote setting



Schedule & Compensation:Full-time, remote position

Required hours: 9 AM – 5 PM EST, Monday through Friday, If you are unable to commit to this schedule, please do not apply. ?Hourly rate: $6–$10/hour, commensurate with experience?If you are passionate about supporting small businesses, enjoy helping others, and want to make a meaningful impact in your work, we would love to hear from you. 



Because we’re a small team and want to respect your time, we do things a little differently. If you’re interested in this role, please create a short video (2–3 minutes) answering the questions below and
 it to our recruiter, Shanda, 



 Questions (2–3 minutes total):?

title: Facebook Media Buyer + GoHighLevel Specialist (Long Term Position)
description:
ABOUT ROOFIGNITE

RoofIgnite is a performance marketing agency based in Toronto, Canada. We help residential roofing contractors across the United States generate qualified homeowner leads through
 Ads and a lead qualification system.



We’re growing fast and need a dedicated Media Buyer to help us manage campaigns and keep things running smoothly.



THE ROLE

You’ll be handling the technical setup of
 campaigns and 
 
 for our roofing clients. You’ll also manage ongoing actions to ensure clients are successful based on performance data and KPIs. We have weekly meetings to review what’s working and what needs improvement.



WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:



Setting Up New Campaigns

-Create
 campaigns in Meta Ads Manager (structure, targeting, budgets)

-Build GoHighLevel funnels, landing pages, and automations (templates provided)

-Set up lead tracking, forms, and ensure pixels are firing correctly

-Handle A2P 10DLC setup (SMS registration and number transfers) and technical integrations

-Make sure all systems are connected so leads flow correctly



Managing Existing Campaigns

-Check performance daily/weekly (CPM, CPC, CTR, cost per lead, booking rates)

-Flag underperforming ad sets and campaigns

-Deploy new creatives when ready

-Fix technical issues (pixel issues, automation failures, tracking problems)

-Keep accounts organized and documented



Weekly Meetings & Reporting

-Pull weekly data and organize it clearly

-Join weekly meetings to discuss account status and blockers

-Share honest feedback and improvement ideas

-Respond quickly to urgent issues

-When something breaks, you fix it or clearly explain what’s wrong



WHO YOU ARE:



Experience You Need

-1–2+ years of hands-on experience with
/Meta Ads

-Strong GoHighLevel experience (funnels, automations, landing pages)

-Comfortable with technical setups: pixels, UTMs, API connections

-You understand CTR, CPM, CPC, cost per lead, and booking rates

-Experience with A2P setup is a plus



How You Work

-Detail-oriented and able to follow processes exactly

-Fast learner who takes feedback well

-Proactive — you don’t wait to be told what to do

-Clear English communication (written and spoken)

-Reliable and looking for long-term work

-Available during EST business hours



Nice to Have

-Experience with Zapier or project management tools

-Basic Canva skills

-Experience in roofing, HVAC, or home services

-Familiarity with call recording tools (Fathom, etc.)

-Ability to analyze data, create action plans, and execute



WORKING ENVIRONMENT

-Hours: 40–40+ hours per week, Monday–Friday, 9AM–6PM EST

-Flexible Saturday Availability as needed (Occasional Saturday morning meetings (weekly if needed))

-Team: Media buying and operations team

-Meetings: Weekly check-ins + occasional strategy calls



WHAT WE OFFER

-Salary: $900–$1,300 USD/month (net, based on experience)

-Performance Bonuses based on account results

-Growth opportunities as the company scales

-Long-term stability — we are building a real team



APPLICATION PROCESS



To apply, please provide:



-Speed Test Result: Run a test at https://www.speedtest.net

 and share the link or paste the result

 or 
 and answer:

--Your name and location

--Your experience with
 Ads and 
 (specific examples)

--Why you want to work with RoofIgnite

Optional but Helpful

 ad campaigns you’ve managed (results if available)

-Any workflows or automations you’ve created



Confirmation

-Include the phrase “I SAW THE FULL POST” in your application



WHY JOIN ROOFIGNITE

-You’ll learn how real marketing operations are run

-Non-corporate, energetic, ambitious team

-Clear growth path as we hire more people

NEXT STEPS

title: QA Engineer (Manual + Automation)
description:
And Studio + LIVE AI

About the Role



We’re looking for a QA Engineer to help us ensure high-quality releases across multiple web apps and AI-powered SaaS platforms. You’ll own QA execution (manual and automation), improve testing processes, and collaborate closely with our Project Manager and developers to prevent regressions and ship confidently.



This role is ideal if you enjoy a fast-moving environment, clear ownership, and building better systems—not just clicking through checklists.



What You’ll Work On



Performing manual QA across web applications (feature testing, regression testing, cross-browser testing)

Creating and maintaining test plans, test cases, and QA checklists in ClickUp

Writing clear, actionable bug reports with steps to reproduce, expected vs actual results, screenshots/video, and environment details

Collaborating with devs to validate fixes and ensure issues are truly resolved (including re-tests + regression checks)

Supporting release cycles by verifying “ready for deploy” criteria and post-deploy smoke tests

Helping us improve QA workflows and documentation (SOPs, definitions of done, acceptance criteria templates)

Automation QA (Strongly Preferred)

If you have automation experience, you’ll also help with:

Building and maintaining automated test suites (end-to-end and/or integration tests)

Setting up a practical automation approach that matches our stack and shipping speed

Running automated checks in CI when possible and keeping the suite stable and useful

(Nice) Reviewing or validating code changes from a QA perspective (risk spotting, edge cases)

Typical Projects You’ll Touch

AI knowledge bases and chatbot experiences

Client marketing websites + landing pages

Multi-tenant SaaS platforms

Integrations and workflows (e.g., CRMs, forms,
 sequences, automation tools)

Tools / Environment

ClickUp (task management, acceptance criteria, QA tracking)

GitHub (PRs, issues, collaboration)

Common web stack: React / Next.js, APIs, databases (varies by project)

Automation tools may include (depending on your experience): Playwright, Cypress, Selenium, or similar

(If you have a preferred automation stack, tell us what you’d use and why.)



Requirements

2+ years experience in QA testing for web applications (manual required)

Strong ability to write clear bug reports and communicate professionally async

Comfortable validating work against acceptance criteria and spotting edge cases

Organized and consistent: you keep test artifacts clean, updated, and reusable

High ownership: you follow issues through from discovery ? fix validation ? release confidence

Nice to Have

Automation QA experience (end-to-end tests, regression suites, CI runs)

Ability to inspect logs/network requests and do basic debugging

Familiarity with modern web apps (React/Next.js), APIs, and databases

Experience working with SaaS products, multi-tenant apps, or AI features

Experience collaborating with distributed teams across time zones

Reporting / Collaboration

You’ll work closely with our Project Manager / QA Lead (Micaella)

You’ll collaborate with developers daily to validate fixes and prevent rework

You’ll help us level up our quality systems—not just test outcomes





About Us

And Studio is a fast-growing digital agency and AI SaaS company, founded in 2014 with the vision of embracing possibilities and big dreams. Our name reflects our philosophy: we are all about "Yes AND Both."

Our core values are rooted in Christian principles:

Start Small, Dream Big

Living ---------- (Integrity & authenticity)

Prioritize People Over Projects

Make it Count

Find a Way & TEA (Test Every Assumption)

Unity, Speed, Ownership, Passion, Grace/Flexibility, Generosity

Engagement Details

Contract role: ~35–40 hours/week (flexible depending on fit and workload)

Remote — async-friendly with some overlap for check-ins

Competitive rate based on experience

Potential for long-term engagement based on performance and team needs



How to Apply

Send your application with:



Subject line: I Want to Work at And Studio - QA Engineer - [Your Full Name]

Include:



Brief intro (2–3 sentences max): why you want the role + why you’re a fit) - Video

Link to LinkedIn and/or portfolio (if applicable)

If you have automation experience: link to GitHub or examples of test work

Your availability (hours/week, timezone)

Hourly rate expectations

Short intro video about you and your QA experience

 to:  

 If selected, a short Google Meet video call will be required.

title: Instagram DM Outreach VA (Part-Time, Small Startup)
description:
About the Role



I’m a UK-based nurse running a small, early-stage skin and aesthetics startup alongside my clinical work. This is not a big agency or corporate clinic — it’s a lean, hands-on business in its early growth phase.



I’m looking for a reliable and thoughtful Instagram VA to help me start genuine conversations with potential clients via manual DM outreach and keep things organised behind the scenes. You will identify and message suitable potential clients on Instagram, help start genuine conversations, and organise warm leads so they can be booked in.



This role is part-time (5 hours per week) and suits someone who enjoys calm, consistent work rather than high-pressure sales. Sales experience preferential. 



What You’ll Be Doing



• Manually sending Instagram DMs and tracking what works. Scripts can be your own or provided. 

• Light personalisation (name, context — no spam)

• Responding to replies (tone will be kind, informative whilst also gently encouraging bookings)

• Tracking conversations and leads in a spreadsheet

• Flagging warm leads for me to follow up



You are not expected to hard sell, close clients, or message huge volumes. I am looking to create genuine leads and connections. You will send ~40 personalised DMs per hour, spread over 1 hour per day, focusing on quality conversations. You’ll also engage with relevant Instagram accounts by liking posts, replying to story mentions, and commenting thoughtfully. All activity should be human, careful, and non-spammy.



What I’m Looking For



Essential:

• Experience with Instagram DM outreach or lead generation

• Clear, friendly written English

• Reliable and organised

• Comfortable following instructions and scripts

• Respectful, non-pushy communication style



Nice to Have:



• Experience supporting small businesses or solo founders

• Experience in sales particularly within the skin or aesthetics sectors 

• Understanding of UK-based service businesses



Hours & Pay



• 5 hours per week to start

• Flexible schedule

• Pay reflects a small startup budget, with opportunity to increase hours and rate if the business grows



How to Apply



Please include:

 1. A short introduction

 2. Your experience with Instagram DM outreach

 3. An example of a friendly, non-salesy DM

 4. Start your application with the word “Success”

title: Surface Designer
description:
We are seeking an experienced Surface Designer with exceptional artistic and hand painting abilities to create original artwork across key product categories—including dinnerware, serveware, kitchen accessories, and seasonal/holiday programs. The ideal candidate blends fine art sensibilities with strong technical skills and understands how artwork translates onto three dimensional products. This role is highly collaborative and requires the ability to deliver production ready designs that support brand vision, market trends, and retailer needs.

Key Responsibilities

Category Focused Design Creation

• Conceptualize and develop surface patterns, motifs, and illustrations specifically for: 

o Dinnerware (decals, border designs, engineered artwork, reactive glaze mapping)

o Serveware (pattern placements, motifs tailored to silhouettes and materials)

o Kitchen Accessories (art for tools & gadgets, storage items, trays, cutting boards, etc.)

o Seasonal / Holiday Programs (collection driven artwork, themed motifs, color stories)

• Ensure artwork suits the materials, form, and manufacturing methods of each product category.

Artistic & Technical Execution

• Create hand drawn, painted, or illustrated artwork and convert it into polished digital formats ready for factory production.

• Prepare production-ready files, including: 

o Layered art files

o Color separations and Pantone specifications

o Repeat patterns and engineered placements

o Artwork scaled to product templates

• Maintain artistic integrity while adapting designs for manufacturing processes such as ceramic decals, print applications, and embellishments.



Education & Experience

• Bachelor’s degree in Fine Arts, Illustration, Surface Design, or equivalent experience.

• Minimum 3 years of experience in surface design for consumer goods, preferably tabletop or home décor.

• Strong portfolio demonstrating: 

o Hand painted and illustrated artwork

o Surface pattern collections

o Application of artwork to 3D products

o Commercial and trend aligned design development

Technical Skills

• Expert proficiency in Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop (Mac environment).

• Strong hand painting, drawing, and illustration capabilities across traditional mediums.

• Ability to create production ready artwork with precise file setup, color accuracy, and proper formatting.

• Understanding of decorative processes used in dinnerware and home products, including decals, print techniques, and embellishments.

title: Data Assistant
description:
Company Description



Charm is a GTM agency that works with clients in numerous industries and assists them by building and managing Customer Service, Sales, and Marketing teams. With more than 5 years of experience, Charm has established itself as an essential element of over 100 unique companies.





Client Description



The client is an online retailer for UTV (Utility Task Vehicles) parts. Founded in 2018, they are based in the US and primarily serve US customers.





Role Description



This position involves managing product data and ensuring accurate, up-to-date listings on UTV Source's ecommerce platform. Responsibilities include loading new products, updating product data, handling price adjustments, and using spreadsheets to analyze and manage data.





Requirements



Uploading new products to the ecommerce platform with all required data points (e.g., descriptions, SKUs, images, pricing).

TO APPLY:

ntum

Interested

title: Professional QA Engineer (Web)(Remote)
description:
Professional QA Engineer (Web Application)

We’re looking for a talented QA (Quality Assurance) Engineer to join our team and help ensure the quality, reliability, and usability of our web-based e-commerce platform. Our application enables users to buy gift cards, earn cashback, and access engaging digital experiences.

This is a key role where you’ll help guarantee stable, intuitive, and high-quality product releases, directly impacting how customers experience our platform. You will work closely with developers, designers, and product teams to validate functionality, improve testing processes, and represent the end-user perspective throughout the development lifecycle.

 

???? What You’ll Do

• Analyse end-user requirements and define comprehensive test plans.

• Execute test cases, identify defects, and propose possible improvements.

• Debug issues, document findings clearly, and follow up until resolution.

• Generate reports on test results, defects, and quality metrics.

• Define testing priorities aligned with system requirements and releases.

• Document system functionalities and expected behaviours.

• Represent the end-user perspective to ensure requirements are correctly implemented.

• Identify opportunities to improve both QA processes and the software development lifecycle.

 

? What We’re Looking For

• 3+ years of experience testing web-based applications.

• Strong knowledge of testing methodologies and QA tools.

• Experience creating test plans, writing test cases, and debugging issues.

• Good understanding of web technologies (frontend and backend basics).

• Experience testing mobile applications is a plus.

• Familiarity with cross-browser and cross-device testing tools (e.g., BrowserStack) is a plus.

• Good English communication skills, especially for writing clear documentation and test reports



 

???? Why Join Us?

• Remote-friendly: Collaborate from anywhere.

• Impactful role: Help ensure product quality and reliability across critical user journeys.

• Modern tech stack: Work with web technologies, modern testing tools, and cloud-based platforms (AWS).

• Growing business: Be part of a scaling platform shaping the digital gift card market
