The ideal candidate will integrate Copilot across multiple business systems so teams can search, retrieve, and act on data across all applications through a unified AI interface.



This role supports departments including HR, Payroll, Finance, Operations, and Client Services, with strict HIPAA and PHI compliance requirements.



Please
 your resume and experience: 

Be detailed in why this job is best for you.



Contract Details:

Type: Independent Contractor

Length: 12 months

Engagement: Ongoing implementation, optimization, and support

Extension: Possible based on performance and organizational needs



Core Responsibilities:

AI & Automation

-Deploy, configure, and manage Microsoft Copilot across the organization

-Design and implement Copilot-based automation workflows

-Build and manage AI agents to streamline operational tasks

-Develop Power Automate flows for cross-platform automation

-Build Power Apps for custom internal tools, data capture, and workflow control

-Create AI-driven dashboards and reporting using Power BI

-Enable Copilot to search and act across all integrated business systems



System Integrations:

-Design and maintain integrations between:

-DocuSign

-Paylocity (Velocity)

-Therap

-QuickBooks

-ClickUp

-Microsoft 365 ecosystem

-Build API integrations within Copilot

-Develop custom APIs or middleware where native integrations do not exist

-Centralize, normalize, and synchronize data across platforms

-Ensure data is accessible through Copilot for search, insights, and automation



Data & Infrastructure:

-Implement and manage Azure Blob Storage for structured and unstructured data

-Store and manage Power BI data and application outputs

-Build secure data pipelines and connectors

-Ensure system reliability, performance, and scalability

-Support Power BI custom API integrations and advanced data modeling



Security & Compliance:

-Enforce HIPAA and PHI compliance standards

-Participate in and adhere to a defined HIPAA security checklist

-Configure Copilot security boundaries and governance controls



Implement:

-Role-based access control

-Encryption at rest and in transit

-Audit logging and monitoring

-Ensure secure handling of employee, client, and operational data



Programming & Technical Work:

-Write custom scripts and code for automation and integrations

-Develop API wrappers and custom connectors

-Troubleshoot and optimize workflows and system performance

-Maintain clear technical documentation and SOPs for all systems built

-Support long-term maintainability and operational handoff



Required Skills & Experience

Expert-Level Experience Required

-Microsoft Copilot and AI Agents

-Power Apps (core requirement)

-Power Automate

-Power BI, including custom API usage



Azure services:

-Blob Storage

-APIs

-Logic Apps

-Functions

-API development and integration (REST, JSON)

-Business system integration across HR, Payroll, Finance, and Operations

-HIPAA and PHI security requirements and best practices



Technical Capabilities:

-Building custom internal business applications

-Low-code and custom-code hybrid development

-Scripting or programming experience:

-PowerShell

-Python

-JavaScript or similar

-Strong process-mapping and workflow translation skills

-Ability to turn business requirements into scalable technical solutions



Success Criteria:

-Reduction of manual data entry and duplicate work

-Centralized visibility and reporting across systems

-Increased automation coverage across departments

-Improved compliance posture and data security

-Measurable time savings and operational efficiency gains

-Effective Copilot adoption across business workflows

title: Sales
description:
JR CLOUD TECHNOLOGIES

AI-Powered Business Solutions



NOW HIRING

Voice AI Sales Closer

Commission-Based  |  Remote  |  Unlimited Earning Potential

Every business you call has the same problem: missed calls = missed money. Our AI Voice Receptionist answers every call in 2 rings, 24/7, books appointments, and qualifies leads — sounding completely human. You don’t convince anyone they have a problem. You show them the solution.



Why This Opportunity Is Different

?	The product demos itself. Call our AI live with the prospect right there. They hear it answer, ask questions, book an appointment. Jaws drop.

?	29 industry-specific demos ready to go. HVAC, dental, legal, real estate, auto, restaurants, salons, medical — walk into any business with a custom demo for their industry.

?	Massive untapped market. 93% of small businesses still answer phones manually or don’t answer at all. You’re the first person showing them this technology exists.

?	Built-in lead generation. Our proprietary tool finds businesses, scores them by likelihood to buy, and gives you a prioritized call list. No guessing.



Compensation

Generous commission on every deal you close. Top performers earn bonuses and first access to management roles with residual income. This is commission-based because we want closers, not clock-punchers. If you can sell, you’ll eat well here.



What You’ll Do

?	Prospect using our lead scoring tool — find businesses by industry, city, and pain points

?	Reach out by phone, text, walk-in, or DM — we provide scripts and objection-handling guides

?	Demo the AI receptionist live on a call — let the product do the heavy lifting

?	Close the deal — we handle all onboarding, setup, and ongoing support



Who You Are

?	Sales experience in any field — HVAC, plumbing, electrical, legal, medical, dental, roofing, solar, insurance, real estate, SaaS, D2D, or just a natural closer

?	Self-motivated and disciplined — you don’t need someone managing your calendar

?	Comfortable on the phone and face-to-face with business owners

?	Entrepreneurial mindset — you treat this like your own business



Ready to Close?

We’re hiring a small team of reps in select markets. Spots are limited.

Apply:

JR Cloud Technologies LLC

title: Lead Generator For Bookkeeping
description:
About Us:

We specialize in providing top-tier bookkeeping services tailored to businesses' unique needs. With a dedicated team of professionals, we ensure accuracy, efficiency, and peace of mind for our clients. As we continue to expand, we are looking for a skilled Lead Generation Specialist to join us in filling our calendar with high-quality leads, utilizing your expertise in cold calling and cold
ing.



Job Description:

We are seeking a proactive Lead Generation Specialist who excels in cold calling and cold
ing techniques to fill our calendar with qualified leads. Your primary responsibility will be to identify and engage potential clients who can benefit from our bookkeeping services. You will play a pivotal role in driving business growth by generating a steady stream of leads and nurturing them through the sales pipeline.



Responsibilities:

- Utilize your experience in cold calling and cold
ing to prospect and qualify potential clients.

- Research and identify target industries and market segments to focus lead generation efforts effectively.

- Develop and execute strategic outreach campaigns to engage prospects and schedule appointments.

- Effectively communicate the value proposition of our bookkeeping services to potential clients.

- Maintain accurate records of all lead generation activities and outcomes using CRM software.

- Collaborate closely with the sales team to ensure a smooth handover of qualified leads.

- Continuously optimize lead generation strategies based on performance metrics and feedback.



Requirements:

- Proven track record of success in lead generation, particularly in cold calling and cold
ing, preferably in a B2B environment.

- Excellent communication and negotiation skills, with the ability to build rapport and overcome objections effectively.

- Strong organizational skills and attention to detail to manage a high volume of leads and appointments.

- Experience using CRM software and other sales and marketing tools to track and manage leads.

- Self-motivated with a results-oriented mindset and the ability to work autonomously.

- Knowledge of bookkeeping or accounting principles is a plus but not required.

- Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field is preferred.



Benefits:

- Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.

- Flexible remote work environment.

- Opportunities for career advancement and professional development.

- Joining a dynamic team of professionals passionate about delivering exceptional bookkeeping services.

- Work-life balance with a supportive company culture.

-Unlimited Earning Potential with a Base Salary+ Commissions for every close deal!





If you are a proactive and results-driven individual with experience in cold calling and cold
ing, we want to hear from you! Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and how you can contribute to our lead generation efforts.

title: Editor (DaVinci Resolve Required) — Short-Form Process Films (YouTube)
description:
Overview



We’re looking for an Editor to cut ~15-minute YouTube films that document hands-on building and craft processes.



The footage has already been reduced by an associate editor (dead time removed, repetition minimized). Your role is true editorial shaping: structure, pacing, rhythm, and d
 which 
nts deserve attention.





Editorial inspiration blends:



- The calm, observational style of Martijn Doolaard (shorter, more concise), and



- Selective fast, compressed sequences to move quickly through repetitive labor when appropriate.



This is not a social-media template role and not an assistant editor position. You’ll be doing the actual cut.





What You’ll Be Editing



- Observational process footage (building, assembly, craft)



- A relevance-based rough cut prepared by an associate editor



The material still needs:



- Clear structure



- Strong pacing



- Editorial judgment



- Thoughtful modulation between stillness and 
ntum





Responsibilities



- Shape the final ~15-minute edit from a reduced rough cut



- D
 when to slow down and let 
nts breathe



- D
 when to speed up and compress repetitive actions



- Maintain clarity of process without becoming instructional or verbose



- Iterate collaboratively based on feedback



- Deliver clean, reviewable cuts with clear communication





Editorial Style & Judgment



The ideal edit:



- Feels intentional and restrained, not flashy



- Holds attention without gimmicks



- Balances calm observation with 
nts of kinetic energy



- Compresses time where repetition exists



- Preserves atmosphere and texture



We’re looking for an editor who can move comfortably between quiet and fast—sometimes within the same sequence.





Workflow & Tools



- Editing in DaVinci Resolve (Free version is fine)



- Work is done using proxy files only (original camera files are never shared)



- Short review cycles rather than a single final delivery



- Files and feedback shared asynchronously, with occasional live reviews if helpful





Time Expectations



- Footage is already reduced, so total edit time is less than a full raw-footage edit



- Emphasis is on quality and decisiveness, not grinding through hours of material



- We value attentiveness and turnaround over speed for speed’s sake





Compensation



- $10–15/hour, depending on experience and fit



- Paid hourly or per block, with clear review checkpoints



- Long-term collaboration preferred if the fit is strong





Ideal Background



- Experience editing documentary, process, or observational footage



- Comfortable shaping structure and pacing from imperfect material



- Able to articulate why a 
nt works (or doesn’t)



- Confident owning editorial decisions and iterating with feedback



- Strong attention to detail and communication





This Role Is Not



- An assistant editor position



- A TikTok or short-form template job



- A marketing or ad-style edit



- A handoff-and-disappear freelance gig





How We Work



You’ll be trusted to edit independently, with direction and feedback provided along the way. This role is for someone who enjoys shaping meaning from process—not just executing instructions.





Next steps:



- A short conversation, followed by



- A small, paid working session to confirm editorial fit





If this role sounds aligned with your experience and interests, please submit your application directly through OnlineJobs.ph. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted via the platform to move forward. 



For role-related questions only: Contact (EA): Josh — WhatsApp:

title: Full-time Bookkeeper
description:
Who We Are -



Hello; my name is Casandra Armstrong, and I am the President of Resilient Pro Group LLC. We are an accounting and tax firm based out of Phoenix, AZ (United States).



We are a small, but growing company and are experiencing quite a bit of growth. This has pushed the need for us to hire you, our newest tea
mber.



We help small businesses, just like ours, maintain, manage, and grow their businesses by ensuring accurate financials, processing payroll for their employees, tax preparation and strategy. We ensure we can take as much off the owner’s plate as possible while building trust within our working relationships.



You’re probably wondering if you would be our first Filipino tea
mber?



Actually, no. We currently have 4 tea
mbers who are from the Philippines like yourself. We have 2 bookkeeping specialists, a payroll specialist, and a tax specialist that are based in the Philippines as well. In addition to them, our operations manager is US based.



If you’re wondering what you would be doing?



The job title is Bookkeeping Specialist. I am looking for someone who can perform detailed bookkeeping for several small business clients. Your primary duties as a bookkeeper would include document processing, data entry, account reconciliation, ledger management, and financial report processing while understanding the business structure and needs. We are QuickBooks based, so a QuickBooks background is required. However, we will also train on processes.





So, why should you join us over anyone and everyone else?



If you would like…

1) a steady pay check with the chance for bonuses based on performance,

2) the opportunity to work from home without a boss breathing down your neck,

3) a team environment where you work with others to share the work, and

4 ) if you want to work for a stable, growing U.S. firm,

…then this is a job you will enjoy and excel at.





How to know if you’re qualified for this opportunity?



We are looking for someone who has bookkeeping experience, complete understanding of debits and credits, assets and liabilities, inter-company transfers, problem solving skills, fluent in English speaking and writing with the experience of speaking directly with US clients, and most importantly someone who can work with little to no direction and meet deadlines. We do not expect you to know it all as we will train you in your position with everything you need to know about our clients and our field for you to be able to excel at your job.



I do need you to be a good leader- someone who can effectively manage him or herself at the job as well as manage others; someone who has extensive attention to detail, can manage and meet deadlines, follow processes and provide ideas for enhanced processes, problem solve and troubleshoot on their own with little to no direction, be able to effectively resolve issues with upset clients. Intermediate bookkeeping/accounting experience, and QuickBooks experience is required.



I also cannot teach you to have a good attitude and to be self-motivated. These are things you must demonstrate in the interview process.



A successful applicant must be able to demonstrate:



* A can do attitude, and the ability to work without constant supervision

* Be able to speak in conversational English and write in passable English as well

* Knowledge of Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, Dropbox, QuickBooks, and general ability to use windows based software

* Have or be willing to obtain Internet fast enough to allow for virtual meeting such as zoom and VOIP phone calls without degradation

* Working microphone and Internet video camera

* Workstation with 2 monitors



So, what are the working hours?



As I stated before, our company is based in Phoenix, Arizona so we would require you to work during the US business hours, Monday to Friday 8:00am to 5:00pm Arizona Time



What about pay?



We are serious about hiring someone and are looking to fill this position ASAP. I also want this to be a real job that can meet your financial needs. Therefore, pay is negotiable but know I want you to be happy and satisfied working here, and a good pay scale is part of that.



What about the 13th Month?



Wondering if we pay the 13th month? Unfortunately, we do not. However, we do offer other benefits such as pay time off, holiday pay, and sick time for Full-Time positions. These benefits begin to accrue after your 90 days probation period of a full-time position.



What happens next?



Since our jobs are so popular we generally get deluged with applicants. So, I have designed a multi-part interview process to make the process as simple and efficient for all parties.



The first part of the interview process is designed to examine your English-speaking & writing skills, personality type, internet speed and ability to follow directions. Please realize the initial application process will take a time commitment on your part of roughly 10-20 minutes. Since this job is intended to be well paying, I hope this time commitment is acceptable to you. Please be advised that those who submit incomplete applications will be passed over.



If you make it through this first round, we will talk via video chat to answer any questions you may have as well as get to know you better. If this goes well, I will invite you to meet some other tea
mbers, as well as call your references to see if there is still a good fit.



We will then ultimately hire someone.





How to Apply



Therefore, to submit your application for the job, please complete all of the following and
 them to me at the reply to
 address: 
 Please send me all the following to applications at resilientpros dot com

a. Your resume

b. Link to your onlinejobs.ph profile and,

c. Names with your relationship for 3 people I can contact whom would say good things about working with you. This could be a priest, former employer, bank manager, school teacher, but no more than 1 of these people can be a family member.

/leveltest/grammar_level_test.htm

/tools/speed-test/work-from-home-speed

title: Senior Property Manager
description:
We are seeking an experienced Senior Property Manager to oversee daily operations, lead and support junior property managers, and ensure smooth management of our residential and/or commercial properties. This role requires strong knowledge of U.S. property management practices, excellent leadership skills, and the ability to balance tenant relations, operational efficiency, and team leadership in a fast-paced environment.



RESPONSIBILITIES

Oversee tenant communications, lease renewals, and resolution of escalated tenant concerns

Support leasing activities, including coordinating listings, property showings, applicant screening, and lease documentation

Ensure compliance with lease terms, investigate violations, and handle tenant disputes professionally

Coordinate with vendors for maintenance, repairs, and improvements; support larger renovation projects as needed

Collaborate with leadership on operational improvements and property performance strategies

Monitor property financial performance, including budgeting, tracking actuals vs. budget, and recommending strategies to improve financial outcomes



REQUIREMENTS

Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

Proven experience in U.S. residential and/or commercial property management

Previous experience leading or supervising a property management team

Experience using AppFolio or similar property management software

Ability to work during U.S. business hours

Can start within 2 weeks of receiving an offer

Personal laptop or desktop computer

Headset and webcam

Stable internet connection

Backup power and internet options

Comfortable using time-tracking tools

Proficiency with Microsoft Office and Google Workspace



COMPENSATION

Salary: Php 70k - 80k

Health insurance

Paid time off

title: Shopify Web Developer - CRO Specialist - Ecommerce Advertising Agency - Full Time 1b
description:
APPLY ON MY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED: 





CRO Shopify Web Developer – Job Overview

I am looking for an experienced shopify web developer to help me upgrade client’s checkout processes and execute CRO tests for various ecommerce brands.

In this role you will update Shopify theme templates, develop landing pages using various page builders and html/CSS frameworks, research/install various checkout/bundle applications, and implement A/B tests using testing tools like intelligems.

You will also report on test performance, and provide suggestions for next steps.

This is a full-time opportunity. Training will be provided and you will work directly with me.



About Zack Miller

My name is Zack Miller, and I’ve been a DTC Ecommerce Growth Marketer since 2019. I’ve done everything fro
dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.



Note: All Remote Employees Must Be Available To Work During The Following Business Hours:

Monday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Tuesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Wednesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Thursday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Friday: 9am – 5:30pm EST



Roles & Responsibilities

- Develop landing pages using Figma and various WYSYWIG editors including but not limited to Replo and Pagefly.

- Edit product, collection and other page templates using Shopify Liquid template engine, and various HTML/CSS frameworks.

- Install various checkout/tracking applications (aftersell, Zipify OCU, Upstack, etc)

- Install various applications for product bundling when needed, and create product bundles. 

- Install tracking pixels on client’s websites

- Implement A/B tests in intelligems for product price tests, shipping price tests, theme tests, landing page tests, and more. 

- Research new ideas for direct response content marketing strategies.

- Work in my project management system, ClickUp.

- Apply a process-first mentality and provide feedback to help further develop our operating systems.



Required Experience & Education

- Strong verbal and written English language skills (American Dialect)

- Strong knowledge of HTML/CSS/Javascript/Shopify Liquid required. 

- Knowledge of Python and Ruby preferred but not required.

- 1+ years of web development (Shopify) experience required

- 1+ years of backend python (flask/django) development experience preferred but not required

- 1+ years of marketing agency experience preferred but not required

- Must be highly organized and possess strong attention to detail

- All applicants are encouraged to apply, regardless of experience or education



APPLY ON MY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED:

title: Amazon FBA Administrator (Experienced – Part Time)
description:
Location: Remote

Hours: Part-time – 4.5 hours per day

Schedule: Monday to Friday, UK time 10:00am–2:30pm

Salary: $240 USD per month

Start Date: ASAP

This role will start part-time, with a strong opportunity to move to full-time hours within 3 months based on performance.



About the Role

We are hiring an experienced Amazon FBA Administrator to support the day-to-day operations of our Amazon business. This role is suited to someone who has already worked in an Amazon FBA administrative position, understands Seller Central well, and can work independently without constant supervision.

We are looking for someone proactive, who brings ideas, identifies inefficiencies, and can help reduce costs and protect revenue through better systems and processes.

This is not a beginner role. Applicants must already be confident working inside Amazon Seller Central.



Key Responsibilities



Amazon & Inventory Operations

Track inbound shipments into Amazon and ensure inventory is correctly received

Monitor deliveries into prep centres and confirm all stock is fully accounted for

Run replenishment reports to support inventory planning

Manage and maintain accurate Cost of Goods (COGs)



Finance & Documentation

Track, organise, and store supplier and logistics invoices

Maintain clear, well-organised digital records



Reimbursements & Issue Resolution

Identify, manage, and resolve Amazon reimbursement cases

Liaise with Amazon Seller Support to recover funds for damaged or broken units

Investigate inventory discrepancies and take corrective action



 & Communication

Manage operational
 inboxes

Identify issues quickly and resolve them efficiently



Returns & Reverse Logistics

List returned items on online marketplaces

Manage shipping for returned items

Coordinate return of problematic stock to original vendors



Proactive Improvements

Identify opportunities to improve processes and reduce costs

Propose and implement approved ideas that add measurable value to the business



Required Experience & Skills (Must Have)

3+ years’ experience working within the Amazon FBA space

Minimum 2 years’ experience in an Amazon FBA administrative role (required)

Strong working knowledge of Amazon Seller Central

High level of written and spoken English — must be confident communicating clearly and professionally

Excellent organisational skills and attention to detail

Comfortable working with spreadsheets and reports

Ability to work independently and take ownership of tasks

Experience with reimbursements, prep centres, inventory reconciliation, and reverse logistics is a strong advantage.



Important Notes

This role requires strong English communication skills

Applicants without prior Amazon FBA administrative experience will not be considered

You must be available to work during UK business hours (10:00am–2:30pm UK time)



How to Apply

Please include:

A brief summary of your Amazon FBA administrative experience

The Seller Central tasks you have managed previously

One example of a process improvement or cost-saving idea you implemented

title: YouTube Thumbnail Designer
description:
We are looking for a consistent, long-term thumbnail designer who will conduct topic research  and make YouTube thumbnails.



We run multiple faceless YouTube channels that need consistent thumbnails. This role is less about making "cool/pretty" designs and more about the psychology behind making people click on our videos.



This is a long-term position requiring about 20-30 hours per week (Flexible hours), and making 40-100 thumbnails a week using AI tools and Canva to speed up the process. The job pays $2 per hour with a pay increase based on performance.



Responsibilities



1. Research: You must regularly conduct research on YouTube topics to come up with titles and thumbnails.

2. Thumbnail Design: Make thumbnails using images from the web, AI image tools, and Canva, focusing on layout and composition. We are NOT just looking for pretty images.

3. Titles: Come up with compelling titles based on your research and our guidelines.



Requirements:



1. Experience driving views to YouTube videos with your thumbnail designs.

2. Understand what makes people click on a video.

3. Familiarity with tools like Canva and prompting AI image generators.

Complete a test task.



Pay:



1. $2 USD per hour

2. Paid on the 1st and 15th of every month

3. Must have a Payoneer

4. 20 hours a week, but Flexible hours (Work on your own time)



If you’re passionate about creating work that drives results and want consistent work long-term, reply now! Tell us why you’re the perfect fit for this role. We will send you the application form with the test task to apply. Use "TTND25" as the subject of your message so we know you’re a serious candidate.

title: Project Lead
description:
Role Overview



We are looking for a Venture Project Lead who can take ideas from concept to execution. This role is highly hands-on and requires strong ownership, critical thinking, and the ability to move projects forward without constant oversight.



You will act as the point person for new initiatives, coordinating across teams, driving execution, and ensuring projects are delivered on time and aligned with business goals.



Key Responsibilities

1. End-to-End Project Ownership

2. Take full ownership of new initiatives once an idea is introduced

3. Clarify project scope, objectives, and success criteria

4. Drive projects from research through execution and delivery

5. Conduct market, operational, and feasibility research

6. Identify required tools, platforms, vendors, and internal resources

7. Build clear execution plans with realistic timelines and milestones

8. Coordinate with internal teams including operations, marketing, and clinical or remote staff as needed

9. Work with content writers, website teams, GHL specialists, and external vendors

10. Ensure projects stay on track without micromanagement

11. Make execution-level decisions independently within defined limits

12. Identify risks, blockers, and dependencies early

13. Escalate only when necessary for budget, scope, or major constraints

14 Provide concise, actionable updates focused on progress, timelines, outcomes, and blockers

15. Communicate clearly and efficiently with leadership



Required Qualifications



Proven experience in project management, operations, venture building, or business execution

Strong ability to translate ideas into actionable plans

Comfortable working cross-functionally with diverse teams

Excellent organizational and prioritization skills

Strong written and verbal communication skills

High level of ownership, accountability, and follow-through

Able to work independently and thrive in a fast-moving environment



Working hours: 9 AM to 6 PM; Pacific time with time tracker

title: Amazon Affiliate Website Manager
description:
Position Description

Job Title: Amazon Affiliate Website Manager

Company: Logic Minds 

Location: Remote – Philippines (Work from Home)

Employment Type: Full-Time

Remuneration: Negotiable

________________________________________

Position Overview

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Amazon Affiliate Website Manager to set up, manage, and grow multiple affiliate websites. The role involves end-to-end responsibility for website development, SEO optimisation, content strategy, traffic acquisition, and affiliate revenue growth. The successful candidate will be proactive, data-driven, and capable of working independently while delivering measurable results.

YOU MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE with AMAZON AFFILIATE WEBSITES to be considered.

We will not respond if you have no experience.

You will need to work Melbourne, Australian hours. 8.30am - 5.30pm

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

• Website Setup & Management

o Build, configure, and maintain WordPress (or equivalent CMS) websites for Amazon affiliate programs.

o Ensure fast, secure, and mobile-friendly site performance.

o Implement structured product comparison tables, review layouts, and affiliate link tracking.



• Content Strategy & Creation

o Develop content plans for product reviews, buying guides, and blogs targeting profitable niches.

o Coordinate with writers/designers (in-house or freelance) to ensure SEO-friendly, high-quality content.

o Upload, format, and optimise content for readability and conversion.



• Affiliate Program Management

o Manage Amazon Associates accounts, ensuring compliance with Amazon’s policies.

o Insert, track, and optimise affiliate links and product promotions.

o Monitor affiliate dashboards and report on earnings, trends, and conversion rates.



• SEO & Digital Marketing

o Conduct keyword research and competitor analysis to drive targeted traffic.

o Optimise on-page SEO (titles, meta tags, alt text, schema, internal linking).

o Build backlinks and implement off-page SEO strategies.

o Track site analytics (Google Analytics, Search Console) and adjust strategy.



• Performance & Reporting

o Provide weekly/monthly performance reports (traffic, rankings, conversions, earnings).

o Continuously test strategies to improve CTR and conversion rates.

o Recommend new niches and growth opportunities.

________________________________________



Key Skills & Requirements

• Strong knowledge of Amazon Affiliate / Associates Program.

• Hands-on experience with WordPress, Elementor, WooCommerce (or similar platforms).

• Proficiency in SEO best practices, Google Analytics, Search Console, and keyword tools (Ahrefs, SEMrush, Ubersuggest, etc.).

• Familiarity with affiliate link management plugins (ThirstyAffiliates, Lasso, etc.).

• Ability to create and implement content marketing strategies.

• Strong research, analytical, and reporting skills.

• Experience with basic graphic editing (Canva/Photoshop) is a plus.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

• Self-motivated, reliable, and able to work independently with minimal supervision.

________________________________________

Qualifications

• Minimum 2 years’ experience in affiliate marketing, SEO, or website management.

• Demonstrated success in growing traffic and affiliate revenue.

• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, IT, Business, or related field (preferred, not required).

________________________________________

Reporting Structure

• Reports directly to: Business Owner & Offshore Team Manager

• Works closely with: In house Content writers, designers, SEO consultants (as required).

________________________________________

Remuneration & Benefits

• Competitive salary in PHP (based on experience).

• Performance-based incentives/bonuses linked to revenue growth.

• Salary will be received every 15th or 16th day of each month.

• Holidays: 20 days paid holiday per year accrued.

• Sick Leave: 10 days paid sick leave per year accrued. 

• You will receive a 13th Month bonus paid each December pro-rata of your employment. Note: 13th month bonus is only applicable to staff who are still with the company on month of December. 

• Public Holidays: Australian Public Holidays

• Flexible working hours (output and results driven).

• Long-term career development with opportunities to scale responsibilities as websites grow.

• We require a one (1) month Leave Notice for any plans of Resignation. Anything before that will be deducted from your month’s salary. 

________________________________________

Equipment Must Haves: 

• Own computer or laptop & two screens (monitors).

• Excellent working headphones and video camera.

• Excellent internet connection, and back-up for any internet/power interruption.





Note: For all interested applicants, send a message here with "AMAZON I'm in" in Subject Line.

title: Marketing & Business Development Specialist (SaaS)
description:
About Us

We’re a SaaS company focused on customer engagement solutions. We’re expanding our marketing and business development efforts and need a skilled professional who can manage campaigns, capture leads, and support growth initiatives across both private sector and government opportunities.



Role Overview

As our Marketing & Business Development Specialist, you’ll own the funnel end to end: managing paid campaigns, creating content, analyzing results, and engaging directly with prospects and customers. While you will engage in outreach through calls,
s, and LinkedIn, this is not an SDR role. Your foundation must be in marketing. This position is for someone who is proactive, comfortable speaking with prospects and customers, and not limited to working behind the scenes.



Key Responsibilities

Marketing & Lead Generation

• Plan and execute lead generation campaigns across Google Ads, LinkedIn, and
, with the ability to expand into channels such as YouTube, Reddit, review sites (G2, Capterra, etc) or other relevant B2B platforms.

• Monitor campaign performance, optimize targeting and messaging, and report on ROI.

• Write ad copy, landing page content, CTAs, case studies, and social posts to support campaign efforts. 

• Create marketing collateral such as proposals, presentations, and project sheets.

• Collaborate with maintaining and updating the company website, social media, and digital presence.

title: Creative Strategist
description:
We’re an established e-commerce brand scaling paid social, and we’re looking for a Performance Creative Strategist to help us build a repeatable, data-driven creative system.



This is not an ad-hoc editing role and not a “brainstorm ideas” position.

Your job is to research what’s working in the market, translate that into clear creative hypotheses, and feed our video editors and designers with direction that converts.



You will work closely with the founder / CMO (media buyer) and plug into an existing Slack-based workflow.



What you’ll own (week to week):



1. Competitor & Market Research



Analyze competitor ads (Meta Ads Library + market leaders)



Identify patterns in hooks, angles, beliefs, and offers



Distill insights into what we should test next (not just observations)



2. Creative Hypotheses



Produce 3–6 testable creative hypotheses per week



Each hypothesis should include:



Core belief / angle



Why it should work



How it should be expressed visually



What metric it’s expected to impact (hook rate, hold rate, CTR, etc.)



3. Editor-Ready Creative Briefs



Turn winning hypotheses into clear briefs for video editors



Briefs should include hooks, structure, visual direction, references, and do/don’t guidance



Editors should be able to execute without clarification



4. Performance Interpretation



Review ad performance data



Identify what to kill, iterate, or scale



Feed learnings back into the next round of creative testing



5. Funnel & CVR Input (High-Level)



Provide strategic input on funnel logic and landing page friction



Identify when an angle may require more education vs a direct PDP



You will not implement pages or manage Ads Manager — this stays with the CMO



What this role is NOT:



Not video editing



Not graphic design



Not Ads Manager / media buying



Not building landing pages in Replo



Not brand-only or “vibes-based” creative



Ideal Experience:



3+ years working with paid social creative (Meta)



Proven experience in e-commerce / DTC



Strong understanding of direct-response frameworks (PAS, JTBD, belief-led angles)



Comfortable working from performance data



Experience collaborating with editors and designers



Clear, structured communicator (Slack-first environment)



Bonus (not required):



Experience with health / wellness / consumer education products



Experience building creative systems at scale

title: Appointment Setter / Lead Qualifier (Immediate Start | No Closing | Long-Term Opportunity)
description:
ABOUT US

We are a growing digital automation and marketing business working with U.S.-based local service businesses.

We value professionalism, clear communication, and results.



ABOUT THE ROLE

We are looking for a reliable, professional Appointment Setter who can start immediately.

Your responsibility is to reach out to business owners, qualify real interest, and book high-quality appointments.

- Immediate start required

- No selling or closing required

- Scripts, qualification rules, and booking link provided

- Leads sourced from public listings (Google Maps, etc.)

- Focus is on quality appointments, not volume



MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

- Find potential clients using Google Maps and public business listings

- Make outbound calls to U.S.-based business owners

- Follow provided scripts and qualification process

- Ask key questions to confirm real interest and fit

- Book validated, confirmed appointments on our calendar

- Log notes and follow up as instructed



IMPORTANT QUALITY STANDARD

Appointments should ONLY be booked if the prospect:

- Is a decision-maker

- Has a real business

- Clearly understands the purpose of the call

- Expresses genuine interest in solving a business problem

- Confirms they will attend the scheduled call



- Calendar fillers and low-intent bookings are not acceptable



REQUIREMENTS

- Experience in appointment setting, cold calling, or outbound outreach

- Clear, neutral English speaking ability (calls are made to U.S. businesses)

- Professional phone presence (no forced or fake accents)

- Comfortable speaking with business owners

- Able to follow scripts and qualification rules

- Reliable internet connection and availability



NICE TO HAVE (NOT REQUIRED)

- Cold calling experience

- CRM experience (GoHighLevel or similar)

- Previous appointment-setting role



COMPENSATION

- Base pay: $2–$3 per hour (based on experience)

- Bonus: Paid per qualified, showed-up appointment + high commission 

- Payment: Bi-Weekly



WORK DETAILS

- Start date: Immediate

- Hours: 20–40 hours per week

- Schedule: Must align with U.S. business hours

- Position type: Long-term



HOW TO APPLY

Please start your application with the word READY and answer the following:

- Do you have experience with appointment setting or cold calling?

- Are you comfortable making calls to U.S. business owners?

- Can you speak English clearly and professionally on the phone?

- Are you available to start immediately?



TYPE OF EMPLOYMENT

- Any (Part-Time or Full-Time)



DESIRED NO. OF HOURS PER WEEK

- 40



WAGE / SALARY

- $2–$3 per hour + performance bonuses



SKILLS TO SELECT

- Appointment Setting

- Lead Generation

- CRM Management

title: Executive Assistant to Two CEOs – Multi-Business Operations
description:
USA-Based Leadership | Remote | California Time Zone Required



About Us



We are a fast-growing group of operating companies spanning automotive, logistics, transportation, franchising, hospitality, and experiential services. Our portfolio includes:



Car Dealership



Auto Body Shop



Auto Mechanic Shop



Car Rental Company



Amazon Logistics & Delivery Operations



The UPS Store Franchise



Passenger Transportation & Wine Tour Company



The businesses are led by two hands-on CEOs (husband and wife) who are deeply involved in strategy, execution, and growth. We are seeking an exceptional Executive Assistant who can function as a trusted operational partner and extension of leadership.



This role is high-responsibility, fast-paced, and intellectually demanding. It is ideal for someone who thrives under pressure, learns quickly, and enjoys managing complexity across multiple business units.



Position Overview



The Executive Assistant will act as the right hand to both CEOs, supporting daily operations, executive communications, cross-business coordination, and HR, research, licensing, and compliance activities to ensure smooth daily operations across all businesses.



This is not a traditional administrative role. You will be expected to understand business context, anticipate needs, manage competing priorities, and proactively solve problems. The right candidate thinks strategically, executes reliably, and remains calm and effective in high-stress environments.



This role requires working full-time on California business hours (PST/PDT).

Your work and performance will be tracked through Hubstaff from Day 1.



Key Responsibilities



Executive & Strategic Support



Manage inboxes and communications for both CEOs, responding on their behalf with professionalism and sound business judgment.



Draft, review, and send executive-level correspondence, proposals, internal memos, and contracts.

title: Video Editor & Media Asset Manager
description:
About Seva Productions



Seva Productions is a pioneering production company dedicated to crafting transformative experiences that resonate deeply with audiences around the world. Our name, 'Seva,' represents our commitment to service through storytelling, where each project is an opportunity to enlighten, inspire, and connect.



At Seva Productions, we specialize in creating high-quality experiences that encompass fulldome film to transmedia and multisensory live events. Our mission is to produce works that not only entertain but also promote mindfulness, compassion, and understanding. We believe in the power of media as a tool for positive change, addressing pressing global issues through moving narratives, breathtaking visuals, high fidelity and deeply impactful soundscapes.



Our team comprises industry veterans, visionary artists, and technical experts who collaborate to bring unique visions to life. We are driven by a passion for innovation and a dedication to excellence, ensuring that every production is not just seen or heard, but felt.



From intimate documentaries to expansive cinematic epics, Seva Productions seeks to push the boundaries of what transformational theater can achieve. We work closely with communities, artists, and thought leaders to reflect diverse perspectives and foster global connections. We facilitate more than media, we inspire movements. Discover more about our projects and join us on this journey. 



Job Description



We are looking for a highly organized and technically skilled Video Editor & Media Asset Manager to curate, prepare, and distribute our extensive library of video assets to a global audience. This role is crucial in ensuring our content is readily accessible, properly formatted, and optimized for various platforms, including standard online distribution, planetariums, and IMAX theaters. You will be responsible for managing our digital asset library, performing video editing tasks, transcoding media, and ensuring the highest quality output for diverse delivery specifications. This is a fully remote position, requiring excellent self-management and communication skills.



Key Responsibilities



Media Asset Library Oversight

- Maintain and structure high-volume video and audio libraries across NAS, Dropbox, and cloud systems

- Apply consistent metadata, versioning, and directory schema across shows and locations

- Support daily sync operations between global teams and servers



File Preparation & Delivery

- Transcode and package media assets for standard, fulldome (e.g. 6K/8K 60fps), and IMAX delivery formats

- Prepare content for conversions such as 24fps remastering, DCDM packaging, or multi-channel audio splits

- Manage EXR, PNG, TIFF sequences and flatten to delivery formats as needed (ProRes, H.264/5, DCP, etc.)



Distribution Pipeline Support

- Transfer and QC media across partner facilities using cloud platforms, MASV, Signiant, or direct drive shipment

- Monitor folder syncs across Dropbox/Google Drive and troubleshoot issues affecting inter-site workflows





Quality Control & Validation

- Perform visual/audio QC across multiple display formats including planetarium domes, theatrical, and online

- Run spot checks, verify frame rate conversions, inspect compression artifacts, audio sync, and color integrity

- Implement naming and logging conventions for approval versions, finals, and archive copies



Editing & Assembly Tasks

- Trim, revise, and prepare internal promotional and reference videos

- Assemble reels, previews, and media selections for stakeholder review





Process Improvement & Documentation

- Suggest and implement workflow optimizations in the DAM stack

- Maintain documentation for naming conventions, asset handling, and delivery prep

- Collaborate with tech lead to evolve global asset delivery systems



Qualifications



Required Skills & Knowledge

- Solid experience with FFMPEG, Adobe Media Encoder, or equivalent batch transcoding tools

- Strong command of file formats (EXR, ProRes, TIFF, MP4, PNG sequences), codecs, and transcoding workflows

- Working knowledge of DCP/DCDM packaging and multi-format delivery prep

Familiarity with version control, metadata tagging, and archival file structuring

- Experience managing remote storage, NAS systems, or high-volume cloud sync operations (e.g. Dropbox for Business, Google Drive Enterprise)

- Ability to quickly adapt to different specs and pipelines across shows

- Detail-oriented and self-directed with exceptional time management



Preferred Experience (not required)

- Background in fulldome, IMAX, or high-resolution exhibition formats (open to be trained)

- Familiarity with MASV, Signiant, or drive-based transfer logistics

- Experience with cross-platform workflows (Mac/PC/Linux) and remote-controlled systems

- Exposure to AI-based upscaling, frame rate conversion, or HDR remastering is a plus

- Light familiarity with Premiere, Resolve, or After Effects for internal edits and quality passes



Who You Are

- Technically adept, detail-oriented, and dependable.

- Curious, mindful, and collaborative.

- Able to work efficiently in a remote, fast-paced creative environment.

- Passionate about storytelling that uplifts and connects.



What We Offer

- Fully remote work setup with room for flexibility.

- Growth opportunities and professional development.

- Supportive, creative, and inspiring team culture.

- The chance to contribute to projects that promote mindfulness, compassion, and global impact.



If this resonates with you, we’d love to hear from you. Apply here:

title: Finance Director / Head of Finance – Forecasting & Cash Flow
description:
Role Purpose



To lead and secure the company’s financial operations by ensuring accurate financial visibility, cash flow control, and forward-looking financial planning, while protecting the business through transaction analysis, reconciliations, fraud detection, and high-quality reporting.



Key Responsibilities

1. Financial Strategy & Planning



Define, build, and manage the annual budget



Develop rolling forecasts (monthly / quarterly)



Analyze variances between actuals vs forecasts



Support strategic decision-making (growth, pricing, hiring, investments)



2. Cash Flow & Treasury Management



Build and maintain cash flow forecasts



Monitor daily and weekly cash positions



Optimize working capital (BFR)



Anticipate cash constraints and propose corrective actions



Manage relationships with banks and financial partners



3. Financial Transaction Analysis



Analyze all incoming and outgoing financial transactions



Monitor payments to/from customers, suppliers, and service providers



Identify anomalies, inconsistencies, or suspicious transactions



Implement transaction control rules and monitoring processes



4. Reconciliations & Financial Controls



Perform and supervise bank reconciliations



Reconcile invoices, payments, and collections



Review accounting entries in coordination with external accountants



Strengthen and secure financial processes and internal controls



5. Fraud Detection & Risk Management



Identify and assess fraud risks



Design and implement internal control procedures



Ensure proper segregation of duties



Audit sensitive financial flows (payments, refunds, cards, subscriptions)



6. Financial Reporting & KPIs



Produce clear, accurate, and decision-oriented financial reports



Track and analyze key financial KPIs, including:



Cash runway



Gross and net margin



Fixed vs variable costs



Profitability by product / business unit



Deliver monthly dashboards to management and leadership



7. Accounting & Compliance Oversight



Act as the main point of contact with external accountants



Supervise monthly, quarterly, and annual closings



Ensure tax compliance (VAT, corporate taxes, filings)



Prepare documentation for audits when required



Profile Requirements

Education



Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Audit, or Management



Professional certifications (CPA, ACCA, DSCG, etc.) are a plus



Experience



5–10 years of experience in finance



Proven background as Finance Director, Head of Finance, or Senior Financial Controller



Experience in SMEs, startups, scale-ups, or high-growth environments preferred



Technical Skills



Strong expertise in:



Cash flow management & forecasting



Financial analysis



Bank reconciliations



Financial reporting



Advanced Excel / Google Sheets skills



Experience with accounting software (Sage, NetSuite, Pennylane, QuickBooks, etc.)



Familiarity with payment platforms (Stripe, PayPal, banking tools)



Soft Skills



Highly analytical and detail-oriented



Strategic thinker with strong business acumen



Proactive, autonomous, and reliable



High level of integrity and confidentiality



Ability to challenge and advise leadership constructively

title: Home Health Authorization & QA Coordinator
description:
Role Purpose



The Home Health Authorization & QA Coordinator ensures patients are eligible, services are properly authorized, and completed visits are administratively accurate and cleared for payroll and billing.



This role exists to prevent denials, protect cash flow, avoid payroll delays, and reduce operational breakdowns by validating visit completion, intake data, documentation, orders, signatures, and authorization limits.



This is a non-clinical, operational role focused on accuracy, speed, accountability, and revenue protection.



Reporting Structure



Reports to: Operations Manager

Works closely with:



Intake & Authorization



Scheduling



Clinical QA



Billing / AR / AP



HR



Core Responsibilities

1) Eligibility Verification & Authorization Management



Verify insurance eligibility for new referrals and active patients



Confirm payer coverage, visit caps, frequency limits, and authorization requirements



Submit and track prior authorizations with payers



Monitor authorized vs. used visits and flag risks early



Proactively request re-authorizations before services lapse



Prevent scheduling outside of authorization limits



2) Visit Completion & Payroll QA Validation (Administrative QA)



Verify completed visits exist in the EMR



Confirm visits are marked as Completed



Validate correct patient, clinician, date, discipline, and visit type



Ensure time in / time out are documented



Approve visits for payroll eligibility (direct hires only)



Place visits on hold when administrative requirements are missing



3) Intake, Payer & Authorization Data Verification



Confirm patient demographics are complete and accurate



Verify insurance information is attached and correct



Confirm correct payer is linked to each visit



Ensure required authorizations are present before services are scheduled



Flag missing or incorrect intake data for correction



4) Orders, Plan of Care & Signatures (Administrative Tracking)



Verify required physician orders are present



Track signed Plans of Care (POCs)



Monitor order expiration dates



Follow up on missing signatures



Ensure documents are linked to the correct patient and visit



5) Authorization Packet Readiness



Compile documentation required for authorization packets



Ensure documents are complete, labeled, and organized



Confirm readiness for submission



Coordinate with Intake on submission and payer follow-up



6) Exception Routing & Issue Resolution



Identify missing or incorrect documentation



Route issues to the appropriate team:



Intake (eligibility, demographics, authorizations)



Scheduling (visit mismatches, date/discipline errors)



Clinicians (missing notes, time in/out, signatures)



HR (credential or payroll eligibility issues)



Escalate repeated breakdowns or unresolved issues to Operations Manager



Required Qualifications



Experience with insurance eligibility, authorizations, or healthcare operations QA



Strong attention to detail and follow-through



Comfortable working with EMRs and payer portals



Strong organizational and documentation skills



Clear written and verbal communication



Preferred (Nice to Have)



Home health, therapy, or healthcare operations experience



Experience managing visit caps and re-authorizations



Experience clearing visits for payroll or billing



Familiarity coordinating across Intake, Scheduling, Clinical, and Billing



What Success Looks Like



Visits are cleared for payroll within 24–48 hours



Authorizations are approved before services lapse



Minimal billing denials tied to auth or documentation issues



Fewer last-minute scheduling holds



Clean documentation ready for billing

title: Senior Sales Operations Specialist
description:
Role Summary



We are hiring a Senior Sales Operations Specialist to support a multi-region field sales organization. This role serves as the operational backbone of the sales team, with primary responsibility for CRM ownership, sales and inventory tracking, reporting, and cross-functional coordination.



This is a hands-on, execution-focused role for someone highly detail-oriented, analytical, and comfortable managing complex sales data and workflows in a fast-paced environment.



Key Responsibilities



Sales Operations & Field Support



Support day-to-day operations for multi-region field sales teams



Act as the primary contact for sales data, reporting, and process questions



Support sales planning, territory alignment, and performance tracking



CRM Ownership & Optimization



Own CRM data accuracy, structure, and adoption



Maintain pipelines, customer records, pricing, and contract data



Support CRM implementations, enhancements, and integrations



Build dashboards and reports for pipeline health, performance, and forecasting



Sales & Inventory Tracking



Track orders, shipments, sell-through, and inventory levels



Coordinate with supply chain and operations teams to align sales and availability



Identify trends, risks, and gaps related to demand and fulfillment



Cross-Functional Coordination



Work closely with Finance on forecasting, revenue tracking, commissions, and pricing



Support Legal with contract tracking and customer documentation



Ensure sales processes align with internal controls and compliance requirements



Reporting & Insights



Prepare regular sales, inventory, and performance reports



Analyze data to provide actionable insights and recommendations



Support ad hoc analysis for new markets, products, or initiatives



Process Improvement



Identify opportunities to streamline and standardize sales workflows



Document SOPs, best practices, and reporting standards



Support training and adoption of new tools and processes



Qualifications



5+ years in Sales Operations, Revenue Operations, or similar role



Strong CRM expertise (Salesforce, HubSpot, or similar platforms)



CRM implementation or system optimization experience preferred



Experience supporting field sales teams across multiple regions



Strong analytical and data management skills



High attention to detail with strong follow-through



Comfortable working independently during US EST hours

title: Video Editor
description:
Description



We are looking for a reliable Video Sync Editor to organize and synchronize raw footage for our long-form golf YouTube channel. Episodes are typically around 1 hour. Your responsibility is to sync video and audio from multiple cameras and deliver edit-ready timelines in DaVinci Resolve. This role does not involve creative editing.



Responsibilities

 • Import all media into DaVinci Resolve

 • Sync multi-camera video and external audio

 • Organize and label timelines clearly

 • Deliver clean, edit-ready Resolve timelines

 • Experience syncing multi-cam footage and external audio

 • Strong organizational skills

 • Fast, reliable internet connection

 • Ability to handle large file transfers (up to 500GB)

Pay

 • Full Time



How to Apply



Please include:

 • Your DaVinci Resolve experience

 • Internet speed (download/upload)

 • Available storage capacity

 • Typical turnaround time for syncing projects

title: Windows Tech Support Agent
description:
Full-Time Windows Tech Support Agent – Work From Home (Philippines)



Stable Full-Time Role | Long-Term Opportunity | U.S.-Based Company



Rate: Up to $5.00 per hour (based on experience)

Schedule: Full-time, 40 hours per week

Work Hours: U.S. Eastern Time

Location: Remote – Philippines only



About the Role



We are an established and  growing U.S.-based company looking for a full-time Windows Tech Support Agent to join our remote support team. This is a stable, long-term role for someone who wants consistent hours, clear expectations, and the opportunity to grow within the company.



You will be supporting U.S. customers by phone and
, helping them resolve Windows and computer-related issues. Strong communication is important, and you will be given the time and tools needed to do the job properly.



If you enjoy troubleshooting, helping customers, and working in a professional remote environment, this role may be a great fit.



What You Will Be Doing"



You will assist customers in the United States via phone and
.

You will troubleshoot Windows 10 and Windows 11 issues.

You will help with driver-related and basic hardware questions.

You will use remote support tools to diagnose and resolve problems.

You will document support cases clearly and accurately.



Who We Are Looking For:



You have at least one to two years of experience in technical support or customer support involving live phone calls.

You are comfortable speaking with customers and explaining technical information clearly.

You have working knowledge of Windows 10 and Windows 11 and general computer troubleshooting.

You have reliable high-speed internet with a minimum speed of 50 Mbps.

You have a quality headset and a quiet, professional home work environment.

You are able to work full-time during U.S. Eastern Time hours.

You are dependable, self-motivated, and open to learning.



Technical Skills Required



You have hands-on experience troubleshooting desktop computers or PC components.

You are familiar with Windows and driver-related issues.

You have used remote desktop or screen-sharing tools to assist customers.

You are comfortable working with a ticketing or CRM system, or can learn one quickly.



You do not need to know everything on day one, but you must have real-world experience working with Windows systems and supporting customers in live situations.



Why Work With Us



This is not a short-term contract or temporary role. We focus on long-term working relationships and treat our tea
mbers with respect.



You will receive consistent full-time hours.

You will work with a supportive and professional team.

You will have opportunities to grow into higher responsibility roles over time.



We value reliability, communication, and effort. If you do great work, it will be noticed.



How to Apply



To keep the process fair and efficient, we ask all applicants to complete a short introduction video. This helps us understand your communication style and technical background.



Step 1

Record a two-minute video using Google Drive or YouTube (unlisted).



In the video, please speak naturally and do not read from a script.

Briefly explain the first six items listed in Windows Device Manager.

Speak clearly and professionally.



Step 2

Reply to this job post on OnlineJobs.ph and include the following.



A link to your video.



Your resume with relevant support experience.



A screenshot of your internet speed test from





A photo of your headset.



Message formatting requirements



Start your application message with the words

“I am your new tech support superhero!”



Include the following in the subject line

Tech Support Agent – Your Name



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.



Final Note



If you are looking for a stable full-time remote role with a U.S. company and you take pride in providing quality tech support, we would love to hear from you.



Apply today and take the next step in your remote tech support career.

title: Executive Assistant to a Busy CEO (Strong EA + QuickBooks Experience Required)
description:
We are hiring a high-performing Executive Assistant to support a CEO managing six (6) business entities. This is a strategic EA role requiring strong business judgment, proactive planning, and the ability to keep a busy executive focused on top priorities across multiple companies.



SCHEDULE

• 20 hours per week

• Flexible within 9:00 AM–5:00 PM PST (availability during PST business hours is required)



WHAT YOU’LL OWN

• Executive inbox management (Gmail): prioritize, organize, flag urgent messages, and track follow-ups

• Weekly executive planning: help build the CEO’s weekly schedule and task list across 6 entities

• Calendar & meeting coordination: schedule meetings, manage time zones, and protect focus time

• Task & follow-up tracking: ensure nothing slips through the cracks

• Google Drive management: maintain clean folder structures, naming conventions, and version control

• QuickBooks invoicing & billing: upload receipts, manage invoices, and coordinate with bookkeepers

• Bookkeeping coordination: retrieve information, follow up on missing items, and keep accounting moving

• Document preparation & signatures: manage contracts, legal, and administrative documents

• Business registrations & admin setup: renewals, service accounts, and compliance support

• Professional coordination: liaise with accountants, lawyers, and partners as needed



MUST-HAVES



• Proven Executive Assistant experience supporting a CEO or senior executive

• Fluent English (written and spoken)

• Strong business sense with the ability to understand priorities across multiple businesses

• Excellent Gmail, Google Calendar, and Google Drive skills

• Hands-on experience with QuickBooks, including invoicing, billing, receipts, and working with bookkeepers

• Experience coordinating corporate legal and administrative requirements

• Highly organized, proactive, discreet, and dependable



BONUS POINTS

• Business degree (MBA is a plus)

• 5+ years of Executive Assistance or operations experience in a fast-paced environment

• Experience supporting multi-entity or multi-business executives



HOW TO APPLY (REQUIRED)



Please include:

• Your resume

• A short video introduction explaining why you’re a strong fit for a CEO-level Executive Assistant role

• Confirmation that you can work 20 hours/week within 9:00 AM–5:00 PM PST

• A list of tools you’re strongest with (Gmail, Google Drive, DocuSign, QuickBooks, etc.)

title: Virtual Office Assistant
description:
Come Join Us!



At Hecht Family Law, we recognize that every interaction represents a client facing a difficult and emotional time. As a Virtual Office Assistant, you will be a key support for both our clients and internal team, providing professional, organized, and compassionate assistance across multiple departments.



This role supports billing, administrative operations, and sales follow-ups. We are seeking someone who communicates clearly, listens empathetically, and takes pride in providing calm, reliable support. If you are detail-oriented, dependable, and motivated to grow with a collaborative family law firm, we invite you to apply.



Responsibilities

• Provide administrative and office support across multiple departments, including billing and operations

• Assist the billing department with reports, documentation, and administrative tasks

• Answer incoming calls, take accurate and detailed messages, and route communications appropriately

• Communicate with clients in a calm, professional, and empathetic manner, particularly during emotionally sensitive situations

• Make follow-up calls to prospective clients who have previously inquired about our services

• Accurately document client interactions, notes, and outcomes in firm systems

• Maintain confidentiality and professionalism when handling sensitive client information

• Assist in the recruitment of Attorneys and Paralegals by researching the Georgia Bar database to identify attorneys’ contact information, including
 addresses, and compiling outreach lists for direct recruitment efforts

• Assist marketing team with various projects including monitoring and reporting on local family law firm competitors’ marketing, tracking blog topics, ads, social media content, and identifying trends, opportunities, and gaps we can capitalize on

• Increase reviews across multiple platforms including Google, Avvo, Yelp, TrustPilot



Qualifications

• Speak English clearly and professionally with strong verbal and written communication skills

• Demonstrate a high level of empathy, emotional intelligence, and patience when working with distressed clients

• Present a confident, professional phone presence

• Exhibit strong organizational skills and attention to detail

• Ability to multitask and manage responsibilities across departments

• Dependable, proactive, and comfortable working independently in a remote environment

• Ability to work 8:30 am to 5:30 pm east coast USA time (9:30 pm to 6:30 am Philippines time—overnight work)



Preferred Experience

• Prior experience as a virtual assistant, office assistant, or administrative support professional

• Experience working with U.S.-based clients

• Familiarity with billing systems, CRM platforms, or legal practice management software (preferred but not required)

• Familiarity and experience with Google Docs, Google Sheets, working with spreadsheets.

• Strong familiarity and experience with ChatGPT

• Background in legal, healthcare, or other client-facing service roles is a plus



Compensation

This position comes with a generous total compensation plan consisting of your salary PLUS up to 50% BONUS!



About Hecht Family Law

Hecht Family Law was founded to help clients navigate some of life’s most challenging transitions with clarity, compassion, and strong advocacy. Attorney Ed Hecht understands firsthand the emotional and practical realities of family law matters, and this perspective shapes the culture of our firm.



Our team shares a deep commitment to treating clients with patience, respect, and empathy—while also delivering organized, professional, and efficient legal support. As a firm, we value collaboration, accountability, and care for both our clients and our tea
mbers. We strive to create a work environment that is supportive, growth-oriented, and rooted in purpose.



Join us, and be part of a team that truly makes a difference—every call, every task, every day.

title: IT Engineer
description:
We are a US-based Managed Service Provider (MSP) seeking a skilled and motivated IT Engineer to join our dynamic team. This role offers a unique blend of IT project implementation and day-to-day technical support responsibilities, providing an excellent opportunity to grow your skills in a supportive and collaborative environment.



As an IT Engineer, you will play a key role in maintaining and improving our clients’ IT environments, troubleshooting issues, and contributing to exciting IT projects. If you’re passionate about technology, problem-solving, and delivering exceptional service, we’d love to hear from you!



Key Responsibilities:

**Provide Level 2 technical support for hardware, software, and network issues, escalating complex problems as needed.

*Plan and implement IT projects, ensuring timely and successful delivery.

*Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to desktops, servers, and networks.

*Perform PC maintenance, upgrades, and installations.

*Manage and support user equipment, software, and services remotely.

*Document work thoroughly and update the ticketing system to ensure transparency and efficiency.



Technologies You’ll Work With:

*Operating Systems: Windows and Mac desktop environments, Windows Server.

*Networking: Cisco, Ubiquiti, Fortinet, and general networking concepts.

*Cloud Platforms: Microsoft 365 and Azure.



What We’re Looking For:

**Experienced L2 IT Support role

*Strong troubleshooting skills for hardware, software, and networks.

*Familiarity with Microsoft 365, Windows Server, and networking concepts.

*Excellent communication and customer service skills.

*A proactive, problem-solving mindset with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.



Preferred but Not Required:

*Certifications such as Network+, Microsoft Certified, or CCNA.

*Experience with firewalls, VPNs, and virtual environments.



Why Join Us?



We believe in creating an environment where our tea
mbers can thrive both professionally and personally. Here’s what we offer:



*Career Growth: Paid certifications, training, and structured onboarding to help you advance your skills.

*Attractive Compensation: Competitive salary, performance-based incentives (monthly profit share and end-of-year bonus), and 13th-month pay.

*Health & Wellness: Monthly healthcare allowance to support your well-being.

*Work-Life Balance: 100% remote work with company-provided equipment.

*Supportive Culture: Be part of a forward-thinking team that values collaboration, innovation, and having fun while doing great work.



What Sets Us Apart?



*Performance-Based Rewards: Monthly profit sharing and bonuses for high-performing tea
mbers.

*Continuous Learning: We invest in your growth with paid certifications and training.

*Collaborative Environment: Work with a team that values your input and supports your success.

*Flexibility: Enjoy the freedom of remote work while contributing to impactful projects.



How to Apply

If you’re ready to take your IT career to the next level, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now and join a team that’s passionate about technology, growth, and delivering exceptional service.



**Submit your application and include the numbers (1828) in your subject line. This helps us ensure you’ve read the full job description.



**Please also attach your updated CV to your application or provide a link to your CV. Applications without a CV will not be considered.



**Currently looking for candidates in NCR or nearby areas of the Philippines



This is an overnight position. The working hours for this role are 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM CST Monday to Friday.



We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Remote Social Media Manager (Execution & Team Coordination)
description:
$1,700 plus incentives

We’re hiring a remote Social Media Manager who focuses on execution, organization, and follow-through.



This role is responsible for keeping content production moving, coordinating people, tracking performance, and ensuring leadership has a clear view of what’s working.



This is a structured role with clear expectations, timelines, and ownership.



Key Responsibilities

Manage daily social media execution across platforms

Coordinate editors, designers, and contributors

Track content calendars, deadlines, and approvals

Review post performance and organize insights

Prepare clear summaries for leadership (what worked / what didn’t / what’s next)

Maintain organized systems for tasks, files, and reporting

Handle fast timelines and pressure without losing control

Content Analysis & Reporting

You will review post performance and organize analytics so leadership can quickly understand results.



Content Analysis & Visual Reporting

You will review post performance and translate data into simple visual analytics so leadership can quickly understand results at a glance.



You will:

Track reach, saves, comments, shares, watch time

Identify patterns across formats and hooks

Organize performance summaries weekly

Flag wins, issues, and repeatable results



Expectation:

Leadership should be able to glance at your report and immediately understand the signal.

Work Setup

Fully remote

Structured workflow

Performance-based expectations

Clear ownership



How to Apply?

Take DISC personality type: 

Send the result via message at using sample format below with Video Introduction:

Dominance	20%

Influence	22%

Steadiness	12%

Compliance	46%

You have an inner motivation to gain knowledge and become 'the expert'. You have the self-discipline to focus and you aim for high standards. You appear to be relaxed and are likely to have plenty to talk about. People see you as knowledgeable, non-threatening and easy to get along with.



REQUIRED APPLICATION STEP (VIDEO INTRODUCTION)

Applicants must submit a 2–3 minute introduction video answering the questions below.

No scripting required.

Video Questions (Ad-Facing)

1 Background

“Briefly introduce yourself and describe your current or most recent role.”

2 Execution

“Describe a situation where you were responsible for making sure work moved forward across multiple people.”

3 Organization

“How do you keep track of tasks, deadlines, and priorities when things move quickly?”

4 Handling Issues

“Tell us about a time something didn’t go as planned. What did you do next?”

5 Analytics & Communication

“How do you usually review content performance, and how would you explain results to someone who wants the bottom line?”

6 Remote Work

“What does a productive workday at home look like for you?”



Send your resume, portfolio, DISC Assessment and quick video introduction to apply

title: Real Estate Photo Editor

Excellent attention to detail

Organized file management practices

Video color correction knowledge

Familiarity with real estate industry standards

Position Details

Contract / Remote

Per-project or per-image compensation

Flexible workload based on volume

Opportunity for long-term collaboration
