title: Editor short form
description:
Hi,



I’m currently looking for one or two video editors to join my team on a long-term basis.



The content is focused on concerts and music artists, and the goal is to produce 8 to 10 short-form videos (Reels / TikTok) per day for my media accounts.



You can check the examples below to understand the style and direction.




 





 What I’m looking for



The work is simple and focused on rhythm and quality:



Find high-quality HD concert clips (TikTok, Instagram, Pinterest, YouTube, etc.)



Select trendy or viral music edits from the artist (The Weeknd, Ariana Grande, Bad Bunny, Taylor Swift, etc.)



Edit clips so they perfectly match the rhythm of the music



Strong first 3 seconds with a good hook and strong visual



Clean, simple, professional edits



No heavy motion design or complex effects needed.

No advanced After Effects work required.



The goal is:

 smooth edits, good energy, clean transitions, and strong pacing.



???? Style of videos



Music-driven edits



Concert atmosphere



Emotional or energetic 
nts



Clips changing on beats or drops



Sometimes simple text added (examples provided)



???? Workflow



The target is around 8–10 videos per day, but this does not mean working every day.



You can, for example:



create content in batches (1–2 days of work)



build a stock of videos



and then I schedule the posts daily.



The important thing is to maintain a consistent content flow.



? Test task (Important)



To make sure you understood the style and direction, please create:



1 video about Ariana Grande



1 video about The Weeknd



Using the same concept and energy as the examples provided.



Once done, send a Google Drive link with both videos.



This helps me see who understands the vibe, who is serious, and who fits the team long-term.



If you enjoy music, concerts, and short-form content, this can become a long-term collaboration.



Looking forward to seeing your work.

title: VA Customer Service Support
description:
Clean Seal Australia is a growing trades business based in Melbourne. We currently receive 30+ new enquiries per day through Facebook, Instagram, Google Ads, and our 2 websites — and we’re looking for a reliable, confident Full-Time Virtual Assistant to help manage customer communication and day-to-day admin.



www.cleansealaustralia.com.au

www.cleansealstonecare.com.au



ABOUT THE ROLE



This is a full-time, long-term role for a confident and organised Virtual Assistant.



Your main job is to handle new customer enquiries and help move them to the next step.



You will:



- Respond to new enquiries

- Ask questions to understand what the customer needs

- Send an email quote OR

- Book the customer into our calendar for an in-person quote with one of our team

- You will also help with general admin tasks to support the day-to-day running of the business (such as filing paperwork or sourcing materials).





KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:



- Learn about all of our products and services

- Respond to customer enquiries via Facebook Messenger, email and phone

- Speak confidently with customers to understand their requirements

- Send email quotes or book appointments into the calendar

- Follow up leads and keep enquiry records organised

- Perform general admin tasks (filing paperwork, sourcing materials, basic business support)

- Communicate clearly with the internal team



REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE



- Strong spoken and written English (must be confident speaking english on phone calls)

- Proven experience in customer service, lead handling and appointment setting

- Available Monday–Friday, 9:00am–5:00pm Melbourne Australia time

- Highly organised, reliable and responsive

- Comfortable working independently and managing multiple enquiries



PREFERRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE (BUT NOT ESSENTIAL)



- Facebook Messenger / Meta Business Suite

- ServiceM8

- Xero

- Experience working with trades businesses, renovation services or appointment-based businesses



WHAT WE OFFER:



- Full-time, ongoing role

- Stable workload with a growing Australian business

- Clear systems and training provided

- Long-term opportunity for the right candidate



HOW TO APPLY:



- A brief introduction about your experience

- Examples of customer service roles or experience you have that are related to this job opportunity

- Confirmation of your availability during Melbourne, Australia  business hours

title: META Paid Ads Executive
description:
META Paid Ads Executive 



Are you performance-driven, and do you have two or more years of experience in profitably growing client accounts across META's
 and Instagram channels?



Maple Forest is a growing digital marketing agency based in London. Our focus is on creating and managing the very best digital marketing campaign strategies for clients of all sizes across varied sectors. Our expertise spans all paid/sponsored marketing channels with a particular focus on Google Ads,
 Ads, Instagram and Bing Ads, to name but a few.



We utilise multiple tools and platforms to achieve the best results for our clients. Our drive and track record mean that we’re constantly looking to improve our clients' marketing strategies, sales revenue targets, lead generation targets and their return on investment.



You will need to be an enthusiastic and capable Social Media Digital Marketer. The ideal candidate will work across a variety of accounts and will be accountable for META Ads and content creation for your specific clients, supported by a Senior Account Manager.



You’ll be responsible for planning, executing and optimising paid social marketing campaigns, driving high-quality traffic, ecommerce sales and lead generation activity. If you live and breathe Meta Ads and know your way around analytics dashboards, and love diving into data to make smart decisions, this is your kind of role.



*** Paid Social Media & Campaign Management ***



Plan, develop and execute paid marketing campaigns across Meta Ads, Own end-to-end campaign performance from content creation to audience research and competitor analysis to copy testing and landing page optimisation



Increase CTR, landing page views, and conversion rates, while reducing wasted spend. Monitor and assist with budget management, account metrics, audience targeting, and ad delivery



*** Communications & Content ***



Develop and implement strategic communication plans META. Write clear, engaging, brand-aligned copy tailored to multiple client accounts.



Conduct A/B testing and use data insights to improve campaign performance. Maintain compliance with GDPR and industry best practices



Collaborate with the team to produce high-quality visual and written content



Strategy & Innovation



Help build and refine our digital strategy from audience segmentation to conversion funnels and retargeting

Craft compelling ad copy that captures attention and drives action, always aligned with the client's tone of voice and their brand values



Identify new opportunities for growth across channels, platforms, and audiences



*** The Successful Applicant***



• Experience in Social Media Marketing and Social Media Optimisation

• Strong Communication and Writing skills

• Expertise in developing and implementing Content Strategy

• Ability to analyse social media metrics and optimise performance

• Excellent organisational and time management skills

• Strong working knowledge of Google Analytics, conversion tracking, and reporting dashboards



*** Why Join Us? ***



A fast-paced, creative environment where your ideas and results will make a real impact

Be part of a forward-thinking, collaborative team that blends brand storytelling with performance marketing

Plenty of room for professional growth as we scale up and expand into new markets and channels

title: Appointment Setter
description:
About Us: Join No Joke Marketing, a leading digital marketing agency dedicated to excellence and employee well-being. We offer half-day Fridays every June, 20 days of paid time off in your first year, and the flexibility of a fully remote position. If you're passionate about driving client success and excelling in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, we want to connect with you!



Position’s Goal: The Appointment Setter is responsible for being the first point of contact for potential clients, engaging them effectively, understanding their marketing needs, and setting the stage for further interactions with the sales team. The goal is to enhance client satisfaction and optimize sales by ensuring potential clients receive exceptional preliminary customer service and are efficiently scheduled for follow-up interactions.



EST Hours: 8am - 4pm



Key Functions and Responsibilities:



General:



Serve as the first contact point for potential clients, effectively engaging them in conversation to understand their marketing needs.

Focus on building and nurturing strong relationships from the initial contact, ensuring a smooth transition to the sales team for deeper engagement.

Daily:



Maintain detailed records of interactions, calls, and appointments scheduled with potential clients.

Ensure timely follow-ups and efficient scheduling to maximize opportunities for the sales team.

Weekly:



Analyze interaction data to improve future engagements and report significant insights to the Customer Experience Manager.

Provide at least three qualified leads to the sales team per week.

Monthly:



Review monthly performance metrics with the Customer Experience Manager to assess and strategize on improving engagement techniques and client conversion rates.

Quarterly:



Participate in training sessions to enhance communication and engagement skills.

Review and update engagement scripts and approaches to align with current market trends and client expectations.

Biggest Challenges for This Position:



Maintaining consistent, high-quality client interaction in a high-volume environment.

Efficiently managing and organizing detailed records of numerous client interactions.

Strategic Internal Relations:



Customer Experience Manager: Updates, feedback, and strategic alignment (Weekly)

Sales Team: Transition of leads, feedback on client needs (As needed)

Strategic External Relations:



Potential Clients: Initial engagement and relationship building (Daily)

Industry Partners: Coordination on client engagement strategies (Quarterly)

Soft Skills:



Teamwork

Flexibility

Integrity

Problem-Solving

Outstanding Communication Skills

Hard Skills:



CRM Software: Advanced

Data Entry: Intermediate

Customer Relationship Management: Advanced

Education & Areas of Expertise:



Formal Education: A high school diploma is required; a bachelor’s degree in business administration or a related field is preferred.

Languages: Proficiency in English

Tech Requirements:



PC Specifications: Processor: Intel® Core™ i7 or greater, Memory: 16GB RAM or greater

Internet Connection: Stable broadband connection with at least 20 Mbps upload and download speeds

Other: High-quality noise-canceling headset, HD web camera

Ready to Apply? Elevate your career with No Joke Marketing. If you are ready to be part of a team where your contributions make a difference, apply now to become our new Appointment Setter

title: Full Stack Developer – Senior – React / .NET / Azure
description:
About the Company

We’re building a large-scale customer engagement platform that unifies live chat, messaging, and AI-driven automation. The platform handles high-volume, real-time interactions and integrates with Azure services to power intelligent workflows, chatbots, and analytics. You’ll join our engineering team expanding AI capabilities and refining product architecture.



Role Overview

We’re looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer with strong front-end expertise in React, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, plus back-end experience in C#, .NET Core, and Azure Cloud. This role focuses on building and integrating AI-driven capabilities, authentication and deployment flows, and enterprise-grade service architecture.



Responsibilities

- Deploy applications to Microsoft Store and Azure environments

- Implement authentication and authorization with OAuth and Azure Active Directory

- Design and maintain back-end services and APIs in C# 
 Core

- Collaborate with product and AI teams to integrate LLM-based capabilities

- Contribute to architecture planning, code reviews, and performance tuning

- Integrate subscription, billing, and purchase flows for SaaS enablement

- Work with CI/CD pipelines in GitHub Actions or Azure DevOps

- Use AI-assisted tools such as GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, Claude, and Cursor to accelerate development

- Work with containerization and deployment using Docker and Kubernetes

- Optionally wire prebuilt front-end components from our UIX team to back-end services



Requirements

- Advanced skills in React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, C#, 
 Core

- Solid experience with REST APIs and microservices architecture

- Familiarity with Azure (App Services, Functions, Service Bus, Storage)

- Experience with SQL databases and data modeling

- Understanding of OAuth, Active Directory, and CI/CD practices

- Comfortable using AI-assisted development tools (Copilot, Claude, ChatGPT, Cursor)

- Strong Git and GitHub workflow knowledge



Nice to Have

- Hands-on integration with OpenAI, Claude, Azure AI, or Hugging Face APIs

- Experience with vector or semantic search platforms (Azure Cognitive Search, Pinecone, Weaviate)

- MongoDB, Redis, Cosmos DB, or similar data technologies

- Microsoft Graph API and workflow orchestration

- SignalR Core for real-time messaging

- Secure access control, encryption, and TDD practices

- BI and Microsoft reporting integration

- Orchestration for identity and intent workflows (MCP frameworks)



To apply:

- Reply to this posting with the subject line: Senior Fullstack_YourName

- Include a link to your resume, link to samples of your work if available, a brief summary of who you are, a quick overview of your experience, and why you believe you're a good fit for this role. 



Please also answer the following questions:

2. Describe a project where you integrated React (TypeScript) 
 Core and Azure services.



We review applications thoughtfully, and those that include the requested details and responses will be prioritized.

title: Bookkeeper
description:
Role Purpose



To lead and secure the company’s financial operations by ensuring accurate financial visibility, cash flow control, and forward-looking financial planning, while protecting the business through transaction analysis, reconciliations, fraud detection, and high-quality reporting.



Key Responsibilities

1. Financial Strategy & Planning



Define, build, and manage the annual budget



Develop rolling forecasts (monthly / quarterly)



Analyze variances between actuals vs forecasts



Support strategic decision-making (growth, pricing, hiring, investments)



2. Cash Flow & Treasury Management



Build and maintain cash flow forecasts



Monitor daily and weekly cash positions



Optimize working capital (BFR)



Anticipate cash constraints and propose corrective actions



Manage relationships with banks and financial partners



3. Financial Transaction Analysis



Analyze all incoming and outgoing financial transactions



Monitor payments to/from customers, suppliers, and service providers



Identify anomalies, inconsistencies, or suspicious transactions



Implement transaction control rules and monitoring processes



4. Reconciliations & Financial Controls



Perform and supervise bank reconciliations



Reconcile invoices, payments, and collections



Review accounting entries in coordination with external accountants



Strengthen and secure financial processes and internal controls



5. Fraud Detection & Risk Management



Identify and assess fraud risks



Design and implement internal control procedures



Ensure proper segregation of duties



Audit sensitive financial flows (payments, refunds, cards, subscriptions)



6. Financial Reporting & KPIs



Produce clear, accurate, and decision-oriented financial reports



Track and analyze key financial KPIs, including:



Cash runway



Gross and net margin



Fixed vs variable costs



Profitability by product / business unit



Deliver monthly dashboards to management and leadership



7. Accounting & Compliance Oversight



Act as the main point of contact with external accountants



Supervise monthly, quarterly, and annual closings



Ensure tax compliance (VAT, corporate taxes, filings)



Prepare documentation for audits when required



Profile Requirements

Education



Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Audit, or Management



Professional certifications (CPA, ACCA, DSCG, etc.) are a plus



Experience



5–10 years of experience in finance



Proven background as Finance Director, Head of Finance, or Senior Financial Controller



Experience in SMEs, startups, scale-ups, or high-growth environments preferred



Technical Skills



Strong expertise in:



Cash flow management & forecasting



Financial analysis



Bank reconciliations



Financial reporting



Advanced Excel / Google Sheets skills



Experience with accounting software (Sage, NetSuite, Pennylane, QuickBooks, etc.)



Familiarity with payment platforms (Stripe, PayPal, banking tools)



Soft Skills



Highly analytical and detail-oriented



Strategic thinker with strong business acumen



Proactive, autonomous, and reliable



High level of integrity and confidentiality



Ability to challenge and advise leadership constructively

title: Process, Systems & Training Specialist
description:
Job Title: Process, Systems & Training Specialist

Reports to: Head of Operations

Type: Full-Time 



The Role in a Nutshell

We need someone who loves order, clarity and logic. Your job is to take the knowledge sitting inside our Leaders’ heads and turn it into simple, step-by-step processes that our staff can actually follow.



Our Leaders know exactly how things need to be done, but they don’t have the time to document every detail. You will build the playbook that keeps our operations consistent, scalable and easy to follow.



What You Will Do

1. Process Detective (Extracting the Information)

Meet with Team Leads across Operations, Scheduling, Cleaner Management, Finance and Sales.

Ask them to walk you through how a task is done — you dig out the details.

Break big explanations into clear, small steps.

Identify missing pieces, unclear instructions or inconsistent approaches.

Spot where staff are getting confused and help close those gaps.



2. Writer & Builder (Documenting)

Write clear, simple processes: checklists, step-by-step guides, flowcharts.

Keep instructions practical and easy to follow on a phone.

Maintain version control and keep our process library clean and current.

Delete outdated documents so everyone always uses the correct version.



3. Training Partner (Support)

Create training materials (slides, checklists, scripts or short videos).

Give Team Leads the tools they need to train their teams effectively.

You don’t manage staff — you build the systems that guide them.



4. Quality & Consistency Guardian

Ensure all workflows follow best practice and support consistent delivery.

Keep processes aligned across teams so everyone works the same way.

Make sure we have the right documentation and audit trail when needed.





Who You Are (Skills & Traits)

Logical and organised — you think in steps.

A simple, clear writer — no jargon, no fluff.

Confident asking questions until you get the full picture.

Tech-comfortable — you can use tools to document processes and create flowcharts.

Calm and steady — you focus on process, not people drama.

You enjoy turning chaos into structure and making things easy to follow.



How We Measure Success

The Maid My Day Playbook is complete, accurate and easy to follow.

Team Leads receive fewer “how do I do this?” messages from staff.

Staff follow processes correctly without guesswork.

You turn Leaders’ knowledge into polished documents quickly and logically.



Not a Fit If…

You expect others to write the processes for you.

You get overwhelmed by big-picture thinkers who jump around quickly.

You want to manage cleaners or run a team — this role is about systems.

You struggle to simplify information or create structure fro
ssy details.





If this sounds like you, kindly send your resume to 
 and please add 'Process, Systems & Training Specialist" in the
 Subject line.

title: Product Lister (Shopify + AI Images)
description:
We are a fast-growing e-commerce company operating Shopify stores across multiple markets. We work with a long-term vision, strong brand standards, and a team-first mindset. This is not “just a VA role” — we work closely together, value feedback, and offer room for growth when the collaboration goes well.



The Role:

We’re looking for a full-time Product Lister who can work accurately and efficiently at scale, following clear SOPs and fixed brand standards.



What You Will Do: 

Product Listing & Imports

• Import products into Shopify using supplier tools, apps, feeds, or CSV files

• Set up clean product structures (variants, collections, tags, metafields)

• Maintain accuracy and consistency across product data



Product Content

• Write product descriptions in our brand style (fully documented in SOPs)

• Translate product content when required (manual or AI-assisted)

• Fill in metafields, attributes, and required product data fields



Product Images & AI Models

• Work with one fixed background provided by us

• Use three fixed AI models provided by us

• Use AI tools and/or Canva — your workflow is flexible, but the output must be consistent

• Ensure images follow the same visual standard across all listings.



Quality:

A product is “done” when data is correct, visuals match the real product, and listings look consistent.

After onboarding, you should be comfortable handling ~35–45 products per day without quality loss.



Who You Are:

- Detail-oriented and accuracy-driven

- Comfortable with repetitive work at scale

- Able to follow SOPs exactly

- Reliable, structured, and team-minded



Requirements:

- Shopify product listing experience

- Familiar with variants, metafields, and product data

- Experience with Canva and/or AI tools for product images

- Good written and spoken English

- Stable internet connection



What We Offer:

- Full-time, long-term position

- Clear SOPs and expectations

- Team-oriented culture

- Room for growth and responsibility

- Performance-based bonus structures



How to Apply:

Start your application with “Consistency” and include:



1: Short introduction about yourself + Shopify product listing experience

2: Examples of product pages or stores you worked on

3: Experience + examples with AI-generated product images

4: Your availability

5: Screenshot of your internet speed



Applications that don’t follow these steps will not be reviewed!

title: (WFH) Senior Bookkeeper
description:
About Us:



We have been serving the bookkeeping needs of Canadian small businesses since the 90s. 

We are focused on serving churches, charities, nonprofits, and small business startups across Canada, organizations that need effective and professional bookkeeping while working with limited financial resources. 



Why Join Us:



Salary range from PHP 90,000 to 110,000 per month + 13 month pay.

Following Canadian public holidays

Supportive and Collaborative work environment.

Work-life balance with flexible scheduling options.

Permanent work from home set-up.

New equipment supplied.

Position Summary:



The Senior Bookkeeper is responsible for end-to-end bookkeeping and financial reporting for a portfolio of clients, primarily churches and nonprofit organizations across Canada. This role owns monthly close deliverables, ensures accurate and compliant records under Canadian accounting standards, and provides proactive, high-quality client support.



The Senior Bookkeeper also mentors junior tea
mbers, reviews their work for accuracy, and helps strengthen processes to improve efficiency and consistency.



Key Responsibilities:



Manage end-to-end bookkeeping for a portfolio of clients (primarily churches, charities, and nonprofits across Canada).

Maintain accurate books in QuickBooks (primarily QuickBooks Online), including coding, journal entries, and general ledger upkeep.

Lead month-end close, including bank/credit card reconciliations and resolution of discrepancies.

Prepare and review monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and reports in line with Canadian standards and firm procedures.

Oversee AP/AR workflows, ensuring timely processing, follow-up, and clean supporting documentation.

Oversee payroll processing and related compliance requirements, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.

Act as a primary client contact, answering questions and providing clear, practical bookkeeping guidance.

Train, review, and coach junior bookkeepers, ensuring quality control and continuous process improvement.



Skills:



Diploma or degree in Bookkeeping, Accounting, or a related field.

Minimum of 5 years of bookkeeping experience, preferably within CAD public practice environment.

Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks).

Strong knowledge of bookkeeping principles and practices.

Excellent organizational and time management skills.

Attention to detail and high level of accuracy.

Good verbal and written communication skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Familiarity with payroll processing and tax preparation is a plus.

title: Virtual Assistant (VA) - Amazon FBA
description:
Amazon Product Research and Online Arbitrage Virtual Assistant (United Kingdom Market)



Location: Remote (Philippines)

Hours: Full-time, forty hours per week

Schedule: Monday to Friday, with some overlap with United Kingdom business hours

Experience Required: Minimum one year of Amazon online arbitrage experience



About the Role



I run a growing Amazon business focused exclusively on online arbitrage for the United Kingdom marketplace. I am seeking an experienced product research and sourcing virtual assistant to join the business on a full-time, long-term basis.



This role is suited to individuals who are already confident sourcing profitable products from online retail websites and analysing them accurately for resale on Amazon. You should be comfortable working independently, following structured processes, and making informed sourcing decisions.



Successful applicants will progress through an interview stage to assess their understanding of the role and expectations, followed by a short practical sourcing test to evaluate real-world product research ability.



Key Responsibilities



• Research profitable products for resale on Amazon United Kingdom using online arbitrage methods

• Analyse products using SellerAmp, Keepa, and Amazon Seller Central

• Source products through ArbiSource (preferred) and manual research on retail websites

• Assess profitability, return on investment, margins, and Amazon fees, including value added tax

• Identify brand restrictions, intellectual property risks, and potential policy concerns

• Maintain accurate product research spreadsheets with clear calculations and notes

• Follow defined sourcing processes consistently and with attention to detail

Required Experience and Skills



You must have:



• At least one year of online arbitrage product sourcing experience

• Strong experience using SellerAmp and Keepa

• Experience sourcing products for the Amazon United Kingdom marketplace

• Solid understanding of brand restrictions and intellectual property risk on Amazon

• High attention to detail and strong numerical accuracy

• Clear written English and ability to follow structured instructions

• Reliable internet connection and ability to commit to forty hours per week



Preferred Experience (Not Required)



• Experience using ArbiSource

• Familiarity with a wide range of United Kingdom retail websites

• Ability to proactively identify and flag high-risk products or brands

• Interest in a stable, long-term working relationship



Performance Expectations and Professional Conduct



• Daily expectations will include consistent submission of high-quality product leads in line with defined sourcing criteria

• All information, tools, systems, and processes shared during this role are confidential and must not be used outside of this position



Tools and Software



• All necessary software and tools required to perform this role will be provided to successful applicants



Pay and Progression



• Monthly salary of 25,000 Philippine pesos

• Opportunity for performance-based bonuses

• Performance-based pay increases over time

• Long-term role available for candidates who demonstrate consistency, accuracy, and reliability

title: Social Media & YouTube Marketing Manager (Real Estate)
description:
We’re looking for a strategic Social Media & YouTube Marketing Manager, not just a content poster.



This is a long-term, full-time role for someone who understands brand building, YouTube growth, video strategy, ads, and AI-powered marketing—someone who can think ahead, analyze data, and help grow a recognizable real estate brand with minimal supervision.



This role is not task-based. You will own the marketing direction, especially for YouTube and social platforms.



CORE FOCUS AREAS (VERY IMPORTANT)

 - Brand Building – 60%

 - Video Editing & Content Execution – 30%

 - Other - 10%



PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES



1. YouTube

YouTube is our #1 growth channel.

You will be responsible for end-to-end YouTube management, including:



Long-form YouTube Content:

- Create high-converting thumbnails

- Write SEO-optimized titles, descriptions, and tags

- Use VidIQ for keyword research, optimization, and competitive analysis

- Upload, schedule, and publish videos

- Track performance, analytics, CTR, watch time, retention, and growth

- Continuously improve content based on data



YouTube Shorts:

- Repurpose long-form content into Shorts

- Edit, format, caption, and schedule Shorts

- Optimize hooks, pacing, and visuals for engagement



YouTube Ad

- Manage YouTube ad campaigns

- Support creative testing, hooks, thumbnails, and targeting

- Monitor performance and suggest improvements



2. Instagram &

You’ll manage and grow our presence across Meta platforms with a marketing-first mindset, not just posting.

- Create and edit Reels (intermediate level required)

- Design and schedule posts, carousels, and stories

- Write captions with strong hooks and CTAs

- Applicants must use Real Estate SMM

- Boost posts and manage sponsored content

- Handle Meta Ads at an intermediate level:

 · Campaign setup

 · Scheduling

 · Basic optimization and monitoring

- Ensure consistency in branding, tone, and visuals



3. Google Presence & Analytics

- Manage Google My Business:

 · Posts

 · Updates

 · Reviews

 · Products/services

- Monitor Google Analytics and performance data

- Track how content and traffic support brand visibility and lead generation



4. Marketing Manager Responsibilities

You are not just executing — you are thinking like a manager.

- Plan content calendars aligned with business goals

- Propose campaigns and growth ideas

- Analyze what’s working and what’s not

- Report insights clearly and simply

- Coordinate with leadership on strategy and priorities



5. AI & Innovation

We expect you to use AI intelligently, not blindly.

- Use tools like ChatGPT, Canva AI, AI video tools, etc.

- Speed up workflows while maintaining quality

- Suggest better systems, tools, and processes

- Stay updated on trends in AI, marketing, and content creation



BASIC REQUIREMENTS

- Minimum 2 years of experience in Social Media Marketing or Digital Marketing

- Real estate experience is a strong advantage

- Proven experience managing YouTube channels

- Strong understanding of branding and content strategy

- Intermediate video editing skills (Reels, Shorts)

- Intermediate experience with Meta Ads

- Comfortable working independently with minimal supervision

- Strong communication, organization, and time management skills



WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR

- Someone who thinks strategically

- Someone who understands YouTube as a growth engine

- Someone who cares about branding, consistency, and results

- Someone who takes ownership and doesn’t wait for instructions



- This role is not for beginners

- This role is not for task-only executors



COMPANY OVERVIEW

We are a BC, Canada–based real estate team focused on modern marketing, strong branding, and long-term growth. We value ownership, creativity, and people who think ahead.



HOW TO APPLY

To apply, please:

Send your resume / CV

Include portfolio links:

YouTube channels managed

Don't use "Rockstar VA" in your application. Read carefully again to find the correct term to use.

Thumbnails you’ve created

Reels / Shorts

Ads or campaigns you’ve worked on



We’re not looking for “just an SMM.”

We’re looking for someone who can build a brand and grow an audience.



 - IMPORTANT: SKILLS TEST / TRIAL TASK -

We’ve hired many SMMs before, and not everyone performs at the level they claim.

Because of this, we will hire based on performance, not interviews.

Shortlisted applicants will complete a practical test.

The fastest and highest-quality submission will be hired.

title: Capcut Video Editor
description:
Looking for full time work for a Capcut / TikTok editor



You will be editing and making AI videos using AI tools like Veo3, Heygen, ElevenLabs, and Gemini. You will be generating B-roll video clips / AI characters talking and editing them in Capcut.



You will be trained extensively on how to do it, previous experience using CapCut is required, it's also preferred that you have past experience with HeyGen and Veo3 but not necessary. You'll be trained on how to generate Audio on elevenlabs, generate images/b rolls in Gemini/Veo3, using HeyGen to create talking AI avatars and editing through Capcut.



IMPORTANT:



Re-create this video using the following services and attach to your application:





1. Create an image similar/the same to the one in the video attached above in Google Gemini (this is free)



2. Download the transcript from the video with this tool: www.submagic.co/tools/tiktok-transcript-generator



3. Create a free ElevenLabs account and run the script through ElevenLabs. Ensure the audio sounds realistic to the speaker's voice in the image you generated. Download the MP3.



4. Create a free HeyGen account. Using HeyGen, upload the MP3 as well as your image to generate the video.

Download the final file, add captions, text hooks, add B-rolls/Images to the video just like in the viral video using Capcut.

(Look for B rolls, Images, Videos on google/youtube)





Please attach these things in your application:

1. The google drive link to your Final recreate Assignment (Make sure the google link is PUBLIC)

2. Your Portfolio showing your Past work with Veo3/HeyGen if you have any.



If your Application does NOT have the Final Recreate assignment of the any of the video above, your application will be IGNORED.



Requirements for the job:



- Attention to detail

- Quick learner and improve through constructive feedback

- Prioritizes High-quality work over speed

- Strong critical thinking and independent problem-solving

- STRONG English

- Strong internet connection

- Previous experience with Capcut / TikTok / Instagram

- Good working with a team

- Availability for 6-8h a day (never more, sometimes less)

- Able to work 5-6 days per week (can take days off whenever needed as long as mostly consistent)

- Can take payments through Wise

- PH or similar time zone



You'll be on a Paid Trial once you're selected.

When we think you fit the role, you'll be switched to Full time to work 40 Hours a week, 300$ per Month.

title: Senior Accountant
description:
A resume is required to be considered.

Must be available to work U.S. Pacific Standard Time (PST) hours.

The contract will be managed through Deel, and work will be tracked using Hubstaff.



Position Summary



The Senior Accountant will play a key role in overseeing day-to-day accounting operations, including sales audits, accounts receivable, cash applications, and inventory management. This role requires strong attention to detail, analytical skills, and extensive experience with Shopify and other eCommerce platforms. You will collaborate closely with Finance, Operations, and Customer Service teams to ensure financial accuracy and operational efficiency.



Key Responsibilities



Audit and reconcile sales transactions from Amazon, Shopify, and other eCommerce platforms; investigate and resolve variances or missing sales invoices.

Record and reconcile cash receipts from multiple payment platforms (Amazon, Shopify, Payoneer, PayPal, Stripe, etc.), ensuring proper matching to the general ledger (GL) and AR sub-ledger.

Manage and reconcile accounts receivable and cash clearing accounts, resolving discrepancies promptly.

Support monthly close activities, including journal entries, account reconciliations, and revenue recognition; maintain accurate documentation for audits and compliance.

Assist with inventory management by monitoring in-transit and prepaid inventory; partner with Operations and 3PL teams to resolve inventory and COGS variances.

Recommend and implement process improvements to streamline billing and reconciliation workflows.



Qualifications



Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.

3+ years of relevant accounting experience, preferably in eCommerce, retail, or consumer goods.

Strong Shopify eCommerce experience, including managing online storefronts, transaction reconciliation, and reporting.

Strong understanding of GAAP, revenue recognition, and AR best practices.

Proficiency with Amazon Seller Central, Shopify, and related transaction reporting.

Hands-on experience with ERP systems (e.g., NetSuite).

Strong Excel skills and familiarity with financial reporting tools.

Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

Ability to work independently in a remote, fast-paced environment.

High attention to detail and accuracy.



Preferred Qualifications



Experience reconciling multi-channel sales and payment gateways, and analyzing detailed transaction reports.

Prior involvement in system or process implementation projects.

Familiarity with sales tax, chargebacks, and refund processing.

title: NSA IDR Award Collections Specialist (Insurance Follow-Up & Medical Billing)
description:
An experienced insurance follow-up / medical billing professional who can confidently call U.S. insurance carriers/TPAs, navigate their systems, and consistently get unpaid No Surprises Act (NSA) IDR awards paid.



ob description* (paste this whole block)



We are hiring an NSA / No Surprises Act IDR Award Collections Specialist to collect unpaid Federal IDR awards by calling insurance carriers/TPAs and driving payment through to completion.



This is a phone-heavy role. You must speak fluent, professional English and be confident making outbound calls to U.S. insurance companies to get these claims/awards paid.



Core Responsibilities



Make high-volume outbound calls to insurance carriers/TPAs to collect unpaid NSA IDR awards and secure firm payment timelines.



Navigate payer departments effectively (claims, appeals/grievances, provider services/relations, escalations) and push files forward until paid.



Provide clear, professional English communication on every call; obtain reference numbers, call notes, supervisor names, and confirmed next steps.



Track each award from “award issued” ? “payment received,” including call logs, follow-up cadence, and documentation status.



Submit and follow up on required documentation (IDR award letter, dispute identifiers, claim details, payee/tax ID confirmation, etc.).



Identify and resolve common non-payment issues (no record found, misrouting, missing attachment, incorrect payee, EOB/ERA mismatch, reprocessing needed, system notes not updated).



Escalate appropriately when overdue (supervisor escalation, provider rep, written follow-up per our workflow) and keep management updated.



Required Experience



Strong U.S. medical billing / insurance collections / claims follow-up experience.



Fluent English (spoken and written) with a confident, professional phone presence.



Proven ability to call payers and get results (not just “status checks”).



Highly organized: able to manage many files, keep clean notes, and follow a process.



Familiarity with No Surprises Act / Federal IDR is required.



Success Metrics



Faster payment timelines and fewer stuck files.



Higher conversion rate of unpaid awards to paid.



Clean, audit-ready tracking and reliable weekly updates.



To apply, please include:



Your medical billing/collections background



NSA/IDR experience



A video of yourself speaking English and explaining the NSA IDR Process.



Which payers you’ve worked with most

title: Full-Stack Developer
description:
About the Role



We are building a custom internal operations platform to run a multi-service healthcare organization. The platform currently supports patient intake, authorization tracking, scheduling, staffing feasibility, QA workflows, and billing handoffs — and will continue to evolve as the company scales.



This is not a short-lived prototype and not a consumer product. It is an internal system designed to enforce workflows, prevent operational errors, and adapt as our services expand (home health, therapy, hospice, workforce development, etc.).



We already have a substantial codebase in place and are looking for a developer who can ship immediately, help us finish current priorities, and then continue building thoughtfully over time.



What You’ll Work On



Your work will span multiple phases, with priorities defined collaboratively and sequenced deliberately.



Near-Term (Current Priority)



Finalizing and enforcing scheduling logic (conflicts, capacity, overrides)



Implementing staffing feasibility gates



Authorization tracking with used/remaining visit logic



Stabilizing authentication and permissions



Hardening existing workflows so they are production-reliable



Medium-Term (As the Platform Evolves)



Communications integrations (SMS, telephony, fax)



Workflow automation and task generation



Clinician-facing tools (visit confirmation, completion, routing)



Billing and financial workflow support



Data extraction and intake automation



Reporting and operational intelligence



Long-Term (Vision-Aligned, Not Immediate)



Deeper AI-assisted workflows



Expanded workforce management features



Gradual reduction of dependency on off-the-shelf tools



Building a flexible, modular system that adapts as services and regulations change



You will not be expected to “build everything at once.” Work is intentionally phased.



How We Work



Founder defines workflows, priorities, and acceptance criteria



You help translate those into scalable, reliable systems



AI-assisted development is encouraged to accelerate delivery



Decisions are driven by operational impact, not novelty



We value correctness, enforcement, and adaptability over polish



This is a collaborative role where engineering judgment matters.



Required Skills



Full-stack JavaScript / TypeScript



Backend API development (Node.js or equivalent)



Modern frontend frameworks (React / Next.js or similar)



Database-backed systems (Postgres / MySQL)



Authentication and role-based permissions



Experience enforcing business rules and constraints



Comfortable working in and improving an existing codebase



Strongly Preferred



Experience building internal tools or admin platforms



Experience with scheduling, availability, or capacity logic



Experience integrating third-party APIs (SMS, telephony, webhooks)



Comfort using AI tools to accelerate development responsibly



Ability to think in systems, not just features



Healthcare experience is not required — strong engineering fundamentals matter more.



Engagement Details



Start as a contract role



Initial focus on current operational priorities



Potential for long-term collaboration if the fit is strong



Remote, flexible schedule



Clear priorities and scope defined per phase



Who This Role Is For



This role is a good fit if you:



Enjoy building systems that prevent mistakes, not just display data



Like working closely with a founder on real operational problems



Are comfortable shipping, refining, and iterating over time



Can balance speed with responsibility



Are excited by building a platform that grows with a business



How to Apply



Please include:



Examples of internal tools, workflow systems, or admin platforms you’ve built



An example of how you’ve enforced constraints or safeguards in a system



How you use AI in your development workflow

title: Post Production Specialist
description:
******TO BE CONSIDERED AS AN APPLICANT, PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR MOST UP-TO-DATE RESUME, PORTFOLIO AND A VIDEO INTRODUCTION TAILORED TO THIS JOB POSTING!******



Job Type: Full-Time

Work Hours: Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM CST, with a 1-hour break

Job Overview: 



We are seeking a detail-oriented Post Production Specialist to support our growing production team, with a strong focus on quality control and the review of already edited images. Collaborate closely with editors and internal tea
mbers to maintain workflow efficiency.

Qualifications: 



Solid understanding of the image editing and post-production process.

Strong attention to detail and a passion for quality control.

Ability to collaborate effectively in a remote, team-based environment.

Confident in providing feedback in a professional and constructive manner.

Highly organized, reliable, and responsible.

Exceptional attention to detail and ability to spot inconsistencies in photos.

Prior experience in post-production, image review, or quality assurance is strongly preferred.

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

title: Video Editor / Adobe After Effects

IF YOU HAVE A SLOW COMPUTER/BAD INTERNET. We will not move forward as we will ask for specs. Thank You

Staying up-to-date with current trends and incorporating them into editing styles.

title: Registered Structural Engineer
description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Structural Engineer to join our manufacturing team specializing in power distribution systems and modular homes. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in the design, analysis, and optimization of structural components and systems, ensuring compliance with safety standards, manufacturing capabilities, and client requirements.



Key Responsibilities

Design and Development:

Create and analyze structural designs for power distribution centers, motor control centers, and modular housing units.

Develop detailed technical drawings, 3D models, and structural specifications using CAD software.

Optimize designs for manufacturing efficiency and structural integrity while maintaining cost-effectiveness.

Structural Analysis:

Perform load calculations, stress analysis, and finite element analysis (FEA) to ensure structural stability and durability.

Assess materials and construction methods to meet safety standards and environmental regulations.

Project Collaboration:

Work closely with cross-functional teams, including electrical engineers, architects, and manufacturing personnel, to integrate structural solutions seamlessly.

Coordinate with suppliers and contractors to procure and verify materials and structural components.

Compliance and Quality Assurance:

Ensure designs meet local, national, and international building codes, as well as industry standards.

Conduct quality control inspections and audits during manufacturing and assembly processes.

Research and Development:

Stay updated on advancements in structural materials, construction techniques, and sustainable practices.

Innovate new designs and solutions to improve product performance and reduce environmental impact.

Qualifications

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Structural Engineering, Civil Engineering, or a related field (Master’s preferred).

Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in structural design, preferably in manufacturing, power systems, or modular housing industries.

Skills and Competencies:

Proficiency in structural analysis software (e.g., STAAD.Pro, SAP2000) and CAD tools (e.g., AutoCAD, SolidWorks, Revit).

Strong knowledge of construction materials, fabrication processes, and building codes (e.g., ASCE, AISC, or IBC standards).

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Certifications:

Professional Engineer (PE) license is preferred but not mandatory.

Additional certifications in structural design or green building practices (e.g., LEED) are a plus.

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):

Timely delivery of accurate and compliant structural designs.

Reduction in manufacturing defects or structural failures.

Positive feedback from clients and cross-functional teams on design collaboration.

title: Executive Assistant (EA) Sales Admin Pod Support
description:
Overview

We’re hiring a proactive high attention to detail Sales Admin / Executive Assistant to support a Sales Pod (multiple closers/setters/accounts) by acting as an operational “eagle eye.” This role exists to make sure nothing slips through the cracks across pre call prep, during call actions, post call admin and follow ups, data accuracy, and daily execution.

If you’re highly organized, process driven, comfortable working inside CRMs, have a knack for project management, and take pride in catching small details others miss, this role is for you.



Core Responsibilities

1. Pre Call SOP Compliance

Ensure closers followed pre call SOPs, including:

Reaching out prior to the call

Maintaining back and forth communication to humanize the process early if the prospect responded

Proper follow ups if the prospect dropped off or never responded

2. During Call SOP Enforcement

If a prospect does not join Zoom at the scheduled time, verify the closer:

Called at least 2x

Sent texts and
s

Took all reasonable actions to recover the call

3. Post Call Audits & PCN Audits

Ensure strong CRM hygiene after every call:

Deal moved to the correct pipeline stage

Notes updated clearly

Tasks added anytime a deal is not Closed Won or Closed Lost

PCNs (Post Call Notes) are:

Completed on time

Accurate

Honest (training provided on how to validate this)

If not honest/accurate call that out and flag down a higher up

4. Updates After Every Interaction

Confirm that after every interaction (unless Closed Won/Lost):

Notes are updated

Old tasks are cleared

New tasks are created

Pipeline stage is updated when appropriate

5. Pipeline Stage Management

Ensure setters and closers move prospects to the proper pipeline stage at all times, and after every interaction

6. Task Reviews

Review each rep’s tasks daily:

Identify overdue tasks

Ensure completion

Escalate patterns to managers

7. Unread Conversation Reviews

Audit unread conversations for setters and closers

Ensure conversations are responded to and cleared daily

8. Live Handoff QC

Verify proper handoffs when:

Calls run long

Double bookings occur

Ensure reps post in the correct handoff channel and request coverage

Ensure someone picks up that handoff

9. White Space SOP Enforcement

During no shows, cancels, or open calendar time, ensure closers are:

Calling/texting upcoming appointments to pull them forward

Working follow ups

Working tasks and smartlists

Calling no shows, cancels, applications, or leads

Validate productivity and activity during white space

If they’re not on a call they should be getting a call

10. Smartlist Management

Ensure setter and closer priority smartlists are worked and kept clear

11. Daily Calendar Availability Reporting

Review calendars daily

Report available slots for key calendars

12. PM / Chasing Items to Completion

Support closer and setter managers by:

Following up on assigned rep tasks

Helping unblock tech or ops issues

Looping in the right people

Ensuring requests are fully completed

When something or a group of things are missed those should be tracked for completion %s across the board and for each rep, and everything missing shouldn’t just be reported on 1 day, it should be rolled over into the next day and pursued aggressively until complete

13. Manager Reporting

Report risks, gaps, missed SOPs, and operational issues to:

Closer Managers

Setter Managers



Required Skills & Experience

Extremely high attention to detail

Strong organizational and time management skills

Comfortable working with:

CRMs (HubSpot, GHL, or similar)

Task systems

Calendars and call recordings

Ability to follow SOPs exactly

Clear written communication

Proactive mindset, you flag issues before being asked

When something feels off, or you feel there is a better, more efficient way to do something, speak up! You’re in a leadership role here that directly drives tons of extra revenue, you’re expected to act and move as such. No ego here, but we want to work with winners.

Strongly Preferred:

Prior experience supporting sales teams or info sales environments

Experience with sales ops, QA, EA, or admin support



Working Style Expectations

You check work carefully, accuracy matters more than speed

You don’t wait to be told when something looks wrong

You’re comfortable enforcing standards and reporting gaps

You enjoy bringing order to chaos



Location & Availability

Full time availability aligned with US business hours (exact schedule to be discussed)

If it’s found out that the ball is being dropped or it’s suspected you’re working multiple gigs you will be let go.



Compensation

$1,000 USD per month



IMPORTANT APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (REQUIRED)

To be considered, you must complete the application task below. Applications without this will not be reviewed. Submit all information below to 

Application Task:



1. DISC Personality Assessment

Complete a free DISC assessment at the link below:


/disc-personality-test

Submission Requirements:

Upload or attach a screenshot or PDF of your final DISC results

Do not summarize submit the actual results



2. Loom Video (2-5 Minutes)

Record a Loom video covering all of the topics below.

Your Loom must cover:

Your prior sales admin / sales ops experience

Info sales offers you’ve supported (setters, closers, pods, CRMs used)

Specific examples where you demonstrated:

High attention to detail

Proactivity (spotting issues before being asked)

Holding reps accountable to SOPs

How you are comfortable communicating up:

Flagging issues to managers or leadership

Escalating patterns or risks clearly and professionally



Submit all information below to

Position Type: Part-time to start, with the possibility of expanding to a full-time role.

Work Hours: Flexible, depending on workload and business needs.

If you’re organized, a strong English communicator, and experienced in the tools we use, we’d love to hear from you!



How to Apply:

Please submit your resume along with a brief introduction about your experience with the listed tools and how you approach client interactions and task management.

title: A+ Player: Media Buyer/Video Editor (Google/Meta)
description:
Please read the WHOLE post & if you think you're a fit - send us a message showing us you read it without using AI.

We pay above market, so read the whole thing and do not use AI. 



**Bulldogs Core Philosophy**

- Simple Scales, Complex Fails

- Build The People & The People Build The Business

- Be The Example



This role is designed for an experienced, results-driven media buyer and video editor who can own paid acquisition from setup to optimization across
 Ads and Google Ads - while also producing high-quality video content that drives ad performance. The ideal candidate will work closely with the CEO to build out ad accounts, landing pages, video ad creatives, and full campaign infrastructure - then manage performance on an ongoing basis.



We hire for the "Soul" and train for the "Role".



---



**Primary Responsibilities**



**Ad Account Setup & Campaign Management**

- Build out
 Business Manager and Google Ads accounts from scratch

- Create campaign structures, ad sets/ad groups, audiences, and conversion tracking (Pixel, CAPI, Google Tag Manager, etc.).

- Develop and launch campaigns aligned with lead generation and data monetization objectives.

- Manage daily budgets, bid strategies, and pacing across platforms.



**Landing Page Development**

- Design, build, and optimize landing pages for paid traffic using tools such as GoHighLevel or similar.

- Implement A/B testing on headlines, CTAs, form fields, and page layouts.

- Ensure landing pages are mobile-responsive, fast-loading, and compliant with platform ad policies.



**Video Editing & Ad Creative Production**

- Edit and produce short-form video ads optimized for
, Instagram, YouTube, and TikTok placements.

- Create multiple variations of video creatives for A/B testing (hooks, CTAs, lengths, formats).

- Work with raw footage, screen recordings, stock video, and AI-generated content to produce polished ad creatives.

- Add captions/subtitles, motion graphics, text overlays, and branded elements to video content.

- Repurpose long-form content (webinars, interviews, walkthroughs) into short-form ad clips and social content.

- Understand platform-specific video specs (aspect ratios, durations, safe zones) and optimize accordingly.

- Maintain an organized library of video assets, templates, and brand elements for rapid creative iteration.



**Tracking, Analytics & Reporting**

- Set up end-to-end conversion tracking including UTM parameters, pixel events, and offline conversion imports.

- Deliver weekly performance reports with clear insights and recommended next steps.

- Monitor KPIs: CPL, CPA, CTR, ROAS, and lead quality metrics.

- Track creative performance to identify which video styles, hooks, and formats drive the best results.



**Creative & Copy Support**

- Write or brief ad copy and creative variations for testing.

- Coordinate with designers or use Canva/similar tools for ad creative production.

- Stay current on platform policy changes, algorithm updates, and creative best practices.

- Research trending ad formats and video styles across platforms to keep creative fresh and competitive.



**Process Improvement & SOP Development**

- Document campaign and video production workflows and standard operating procedures using Loom (video-based SOPs) or similar tools.

- Identify inefficiencies in the ad-to-lead pipeline and creative production process, and suggest automation or workflow improvements.

- Show us you read up until here - prepare a message with the words "I am a superstar".



**Client & Vendor Coordination**

- Communicate with internal tea
mbers to ensure smooth integration.

- Attend key calls, document takeaways, and ensure follow-ups are logged and executed.



---



**Ideal Candidate Profile**

- **Proven Media Buying Experience:** Minimum 2 years running
 and/or Google Ads campaigns with demonstrable results in lead generation.

- **Skilled Video Editor:** You can take raw footage and turn it into scroll-stopping ad creatives quickly and efficiently. You have an eye for pacing, hooks, and what makes people stop scrolling.

- **Full-Funnel Thinker:** You don't just launch ads - you understand the entire journey from click to conversion and optimize accordingly.

- **Landing Page Capable:** Comfortable building and iterating on landing pages without needing a developer.

- **Data-Driven:** You make decisions based on numbers, not gut feelings. Comfortable pulling reports and pivoting strategy based on performance.

- **Self-Starter & Problem-Solver:** Can proactively identify what's underperforming and take action without excessive hand-holding.

- **Strong Communication Skills:** Ability to work with executives, vendors, and clients professionally.

- **Flexible & Adaptable:** When a platform changes its rules overnight, you adjust and keep moving. Willingness to learn, take ownership, and operate in a fast-paced environment.

- **See the Big Picture:** You connect daily campaign optimizations to long-term company growth objectives.

- **Deliver with Urgency:** You bring focus and energy to hit launch dates and performance targets.



---



**Preferred Experience & Tools**

- **Ad Platforms:**
 Ads Manager, Google Ads, TikTok Ads (bonus)

- **Video Editing:** CapCut, Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, DaVinci Resolve, or Final Cut Pro

- **Motion Graphics & Design:** Canva, Figma, or basic Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator)

- **Landing Pages:** GoHighLevel, ClickFunnels, Unbounce, WordPress/Elementor, Leadpages

- **Tracking & Analytics:** Google Analytics (GA4), Google Tag Manager,
 Pixel/CAPI, Hyros or similar attribution tools

- **CRM & Automation:** GoHighLevel, HubSpot, Zapier, API integrations

- **Collaboration:** Slack,
, Zoom, Loom



---



**Position Type & Availability**

- Part-Time & Gig to start with potential to grow into a larger role as volume scales.

- Must be available to work within U.S. Eastern Time (EST) for check-ins and collaboration windows.

- Remote position with regular communication cadence and real-time responsiveness expected.



---



**Why This Role Matters**



The company is in a growth phase, and this role is critical to building out a paid acquisition engine that generates high-quality leads at scale. We're not looking for someone who just "boosts posts" or slaps text on stock footage - we want a strategic operator who builds campaigns with intention, produces creative that converts, tests relentlessly, and treats our ad spend like it's their own money. Show me you read the entire description - continue your message to us with the words "details count". High attention to detail and accuracy will impress us.



This is an opportunity to be part of something exciting, have a direct impact on revenue, and grow alongside the business.



---



**Things we look for when evaluating candidates:**

- Fast response times

- Detail-oriented

- Follows instructions

- No need to chase

- Owns their teeth (takes ownership of their role)

- Competent

- Honest

- Smart

- Spelling / Grammar

- Good natured

- Responds to
s after hours

- Goes over and above to learn / grow

- An autodidact that can handle self-learning projects

title: Talent Sourcing Specialist
description:
Job Overview:

Proactively source suitably skilled candidates for vacant positions with our Clients.

Working closely with Australian Recruitment Teams to screen and vet candidates and arrange all compliance requirements with candidates. 

Maintain Candidate Database.



Daily Responsibilities:

Your daily responsibilities would include:

• Manage a high-volume of incoming temp job orders from Local and State Governments across Australia. Roles are varied with both industrial and commercial positions.

• Create and post vacancy adverts that attract the right people.

• Source, search, screen, and onboard candidates quickly and effectively against vacancies and submit to Australian Recruitment teams and Clients.

• Build and maintain a talent pool of job-ready workers across key skill areas.

• Liaise daily with Australian Team to fill urgent vacancies, manage client expectations, and provide exceptional service.

• Maintain accurate data within the CRM and candidate management systems.

• Provide a daily report on activity and tasks completed.



To qualify for the position, you will ideally be able to demonstrate a working knowledge of: 

• Previous experience in temp recruitment or a fast-paced recruitment environment.

• Experience using Seek talent search. Linkedin and Boolean searches.

• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills – able to build trust quickly with both clients and candidates.

• Strong organisational and time management skills – thrives under pressure and adapts easily to change.

• Knowledge of Australian Workplace, and onboarding requirements is desirable.

• Resilient, proactive, and service-focused attitude.



Perks & Benefits: 

Once you have completed 6 months probation you will get;

- 13 month bonus

- Access to individual commission plan



Work schedule & holidays;

This is a full-time Contactor Position



Hours of Work;

Required work hours are Mondays to Friday 8am To 5pm with 1 hour lunch break. Some flexibility will be available on working hours.

Annual Leave:

You will accrue 12 annual leave days per year

Sick Leave;

You will accrue 10 sick leave days per year

Public Holidays

Will be offered as per Australian Calendar. 10 Days per year. Happy to discuss a few swaps of Filipino holidays based on timing and Business needs

title: Medical Sales Specialist (US-Based Clinic) – High Ticket Sales
description:
We are a US-based medical company specializing in regenerative medicine and optimization. We don't need appointment setters; we need closers who can speak intelligently about medical procedures to American patients. You will be the voice of our clinic, handling bookings and sales for high-value treatments including StemWave, Hormone Optimization, and Medical Weight Loss.



Who You Are:

- Impeccable English: You speak with a neutral or American accent. You understand American cultural nuances and idioms.

- Medical Background (Preferred): You have experience in a medical setting (RN, PT, Medical VA) and understand terminology related to pain management, endocrinology, or aesthetics.

- Sales Shark: You are comfortable on the phone, handle objections with ease, and know how to guide a patient from "interested" to "paid/booked."

- Tech Savvy: You can navigate CRM software (GoHighLevel experience is a major bonus) while on a call.



The Role:

- Inbound/Outbound Sales: Manage leads for StemWave therapy, TRT/Hormone Optimization, and Weight Loss programs.

- Consultative Selling: Educate patients on the benefits of our treatments (we provide training, but you need the foundational knowledge).

- Calendar Management: Qualify patients and book them directly into provider schedules.

- Follow-Up: relentless follow-up on warm leads to maximize conversion.



Requirements

- Reliable high-speed internet and a noise-canceling headset.

- Minimal distracting background noises



Ability to work US Time Zones (PST).



Voice recording required for application.



How To Apply

#1 - Send a message with the subject line: "Medical Sales - [Your Name]"



#2 - Include a link to a 60-second voice recording introducing yourself and selling me on why I should hire you. Applications without a voice recording will be ignored. We recommend: 



#3 - List your relevant medical or sales experience in 3 bullet points.



Compensation: Let us know your preference

title: Community Manager — Creative & Highly Organized (Instagram Primary + TikTok Secondary)
description:
We are looking for a creative and highly organized freelance Community Manager to manage and grow our presence on Instagram (main platform) and TikTok (secondary).

We are a French brand, and if the collaboration goes well, you may also be asked to work on other brands in our portfolio in the future.



Very important: we are a French brand and our audience is primarily French-speaking. This means you must be comfortable writing posts, captions, and stories in French, as well as handling French comments and DMs—including translating when needed and replying naturally in a professional, on-brand tone (AI tools can help when appropriate).



Non-negotiable: you must respect our brand identity 100% (visual direction, tone of voice, values, style).



Key Responsibilities



1) Content Creation (Top Priority)

 • Create image content: posts, carousels, static visuals

 • Create video content: Reels (TikTok as secondary)



 • Deliver a varied content mix, including:

 • educational / informative content

 • customer testimonials / social proof

 • high-end brand content with strong visual direction (DA)

 • short, engaging formats designed to drive interaction



2) Planning & Content Calendar

 • Provide a weekly content calendar for approval

 • Posting rhythm: 3–4 posts per week

 • Plus: minimum 1 story per day

 • Plan themes, propose ideas, and maintain a consistent, cohesive feed



3) Community Management

 • Reply to comments and DMs (mostly in French)

 • Translate messages when needed and answer in a natural, on-brand way

 • Engage and animate the community (interactive stories, polls, Q&A, etc.)

 • Goal: build an active community and improve engagement



Required Skills & Profile

 • Proven experience as a Community Manager (Instagram first)

 • Strong visual skills and attention to detail (clean, consistent, on-brand design)

 • Ability to follow brand guidelines strictly and replicate a brand identity perfectly

 • Organized, proactive, autonomous, reliable (you deliver on time, every week)

 • Comfortable with creation/editing tools (e.g., Canva / Adobe / CapCut, etc.)

 • Strong writing skills + ability to adapt to our brand voice



AI Tools Requirement (Mandatory)



You must be comfortable using AI tools, including:

 • ChatGPT (especially for translating French comments/DMs and drafting replies)

 • NanoBanana (subscription provided) to generate custom, product-specific, brand-consistent visuals/content tailored to our needs



Deliverables

 • Weekly content calendar (posts + stories) submitted in advance for validation

 • Ready-to-publish assets (IG formats + variations when needed)

 • Community management (comments + DMs) handled consistently

 • Simple weekly recap (what worked, what didn’t, next improvements)



How to Apply



Please send:

 1. Your portfolio (posts/carousels + Reels/TikTok if possible)

 2. 2–3 Instagram accounts you’ve managed (or relevant examples)

 3. A short note: how do you ensure 100% brand consistency in visuals and tone?



Important: Applicants who cannot strictly follow an established brand identity will not be considered.

title: CREATIVE STRATEGIST (META ADS) — VIDEO AD SCRIPTS
description:
ABOUT



We produce creatives designed to run on Meta 
/Instagram) with one clear goal: maximize conversions through a structured, varied, and iterative creative strategy.



You will write scripts for the brands we brief you on (the number of brands can scale significantly over time).



?



MAIN MISSION



We’re looking for a Creative Strategist who can write 5 scripts per day, intended to be turned into video ads and tested on Meta.



You’re not “just writing scripts”: you must think in terms of the overall coherence of a batch (a set of creatives), a long-term vision, varied angles, and a testing logic aligned with how Meta’s algorithm (Andromeda) works.



?



COLLABORATION & COMMUNICATION (CRITICAL)



• You will work closely with our video editor to reduce back-and-forth. If a script requires a specific intent (pace, shots, editing, structure), you must be able to explain it clearly and directly.

• This role requires excellent communication: you’ll collaborate effectively with the team and indirectly drive the creative production (project-lead mindset).



?



MEETINGS & PROCESS



• There will be many meetings with the team (creative follow-up, feedback, iterations).

• Weekly CEO briefing: you will most likely need to submit a creative plan for the upcoming week (angles, formats, funnel, volume) for approval.

• We will also share Meta metrics / performance feedback so you know where we stand, what’s working, and what needs to change.



?



DAILY DELIVERABLES



You must deliver 5 scripts/day, designed as a complementary batch (not 5 versions of the same thing).



Variety expected in a batch



You must be able to propose and rotate:

• Formats: UGC, testimonial, before/after, “pro edit”, product demo, explainer, VSL (Video Sales Letter), etc.

• Funnel: ToF / MoF / BoF (Top/Middle/Bottom of Funnel).

• Awareness levels (logical progression):

–  Unaware (the customer doesn’t know they have a problem)

–  Problem-aware (they feel the problem)

–  Solution-aware (they know solutions exist)

–  Product-aware (they know the product/category)

–  Most aware (ready to buy: offers, proof, urgency, guarantee)

• Ad frameworks: AIDA, PAS, Problem/Solution, Storytelling, objection-handling, etc.

• Varied lengths: e.g., 15–30s, 45–60s, 90s, 2 min (depending on needs and funnel stage)



Example batch balance (indicative)



• 1 UGC ~30s (ToF / Problem-aware)

• 1 testimonial ~45–60s (MoF / Solution-aware)

• 1 before/after ~15–20s (ToF or MoF depending on angle)

• 1 explainer ~90s–2min (MoF / Product-aware)

• 1 VSL / offer-driven (BoF / Most aware)



?



REQUIRED SKILLS



You must be able to:

• Write performance-driven scripts: hook, flow, proof, objections, CTA.

• Propose different marketing angles day-to-day to test multiple audiences.

• Understand key Meta creative dynamics: creative fatigue, variations, iteration, angle differentiation, testing logic.

• Work with an “Andromeda-ready” mindset: complementary, non-repetitive creatives (do not deliver 5 scripts with the same format/length/angle).



?



RESEARCH & INSPIRATION (REQUIRED)



You must also be able to:

• Research competitor ads / trending e-commerce brands.

• Identify what works (hook, angle, structure, pacing) and adapt those mechanics to our brands (no copy-paste).

• Deeply understand our products and uncover real customer needs through “field research” in our niches:
 groups, TikTok comments, Reddit threads, customer reviews, forums, etc.



?



DELIVERABLE FORMAT



Scripts must be clear and directly usable by a creative/editing team.



Each script should ideally include:

• Format (UGC, VSL, testimonial, etc.)

• Funnel stage (ToF / MoF / BoF) + awareness level

• Target length

• Hook (0–3s)

• Voice-over text (or on-screen text if applicable)

• Structure/pacing (editing intent: cuts, b-roll, before/after, proof, etc.)

• CTA (soft vs. hard depending on funnel & awareness)



?



LANGUAGE



• Scripts in French.

• English and/or German may be needed depending on future requirements (optional but appreciated).



?



ORGANIZATION & DEADLINE



• Daily deadline: 2:00 PM (French time).

• Consistent work with daily output.

• Adjustments and iterations based on feedback and performance.



?



COMPENSATION



• Monthly fixed pay: $200

• Variable: $1 per script (delivered and approved)

• Current volume: 5 scripts/day ? 150 scripts/month

? Approx. $350/month ($200 + $150 if 30 days)

• Volume may increase over time: compensation increases automatically ($200 + $1 per script).



?



IDEAL PROFILE



• Fast, structured, conversion-focused.

• Able to write short, punchy, no fluff.

• Comfortable with creative analysis and Meta testing logic.

• Excellent communicator, able to manage a creative vision and clearly transmit it to the team (project-lead mindset).
